content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Total Receivables Life Insurance Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of loans classified as assets, plus income accrued but not received in relation to this asset. This method of disclosure differs from the Australian Accounting Standards. Loans include, but are not limited to, financial leases and mortgages. Loans differ from interest bearing securities as usually the asset is non negotiable (i.e. able to be traded on a secondary market).
content.name: Assets Loans Plus Accrued Income Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used. It is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to other assets, after adjusting for derivatives. 

An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the all counterparties. 

On-balance sheet refers to those assets, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Exposures Other Adjusted For Derivatives Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to indexed interest bearing securities, after adjusting for derivatives. 

Indexed securities pay an income stream that is dependent upon any external factor. 

Interest bearing securities are debt securities paying an income stream based upon an interest rate consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for investment securities in accordance with the accounting standards. 

An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties. 

On-balance sheet refers to those assets, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Exposures Indexed Interest Bearing Securities Adjusted For Derivatives Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to loans (including any accrued interest), after adjusting for derivatives. 

An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties. 

On-balance sheet refers to those assets, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Exposures Loans Adjusted For Derivatives Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of counterparty exposures to receivables, after adjusting for derivatives. 

An exposure to a counterparty or a group of related counterparties is the aggregate of all claims, commitments arising from on-balance sheet transactions with the counterparty or group of related counterparties. 

On-balance sheet refers to those assets, or exposure items, which are recognised or recorded on the statement of financial position of the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Exposures Receivables Adjusted For Derivatives Amount

content.definition:
Report the value of negotiable certificates of deposit issued by the reporting party as at the reporting date. 
Negotiable Certificates of Deposit are tradeable certificates issued by a bank or other financial institution that indicate a specified sum of money has been deposited at the issuing depository institution and will be redeemable from that institution on maturity by the holder.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Certificates Of Deposit Total Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of holdings of property acquired or held which is available for sale, excluding owner-occupied property. 

Report the value after deducting accumulated depreciation. 

Investment property should be consistent with the classification and measurement basis used in the relevant accounting standard.
content.name: Assets Property Plant And Equipment Plus Accrued Income Amount

content.definition: This is the balancing item in the list in which it is being used. This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non-reinsurance receivables other than premiums, non-reinsurance recoveries and current tax assets.
content.name: Assets Receivables Not Premiums Not Non Reinsurance Not Tax Assets Current Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the cumulative life to date gains in the unrealised asset value.
content.guidance: For the purposes of this item include the unrealised gains on derivative liabilities.
content.name: Assets Unrealised Gains Including Derivative Liabilities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, at the relevant date, of all financial assets as defined in relevant accounting standards. For the purposes of this item, exclude derivatives.
content.name: Assets Financial Excluding Derivatives Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any surplus/deficit of deferred tax assets (DTA) over deferred tax liabilities (DTL). DTA and DTL are determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards; the netting of these items is in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Surplus Deficit Deferred Tax Assets Over Liabilities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of tax benefits arising from the application of asset risk stresses. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Tax Benefits Asset Risk Stresses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all tax benefits arising from the application of insurance risk stresses. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Tax Benefits Insurance Risk Stresses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of assets transferred between different Fair Value Hierarchy Levels, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Transfers Between Hierarchy Level Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the aggregate of the risk charge components resulting from the application of the asset risk stress scenarios, allowing for the likelihood of the scenarios occurring simultaneously. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Aggregated Risk Charge Components Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date of the impact of diversification, calculated as the difference between the sum of the individual risk charge components used in calculating the aggregated risk charge component less the aggregated risk charge component. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Aggregated Risk Charge Diversification Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the trade exposures for exchange traded and centrally cleared OTC derivatives. This item is calculated in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Central Counterparty Trade Exposure Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the capital charge applied to the credit value adjustment (CVA) risk. This is the difference between the risk-free portfolio value and the true portfolio value that takes into account the possibility of a counterparty's default. It is calculated in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Value Adjustment Capital Charge Amount

content.definition: The reporting entity must identify the calculation approach used in determining the credit value adjustment (CVA) risk capital charge.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Value Adjustment Calculating Approach Risk Charge Text

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of paid-up ordinary share capital issued by the reporting entity and determined in accordance the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Paid Up Ordinary Share Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of paid-up ordinary share capital; or, instruments with the characteristics of ordinary shares instruments issued by the reporting entity that satisfy - as determined by APRA - the eligibility criteria of the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Paid Up Ordinary Share Capital Other Qualifying Instruments Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the upfront fee income component of the current year profits (or losses), as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Equity Current Year Earnings Upfront Fee Income Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date of minority interests (as defined in accordance to relevant accounting standards) arising from the issue of ordinary shares by fully consolidated Authorised Deposit-taking institutions or overseas equivalents held by third parties. This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined as per relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Equity Minority Interests Fully Consolidated ADI Or Overseas Equivalent Amount
Equity Movements Dividends Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of accumulated other comprehensive income and other disclosed reserves, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Accumulated Comprehensive Income And Other Disclosed Reserves Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any accumulated other comprehensive income and other disclosed reserves specified by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Accumulated Comprehensive Income Other Reserves Disclosed Other APRA Specified Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the balance of the reserve relating to the revaluation of property, as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Property Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reserve relating to exchange rate differences arising on a monetary item that forms part of a reporting entity's net investment in a foreign operation in accordance with Australian accounting standards. For the purposes of this item, exclude unrealised gains and losses from a foreign currency hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation.
content.name: Equity Reserves Foreign Currency Translation Reserve Excluding Unrealised Gains Losses FX Hedge Investment For Operation Amount

content.definition: This is the value, at the relevant date, of the reserve in relation to the effective portion of the gain or loss on the cash flow hedging instrument as determined in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Gains Or Losses Cash Flow Hedges Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the equity settled share based payment reserve amounts in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards. For the purposes of this item include only payments granted to employees as part of their remuneration package.
content.name: Equity Reserves Share Based Payments Reserve Employee Remuneration Package Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the unrealised fair value gain or loss of a hedging instrument that is determined to be an effective hedge of the net investment in a foreign operation, in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Unrealised Gains Losses Foreign Currency Hedge Investment Foreign Operation Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for claims expense (including current year bonus). That is claims against policies for which the reporting entity has accepted the liability from another insurer or reinsurer. Include bonuses paid to the insurer or reinsurer as a distribution of current year profit.
content.name: Expense Insurance Claim Inwards Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for benefits paid or payable as withdrawal of any deposit elements.
content.name: Expense Insurance Claim Inwards Deposit Component Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of total claim payments to meet liabilities to policy owners.
content.name: Expense Insurance Claim Payments Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the movement in the unallocated surplus classified as net policy liabilities that relates only to the current year profits. This unallocated surplus relates to all other unallocated surpluses that have not been included as unallocated benefit fund reserves in balance sheet.
content.name: Expense Insurance Net Policy Liability Movement Unallocated Surplus Classified Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total policy expenses recognised as a withdrawal of the deposit (investment) component or change in policy liability.
content.name: Expense Insurance Policy Total Deposit Component Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of benefits paid or payable as withdrawal of deposit elements for claims on life investment business.
content.name: Expense Insurance Total Claims Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for insurance policy expenses. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Insurance Policy Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for the relevant period, of any underwriting expenses. This item is determined in accordance with the relevant Accounting Standards. 

Underwriting expenses includes:

- acquisition costs and the results of liability adequacy tests;

- levies and charges; and

- commission expense (and commission revenue reported as negative). 

Acquisition costs are incurred in obtaining and recording insurance contracts. They include commission or brokerage paid to agent or brokers for obtaining business for the insurer, selling and underwriting costs such as advertising and risk assessment, the administrative costs of recording policy information and premium collection costs.

Liability adequacy test means an assessment of whether the carrying amount of an insurance liability needs to be increased (or the carrying amount of the related deferred acquisition costs or related intangible assets decreased) based on a review of future cash flows.
content.name: Expense Insurance Underwriting Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of depreciation charged to profit and loss in respect of tangible assets as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Depreciation Tangible Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of all fixed and variable costs as recognised under Australian Accounting Standards incurred when acquiring new business including those related to commissions and other incremental expenses.
content.name: Expense Operating Policy Acquisition Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of all fixed and variable costs as recognised under Australian Accounting Standards incurred when maintaining new business including those related to commissions and other incremental expenses.
content.name: Expense Operating Policy Maintenance Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of commission and other incremental acquisition costs. They include commission or brokerage paid to agents or brokers for obtaining business for the reporting entity, and variable costs directly related to acquiring the new business that would not have been incurred if the new business were not acquired.
content.name: Expense Operating Total Acquisition Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period in accordance with the relevant accounting standards total other expenses including:-
:-value of investment expenses incurred on assets backing insurance liabilities
:-losses on foreign exchange separate for each region
:-expenses incurred for the period in relation to financing
:-defined benefit actuarial losses
:-any other operating expenses
:-loss on the measurement of a non-current asset (or disposal group) classified as held for sale that does not meet the definition of a discontinued operation.
content.name: Expense Operating Total Other Expenses Amount

content.definition:
Report the value of deposits held by the reporting party as at the reporting date, which are classified as Retirement Savings Accounts. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards. 
Retirement Savings Accounts (RSA) are approved accounts, in accordance with the Retirement Savings Accounts Act 1997, offered by banks, building societies, credit unions, life insurance companies and prescribed financial institutions (RSA providers). They are products specifically used to accumulate retirement savings, similar to a superannuation fund. Amounts placed in these accounts cannot be withdrawn until specific criteria have been met.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Retirement Saving Accounts Amount

content.definition: This is the end date of the catastrophe reinsurance program.
content.name: Financial Risk Catastrophe Reinsurance End Date

content.definition: This is the commencement date of the catastrophe reinsurance program.
content.name: Financial Risk Catastrophe Reinsurance Start Date

content.definition: Is the adjustment and exclusion approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority for transitional purposes?
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values.

true = The adjustment and exclusion approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority is transitional.

false = The adjustment and exclusion approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority is not transitional.
content.name: Financial Risk Adjustment And Exclusion Status Indicator

content.definition: The basis used for determination as at the relevant date.
content.guidance:
Valid values are:
Gross = The basis used to calculate the reported information was gross of reinsurance recoveries. 
Net = The basis used to calculate the reported information was net of reinsurance recoveries.
content.name: Financial Risk Determination Basis Code

content.definition: This is the rating grade, as at the relevant date, of the collateralised or guaranteed counterparty exposure, set according to the long-term and short-term credit rating grades of the counterparty as determined by various rating agencies.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Counterparty Rating After Collateral Guarantee Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for unfunded default fund contribution with this central counterparty. This equates to the clearing member's proportionate liability for default fund calls (i.e. unfunded default fund commitment). It is calculated in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Financial Risk Management Capital Unfunded Default Fund Contribution Amount

content.definition:
This is the value as at the relevant date, of reinsurance recoverables in relation to reinsurance contracts net of provisions for doubtful debts, for both paid and outstanding claims against the reporting entity where the reinsurer providing the reinsurance contract has not complied with the governing law requirements set out in the relevant prudential standard.                                                                                                                                                       

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting entity under a reinsurance arrangement that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with capital and prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Insurance Reinsurance Recoverables Paid Outstanding Claims Not Meet Gov Law Net Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.                                                                           

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any asset recognised by the reporting party that relates to reinsurance,  where the reinsurer has not complied with the governing law requirements set out in the relevant prudential standards, other than those relating to:                                                                             

Reinsurance recoverables, being any amounts due to the reporting party under a reinsurance arrangement that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with capital and prudential standards;                                                                                                                                                    - Expected Reinsurance and Non Reinsurance Recoveries, being any amounts due to the reporting party, whether under a reinsurance arrangement or not, that arise from the recognition of Premiums Liabilities in accordance with capital and prudential standards; or                                                                                                                                                    - Deferred Reinsurance Expense, as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Insurance Reinsurance Other Not Meet Gov Law Amount

content.definition: This is the value for the duration of the relevant period of dividends declared or paid (distributions) out of profits to the shareholders of a company in proportion to their holdings of a particular class of capital.
content.name: Equity Dividends Paid Or Declared Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the cumulative life to date unrealised losses on financial assets including derivatives liabilities.
content.name: Assets Unrealised Losses Including Derivative Liabilities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the total of all contractual regular contributions. These are the total gross premiums that are accepted through direct debit, have a specific contractual requirement for future on-going premiums, have an expectation of renewal each year (e.g. Yearly Renewable term products) or generally cause a policy to discontinue on cessation of future payment.
content.name: Assets Insurance Contractual Regular Contributions Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for future benefit policies. Where projection techniques are used, report the net present value. For participating benefits, this includes past declared bonuses only. Current reporting period bonuses are excluded as per prudential standards. For non-participating benefits with an entitlement to discretionary additions, the cost of the current year discretionary additions should be included. Where projection techniques are not used, report the policy liability before deducting the value of deferred acquisition expenses.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Future Policy Benefits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for future policy expenses where projection techniques are used, report the net present value, where projection techniques are not used, report nil.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Future Policy Expenses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for future premiums where projection techniques are used, report the component of the best estimate liability relating to the net present value of future policy premiums. Where projection techniques are not used, report nil.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Future Policy Premiums Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reduction in policy liabilities in respect of unrecouped acquisition expenses. Where projection techniques are used, report nil.

Where projection techniques are not used, report the component of the policy liability relating to the value of the unrecouped (deferred) acquisition expenses.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Reduction In Policy Liability Due To Deferred Acquisition Cost Recovery Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for future profits from policy owner bonuses report the net present value of the policy in relation to future profits for participating business. Current year bonuses are excluded.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Participating Business Future Profits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the fair value of the contractual obligation in relation to the deposit (investment) component of insurance policies in force as at the reporting date.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Investment Contract Deposit Component Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of credit-related provisions for impairment. This represents provisions on credit exposures and includes both specific provisions and the amount in the general reserve for credit losses. This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting and prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Provisions Impairment Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any partial write-offs of assets that form part of the reporting party's total eligible provisions. This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Write Off Partial Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of discounts on assets that form part of the reporting party's total eligible provisions. This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Assets Discounts Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of General Reserve for Credit Losses (GRCL). General Reserve for Credit Losses represents a reserve established that, as a minimum, covers credit losses prudently estimated but not certain to arise over the full life of all the individual facilities making up the business of an entity. GRCL is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit General Reserve Credit Losses Amount

content.definition: The geographic latitude of a point on the earth is a measurement in degrees north or south of the equator reference to a prescribed datum.  Latitudes south of the equator are expressed as a negative number, north of the equator as positive.
content.guidance: Usage Example: -33.91277417
content.name: Address Details Geocode Latitude Number

content.definition: The geographic longitude of a point on the earth is a measurement in degrees east or west of the Greenwich Meridian to a prescribed datum. Longitudes east of Greenwich are expressed as a positive number, west of Greenwich as negative.
content.guidance: Usage Example: -150.91277417
content.name: Address Details Geocode Longitude Number

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for contributions that are accrued but not yet received.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Contributions Receivable Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of benefits payable, which represent the liability to members who remain unpaid in lieu of having exited or drawing a benefit payment.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Member Benefits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of increases in reserves as a result of positive earnings from investments, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Movements Reserves Earnings Positive Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of decreases in reserves as a result of negative earnings from investments, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Movements Reserves Earnings Negative Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reinsurance assets. This represents assets arising from net contractual rights under a reinsurance contract with respect to insurance benefits offered to beneficiaries. A reinsurance contract is an insurance contract issued by one insurer (the reinsurer) to compensate another insurer (the cedent) for losses on one or more contracts issued by the cedent. This item is determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Insurance Reinsurance Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for insurance liabilities, arising from insurance offered where the entity self-insures the benefits offered. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of liability for members' benefits. This represents the present obligation to beneficiaries for benefits they are entitled to receive in the future as a result of membership of the Registrable Superannuation Entity in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Liability Members Amount

content.definition: This is the portion, in percentage terms, as at the relevant date of business activity undertaken by the reporting entity.
content.name: Miscellaneous Business Activity Percent

content.definition: This is the date on which the reported information is reviewed.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Review Date

content.definition: This indicates whether the service provided is a material business activity.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = The service provided is a material business activity. 
false = The service provided is not a material business activity.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Business Activity Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the service provided is classified as offshoring.  Offshoring means the outsourcing of a material business activity to a service provider where the outsourced activity is to be conducted outside Australia.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = The service provided is classified as offshoring. 
false = The service provided is not classified as offshoring.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Offshoring Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any flows into the regulated superannuation fund that result in increases in the liability for benefits owing to members.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Fund Inflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any flow outwards of the regulated superannuation fund that result in decreases in the liability for benefits owing to members.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Funds Flow Outward Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for expenses that relate to the administration and operation of the entity.
content.name: Expense Operating Administration Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any advertising and marketing expense incurred by the reporting entity. That is activities associated with the promotion or delivery of goods or services, brand or entity. Includes: promotion and sponsorship activities.
content.name: Expense Operating Advertising And Marketing Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for expenses that relate to the provision of financial product advice to a member in accordance with the relevant Australian accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Advice Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for inflows sourced from insurance activities.
content.name: Income Insurance Activities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for outflows incurred through insurance activities.
content.name: Expense Insurance Activities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the net of inflows sourced from insurance activities and outflows incurred through insurance activities.
content.name: Insurance Activities Net Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of distinct entries recorded in the register of member accounts (or other equivalent mechanism).
content.name: Organisation Control Registered Member Account Count

values: ORFR trustee capital and ORFR reserve

content.definition: This indicates how the financial resources to meet the Operational Risk Financial Requirement (ORFR) are held.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Operational Risk Financial Requirement Held Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the target amount of financial resources to address the risks of the business.
content.name: Financial Risk Target Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the tolerance limit that reflects the level below which the entity must take action to replenish financial resources held to meet the requirements.
content.name: Financial Risk Tolerance Limit Amount

content.definition: This indicates whether or not the entity has a transition plan or a replenishment plan in force, as required by relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Transition Replenishment Plan Code

content.definition: This is the date for the entity's transition plan or a replenishment plan in force to reach the target, as required by relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Transition Replenishment Plan Date

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for amounts transferred to capital.
content.name: Equity Movements Transferred To Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for amounts transferred from capital.
content.name: Equity Movements Transferred From Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of rebates received from the insurer in respect of members' insurance premiums paid to that insurer.
content.name: Income Insurance Premium Rebate Amount

content.definition: This is the value, of surplus capital distributed during the relevant period. This represents an amount of financial resources that exceed the target amount which therefore are available to distribute.
content.name: Financial Risk Surplus Capital Distributed Amount

content.definition: This is the portion, as at the relevant date, of net assets available for member benefits (net of operational risk financial requirements reserves) to vested benefits determined by the Board of the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee to be the shortfall limit within the meaning given in the relevant Prudential Standard.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Shortfall Limit Percent

content.definition: This is, as at the relevant date, of the weighted average in years of benefit payments due to members under benefit arrangements.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Weighted Average Payment Term Number

content.definition: This is the relevant effective date of the weighted average duration calculation.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Weighted Average Payment Term Date

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of insurance claims admitted but not yet paid.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Claims Admitted Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of claims where a final decision to admit the claim has been made by the insurance provider but payment has not yet been made by the insurance provider to members and/or their beneficiaries.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Claims Admitted Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of insurance claims paid.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Claims Paid Count

content.definition: This is the relevant effective date of the funding and solvency certificate.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Funding And Solvency Certificate Date

content.definition: This indicates whether a notifiable event has occurred during the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = a notifiable event has occurred during the relevant period. 
false = a notifiable event has not occurred during the relevant period.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Notifiable Event Indicator

content.definition: This is the relevant date of the benefit certificate. A benefit certificate represents the benefit certificate that has been obtained from an actuary.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Benefit Certificate Date

content.definition: This indicates whether the status of information provided by the reporting entity, during the relevant period, has a satisfactory financial position, unsatisfactory financial position, or technically insolvent values.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Satisfactory = The information provided by the reporting party, for the duration of the relevant period, being based on financial statements is satisfactory in accordance with prudential standards. 
Unsatisfactory = The information provided by the reporting party, for the duration of the relevant period, being based on financial statements is unsatisfactory in accordance with prudential standards. 
Technically insolvent = The information provided by the reporting party, for the duration of the relevant period, being based on financial statements indicating technically insolvent in accordance with prudential standards.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Financial Statements Status Code

content.definition: This is the date of the financial position status change.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Status Change Date

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the amount at which the insurance cover provided is capped.
content.name: Financial Risk Insurance Cover Limit Amount

content.definition: This is the date of an actuarial investigation on a self-insurance arrangement.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Actuarial Review Date

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of funds that an actuary identifies as being necessary to fund a self-insurance arrangement such that the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee is able to pay claims made by members as and when they arise.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Recommended Self Insurance Funding Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of funds held within a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) or defined benefit sub-fund for the purposes of funding a self-insurance arrangement.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Actual Self Insurance Funding Held Amount

content.definition: This indicates whether, during the relevant period, money is specifically provided to a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) or a defined benefit sub-fund by an employer sponsor. Excludes contributions paid in compliance with super guarantee obligations.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = money is provided to a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) or a defined benefit sub-fund by an employer sponsor. 
false = money is not provided to a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) or a defined benefit sub-fund by an employer sponsor.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Employer Funded Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether, during the relevant period, the self insurance arrangement is closed to new members.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the self insurance arrangement is closed to new members. 
false = the self insurance arrangement is still open to new members.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Self Insurance Arrangement Status Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the self insurance arrangement commenced prior to 1 July 2013.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the self insurance arrangement commenced prior to 1 July 2013. 
false = the self insurance arrangement commenced after 1 July 2013.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Self Insurance Arrangement Commencement Indicator

content.definition: This is the arrangement, during the relevant period, that a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee has in place to fund self-insurance arrangements.
content.guidance:
Valid values are 
Self insurance reserve = a reserve designated by the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee as being for the purposes of funding self insurance arrangements. 
Other arrangement = a funding arrangement that is not a self-insurance reserves. This includes where the actuary makes a regular assessment of accrued self-insured claims liability which is taken into account in determining contribution levels. 
Both = a funding arrangement includes both Self insurance reserve and other arrangement.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Funding Arrangement Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total investments. Investments represent the purchase of a financial product or other item of value with an expectation of favourable future returns. This item excludes directly held derivatives.
content.name: Assets Investment Total Excluding Derivatives Directly Held Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the proportion of assets allocated to meet the objectives of the strategy.
content.name: Financial Risk Asset Allocation Percent

content.definition: This is the ratio, as at the relevant date, of the level of investments that are protected against adverse changes in the market as a portion of total investments. A hedge is a transaction where the purpose of the transaction is to protect against adverse changes in the market.
content.name: Financial Risk Hedging Percent

content.definition: This indicates whether a contract between a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee and an insurance company provides insured benefits in respect of a group of members or single member.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = Where the insurance arrangement covers more than one member. 
false = Where the insurance arrangement covers no more than one member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Group Insurance Arrangement Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the contract between a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee and an insurance company to provide insured benefits in respect of member coverage is on an individual basis, group basis or both.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Individual insurance = Represents a contract between the superannuation entity and an insurance company to provide insured benefits in respect to a single member. 
Group insurance = Represents a contract between the superannuation entity and an insurance company to provide insured benefits in respect to a group of members. 
Both = Represents both individual insurance and group insurance.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Insurance Policy Arrangement Code

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for gains or losses as a result of the actual disposal or closure of investments.
content.name: Income Investment Realised Gains Or Losses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of in house assets held by the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) for which the entity has an exemption from APRA in writing.
content.name: Assets In House Assets Exempted From APRA Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any repatriations out of the fund that go to an employer.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Repatriation To Employer Sponsor Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of an amount held by the investors in the pooled superannuation trust (PST).
content.name: Superannuation Contribution Pooled Super Trusts Held Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for expenses that relate to the operation of a business in accordance with the relevant Australian accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Business Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of investment options offered in the reporting entity.
content.name: Financial Services Investment Options Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period of the net of all acquisition and disposal transactions. These transactions involve the exchange of valuable consideration between counterparties.
content.name: Assets Investment Acquisition Disposal Transactions Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for all fees paid for the provision of services.
content.name: Expense Fees Total Amount

content.definition: This is the date on which a stress test is undertaken with respect to the investment option.
content.name: Financial Risk Stress Test Date

content.definition: This indicates whether an investment option is used to back defined benefit interests.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = The investment option is used to back defined benefit interests. 
false = The investment option is not used to back defined benefit interests.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Defined Benefit Interests Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the investment option is a default option. A default option represents an investment option under which the asset of the fund attributed to a new member is invested under the current governing rules of the fund if no direction were given.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = The investment option is a default option. 
false = The investment option is not a default option.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Default Investment Option Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period of rebates or discounts applied against fees charged.
content.name: Income Fee Rebate Paid Amount

content.definition: This indicates whether financial product advice is provided.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = financial product advice is provided. 
false = financial product advice is not provided.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Financial Product Advice Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the reporting entity holds investments in derivative contracts.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the reporting entity holds investments in derivative contracts. 
false = the reporting entity does not hold investments in derivative contracts.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Investments Derivatives Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the reporting entity participates in a securities lending program. This represents an arrangement that involves the transfer of legal ownership of securities between the original holder and 'borrower', including the right for the 'borrower' to on-sell the securities.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the reporting entity participates in a securities lending program. 
false = the reporting entity does not participate in a securities lending program.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Securities Lending Program Indicator

content.definition: The number of distinct entries recorded in the register of member accounts (or other equivalent mechanism) with fee rebate applied.
content.name: Organisation Control Registered Member Account With Rebate Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of insurance premium payments paid for the provision of insurance under an insurance policy.
content.guidance: This excludes legacy insurance arrangements where no insurance premium is payable because the insurance policy is based on a surrender value.
content.name: Expense Insurance Premium Payments Amount

content.definition: This is the date of the most recent measurement. It may be the last actuarial investigation date or a subsequent more recent estimate date.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Measures Date

content.definition: This is the relevant date of the most recent actuarial investigation during which the actuarial projection assumptions were set. Where the reporting entity uses different assumptions for long term and short term time frames, use only the long term ones.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Actuarial Projection Date

content.definition: This indicates whether the member has a defined benefit interest or a defined benefit pension.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = The member has a defined benefit interest or a defined benefit pension. 
false = The member does not have a defined benefit interest or a defined benefit pension.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Defined Benefit Interests Indicator

content.definition: This is the portion, as at the relevant date, of member accounts for which the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) has the member's tax file number recorded to identify the member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registered Member Account With Tax File Number Percent

content.definition: This is the portion, during the relevant period, of member accounts which received lump sum benefit payments and or pension benefits paid directly to members.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Accounts Receiving Benefit Payments Percent

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for total investment revenue in the form of income or distributions from investments including dividends, interest, trust distributions, or rental income.
content.name: Income Investment Income Plus Distributions Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of distinct entries recorded in the register of member accounts (or other equivalent mechanism).
content.name: Organisation Control Registered Member Account Flow Count

content.definition: This is the value of surplus reserve distributed during the relevant period. This represents an amount of financial resources that exceed the target amount which therefore are available to distribute.
content.name: Financial Risk Surplus Reserve Distributed Amount

values: MySuper product for large employer sponsor

content.definition: This indicates the type of MySuper product.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are:
Goodwill MySuper product = Goodwill MySuper product
MySuper product for large employer sponsor = MySuper product for large employer sponsor
Generic MySuper product = Generic MySuper product
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information MySuper Product Type Code

content.definition: This is the ratio, as at the relevant date, of the investment strategy as a portion of total investments. Investments represent the purchase of a financial product or other item of value with an expectation of favourable future returns. This item excludes directly held derivatives.
content.name: Assets Investment Investment Strategy Excluding Derivatives Percent

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, of premium revenue.  This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.

This item is gross of any associated outwards reinsurance expense.
content.name: Income Insurance Premium Gross Of Reinsurance Amount

content.definition: This indicates whether the employer sponsor participation is limited during the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = employer sponsor participation is limited during the relevant period. 
false = employer sponsor participation is not limited during the relevant period.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Employer Sponsor Participation Limited Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether members benefit payments were made in accordance with actuarial recommendations during the relevant period.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are:
Yes = members benefit payments were made in accordance with actuarial recommendations during the relevant period.
No = members benefit payments were not made in accordance with actuarial recommendations during the relevant period.
Not applicable = no members benefit payments were made during the relevant period.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Benefit Payments Made In Accordance With Actuarial Recommendations Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of securities available for arrangements that involve a transfer of legal ownership of securities between the holder and borrower, including the right for the borrower to on-sell the securities.
content.name: Assets Securities Lending Program Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the portion of the security lending program loaned out.
content.name: Assets Securities Lending Program Loaned Out Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the assets that are offered to secure a borrowing in a security lending program.
content.name: Assets Securities Lending Program Collateral Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of contracts underlying the exposure.
content.name: Assets Exposures Contract Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the cumulative change including gains and losses in value since the exposure/holding was established.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Cumulative Gains And Losses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of collateral provided to the reporting entity, as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Collateral Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of cash required to close or realise the derivative contract.
content.name: Liabilities Derivatives Cover Cash Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of other costs that relate to the assets of the fund which were not as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material and are not otherwise categorised.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Costs Other Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of other costs that relate to the assets of the fund which were not as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material and are not otherwise categorised.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Costs Other Percent

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of income tax expense/benefit that is associated with net investment income or due to investment related activities, net of investment fees and costs.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Investment Related Tax Expense Benefit Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of income tax expense/benefit that is associated with net investment income or due to investment related activities, net of investment fees and costs.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Investment Related Tax Expense Benefit Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the time-weighted rate of return on investments, net of investment-related fees, costs and taxes, adjusted for cash flows as they occur.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Net Investment Return Percent

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the tax benefits/expenses derived from fees or costs charged to a member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Tax Expense Benefit Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the tax benefits/expenses derived from fees or costs charged to a member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Tax Expense Benefit Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for fees charged, as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees Disclosed Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, for fees charged as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees Disclosed Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the top limit placed on a fee charged, as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees Disclosed Cap Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of employer-sponsors within the meaning given in the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act (SIS Act).
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Employer Sponsor Count

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, of borrowings for the purpose of boosting the return on capital and income via additional investment.
content.guidance: Includes: derivative securities which achieve a gearing effect.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Gearing Percent

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of the interposed associates. Interposed associate represents an associate that has been engaged to manage some or all of the investments of the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) that invests in other investment vehicles.
content.guidance: Exclude: an investment vehicle that holds the Registrable Superannuation Entity's investment.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Interposed Associate Count

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of legally enforceable contractual commitments to invest additional funds in the asset at any time in the future.
content.name: Off Balance Sheet Commitments Outstanding Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the net return for a representative member. It equates to the net investment return that is also net of administration and advice fees, costs and taxes calculated for a representative member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Representative Member Net Return Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the portion of the indirect cost ratio associated with a specific cost. The indirect cost ratio is calculated in accordance with the Corporations Regulations and disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Indirect Cost Ratio Portion Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, that represents the mean annualised estimate of the rate of net return that exceeds the growth in the Consumer Price Index (CPI) over ten years.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Return Target Percent

content.definition: This is the date the return target was established.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Return Target Start Date

content.definition: This is the level of investment risk, as at the relevant date, represented by the estimated number of years in a 20 year period that negative net investment returns are expected to be incurred.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Level Investment Risk Number

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the annual investment, administration and advice fees and costs.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees And Other Costs Amount

content.definition: This is the classification, as at the relevant date, of allowable gender of a member in the product.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are:
Female = Where women are the only determinant for membership in a lifecycle stage
Male = Where men are the only determinant for membership in a lifecycle stage.
Intersex or Indeterminate = Where intersex or indeterminate gender is the only determinant for membership in a lifecycle stage.
Any = Where gender is not a determinant for membership in a lifecycle stage.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Membership Profile Gender Code

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the ten year moving average net return on an investment. That is the average of the net return for each year reported as calculated in accordance with the relevant reporting standard.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Moving Average Return Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the ten year moving average return target on an investment. That is the average of the actual return target for each year reported as calculated in accordance with the relevant reporting standard.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Moving Average Target Return Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the minimum allowable member account balance in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Minimum Account Balance Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the minimum allowable age of a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Minimum Age Number

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, of the minimum allowable contribution rate, as a percentage of the member's salary, for a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Minimum Contribution Rate Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the maximum allowable salary of a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Maximum Salary Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the minimum allowable number of years until retirement for a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Minimum Time Remaining To Retirement Number

content.definition: This is the description, as at the relevant date, of any other factors determining membership in a product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Other Factors Text

content.definition: This indicates, as at the relevant date, the level of investment risk based on the number of negative net investment returns over a 20 year period.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are:
Very low = The information represents estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 6 or greater.
Low = This information shows the estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 0.5 to less than 1.
Low to medium = The information represents estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 3 to less than 4.
Medium = The information represents estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 2 to less than 3.
Medium to high = The information represents estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 3 to less than 4.
High = The information represents estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 4 to 6.
Very high = The information represents estimated number of negative annual returns over any 20 year period is 6 or greater.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Investment Risk Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the maximum allowable age of a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Maximum Age Number

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the maximum allowable member account balance in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Maximum Account Balance Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, of the maximum allowable contribution rate, as a percentage of the member's salary, for a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Maximum Contribution Rate Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the minimum allowable salary of a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Minimum Salary Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the maximum allowable number of years until retirement for a member in the product.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Profile Maximum Time Remaining To Retirement Number

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the quoted default coverage of an insurance cover as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material. For income protection insurance it is quoted on a monthly basis.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Default Cover Amount

content.definition: This is the ratio, as at the relevant date, of the default coverage of an insurance cover where it is disclosed as a percentage of salary in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Default Cover Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the insurance premium charged for $1,000 of default level of cover, gross of rebates as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material. For income protection insurance it is the value for $1,000 of monthly cover.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Default Cover Cost Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of member accounts entitled to be offered the insurance cover as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Membership Coverage Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the portion of the indirect cost ratio associated with a specific cost. The indirect cost ratio is calculated in accordance with the Corporations Regulations and disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Indirect Cost Ratio Amount

content.definition: This is the start date of the reporting period for a new investment option.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures New Investment Option Start Date

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for all fees and costs whether disclosed or not in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees And Costs Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for all fees and costs whether disclosed or not in the Product Disclosure Statement or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees And Costs Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for all fees paid for the provision of services.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Fees Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of the indirect cost ratio calculated in accordance with the Corporations Regulations and disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Indirect Cost Ratio Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the impact on the capital base arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capital Base Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the impact on the insurance risk charge arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty.
content.name: Financial Risk Risk Charge Insurance Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the impact on the insurance concentration risk capital charge arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty.
content.name: Financial Risk Risk Charge Concentration Insurance Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the impact on the asset risk charge arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty. The amount reported must be after the aggregation formula is applied.
content.name: Financial Risk Risk Charge Asset Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the impact on the asset concentration risk capital charge arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty.
content.name: Financial Risk Risk Charge Concentration Asset Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the impact on the operational risk capital charge arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty.
content.name: Financial Risk Risk Charge Operational Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the impact on prescribed capital amount arising from the failure of a reinsurance counterparty.
content.name: Financial Risk Prescribed Capital Adjustment Impact Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reinsurance recoverables in relation to reinsurance contracts for outstanding claims.
content.name: Assets Insurance Reinsurance Recoverables Outstanding Claims Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all the settlement account balances and any other deposits with central banks.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Central Bank Balances And Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all Minimum Liquidity Holdings (MLH) as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Minimum Liquidity Holdings Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for earning assets net of all related provisions including assets where the entity is the originator of the securitised assets in a securitisation in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Assets Earning Net Of Provisions Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all non-earning assets that are not income-producing assets.
content.name: Assets Non Earning Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for liabilities and general obligations not collateralised by legal rights to specifically designated assets owned by the borrowing institution in the case of bankruptcy, insolvency, liquidation or resolution, excluding derivatives. This item is to be determined in accordance with the prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Unsecured Funding Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all present obligations of the entity arising from past events, the settlement of which is expected to result in an outflow from the entity of resources embodying economic benefits, as well as total capital in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards.
content.name: Liabilities Plus Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all foreign exchange (FX) transaction inflows (including spot trades), include both exchange traded and over the counter.
content.name: Off Balance Sheet Foreign Exchange Cash Inflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all foreign exchange (FX) transaction outflows (including spot trades), include both exchange traded and over the counter.
content.name: Off Balance Sheet Foreign Exchange Cash Outflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for notes and coins and central bank balances.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Balances Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for securities subject to encumbrance by a legal, regulatory, contractual or other restriction that may affect an entity's ability to liquidate, sell, transfer, or assign the asset.
content.name: Assets Securities Encumbered Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for contractual cash inflows from outstanding exposures in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Cash Inflows Contractual Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for other assets approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) for inclusion in High Quality Liquid Asset (HQLA) stock in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets APRA Approved Adjustment High Quality Liquid Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value, after the applicable Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) haircuts, of eligible securities that are accepted by the RBNZ in its domestic market operations.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Securities Eligible Reserve Bank Of New Zealand Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for assets eligible as alternative liquid assets (ALA) in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Assets Eligible Alternative Liquid Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all high quality liquid assets (HQLA), eligible Reserve Bank of New Zealand securities and alternative liquid assets that meet operational requirements in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Assets High Quality Liquid Assets Eligible Reserve Bank Of New Zealand Alternative Liquid Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, for the entity's board approved minimum targeted liquidity coverage ratio (LCR) as contained in its liquidity management strategy.
content.name: Financial Risk Minimum Targeted Liquidity Coverage Ratio Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage for the lowest liquidity coverage ratio (LCR) during the reporting period calculated in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Financial Risk Lowest Liquidity Coverage Ratio Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for contractual cash outflows from outstanding liabilities and off balance sheet commitments in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Cash Outflows Contractual Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all other contractual cash inflows that are not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Assets Cash Inflows Contractual Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the loans that the lending institution has extended and are collateralised by legal rights to specifically designated assets owned by the borrowing institution which the lending institution can use and for which the lending institution can claim ownership to in the case of default by the borrower.
content.name: Assets Secured Lending Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the expected cash flows from the head office fund via a committed funding facility when the entity is a foreign ADI (Authorised Deposit-taking Institution) that is not part of a group that also has a locally incorporated banking subsidiary in Australia in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Committed Funding Facility Head Office Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for collateral received.
content.name: Liabilities Collateral Received Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for expected cash outflows to meet any increase in liquidity needs for derivative or other transaction. The authorised deposit taking institutions (ADIs) are required to report the largest absolute net 30 day collateral flow realised in the past 24 months in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Liabilities Collateral Outflows Derivatives Or Other Transactions Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of contractual inflows for all other types of transactions excluding self-securitised assets when it is included as part of the stock of liquid assets.
content.name: Assets Funded Earning Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for cash flows relating to a structured financing facility.
content.name: Liabilities Structured Financing Facility Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, for the agreed run-off rates for cash inflows and outflows not pre-determined in the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Agreed Run Off Rate Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for securitisation liabilities of Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs) where the reporting entity is the originator of the securitised assets that meet operational requirements for regulatory capital relief under the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Operational Requirement Special Purpose Vehicles Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for equity securities held in accordance with the Australian Accounting Standards, which are contracts that evidence a residual interest in the assets of an entity after deducting all its liabilities.
content.name: Assets Equity Securities Held Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for loss of funding relating to structured financing facilities.
content.name: Liabilities Structured Financing Facilities Loss Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the limit approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) for the committed liquidity facility (CLF) with the Reserve Bank of Australia.
content.name: Assets Committed Liquidity Facility Approved Amount
