content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for contractual derivative cash inflows in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Off Balance Sheet Derivative Cash Inflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for contractual derivative cash outflows in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Off Balance Sheet Derivative Cash Outflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the adjustment to liquid assets that would result after unwinding those short-term secured funding, secured lending and collateral swap transactions involving the exchange between any liquid assets that would meet if held unencumbered, the operational requirements for liquid assets set out in the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Assets Collateral Swap Adjustment Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of deposits due to retail customers as defined in accordance with the prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Retail Customer Funding Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of instances of rollovers. That is any transfer into or out of a superannuation fund including eligible rollover funds, approved deposit funds, deferred annuities or retirement savings accounts.
content.name: Superannuation Rollover Transaction Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the cost of processing rollover transactions into or out of the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE).
content.name: Superannuation Rollover Processing Cost Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of contribution transactions that represent an instance of a contribution in respect of a single member or an instance of a contribution in respect of a defined benefit pool in which a group of members has an interest.
content.name: Superannuation Contribution Transaction Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the cost of processing contribution transactions.
content.name: Superannuation Contribution Processing Cost Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of employers who have made at least one contribution transaction that is an employer contribution or personal contribution.
content.name: Superannuation Contribution Active Employers Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for outward transfers of retained profits from the general fund.
content.name: Equity Movements Retained Profits Transfers Out From General Fund Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for transfers of retained profits from a type of business of the entity to the general fund.
content.name: Equity Movements Retained Profits Transfers Into General Fund Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the profit arising from applying the profit margin(s) determined at the beginning of the period to the expected value of the profit carrier(s) on the basis of best estimate assumptions at the beginning of the period.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Insurance Profit Margin Emerging Amount

content.definition: This indicates the method of wind-up of the entity.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Successor fund transfer = represents a transfer of a member's benefits without the member's consent from one Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) to a successor fund within the meaning given in the relevant Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Regulations 1994 (SIS Regulations).  
Via member consent = represents where the winding up was implemented via members' consent to the transfer within the meaning given in the relevant SIS Regulations, rather than a transfer to a successor fund.  
ERF wind up = represents a transfer from an eligible rollover fund (ERF) within the meaning given in the relevant section of the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act 1993 (SIS Act).  
Part 18 amalgamation = represents where APRA approves, under the relevant section of the SIS Act, the transfer of all benefits of members and beneficiaries in an RSE, small APRA fund or single member approved deposit fund to another RSE, small APRA fund or single member approved deposit fund.  
Other method = represents other methods of wind-up that do not fall under a successor fund transfer, transfer via member consent, ERF wind up or Part 18 amalgamation.
content.name: Business Termination Wind Up Method Code

content.definition: This is a unique identifier allocated to the sub-fund by the entity.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Unique Identifier

content.definition: This is the authorisation number of the MySuper product allocated by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details MySuper Product Identifier

content.definition: This is the number of board meetings held during the relevant period.
content.name: Organisation Control Board Meetings Held Count

content.definition: This indicates whether the board has set a particular length for a director's term.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the board has set a length for a director's term.
false = the board has not set a length for a director's term.
content.name: Organisation Control Director Term Set Indicator

content.definition: This is the number of years of a director's term, where the board of an entity has set a length for the term of appointment of a director as part of the board renewal policy.
content.name: Organisation Control Director Term Length Count

content.definition: This is, as at the relevant date, the maximum number of terms for which a director can be appointed to the board of an entity.
content.name: Organisation Control Maximum Number Director Term Count

content.definition: This is the number of expressions of dissatisfaction received by the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee from members, relating to its products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response is explicitly or implicitly expected.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Member Complaints Count

content.definition: This is the number of board meetings attended during the relevant period.
content.name: Organisation Control Board Meetings Attended Count

content.definition: This indicates whether the individual is the chairperson of the board meeting.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the individual is the chairperson of the board meeting.
false = the individual is not the chairperson of the board meeting.
content.name: Organisation Control Chairperson Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the board remuneration committee is a group board remuneration committee.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the board remuneration committee is a group board remuneration committee.
false = the board remuneration committee is not a group board remuneration committee.
content.name: Organisation Control Group Board Indicator

content.definition: This indicates the gender of an individual person where male or female are the only allowable options.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Female = Where the gender is female.
Male = Where the gender is male.
content.name: Person Demographic Details Gender Restricted Code

content.definition: This indicates the representation type of the director, individual trustee or alternate director.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Member representative = where the director is appointed by the RSE licensee to represent the interests of members. 
Employer representative = where the director is appointed by the RSE licensee to represent the interest of an employer(s). 
Independent director = where the director is an independent director within the meaning given in the relevant Acts. 
Executive director = represents a director who is a member of the RSE licensee's management. 
Non executive director = represents a director who is not a member of the RSE licensee's management. 
Non affiliated director = represents a director who is non-affiliated within the meaning given in the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Board Representation Code

content.definition: This indicates the director type of the individual.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Director = represents a director of an RSE licensee, within the meaning given in the relevant Acts. A reference to 'a director' is, in the case of a group of individual trustees, an individual trustee. 
Individual trustee = represents an individual trustee of an RSE licensee which is a group of individual trustees. 
Alternate director = represents an alternate director within the meaning given in the relevant Acts. 
Director (Chair) = represents a director of an RSE licensee, within the meaning given in the relevant Acts, who is serving as chairperson of the Board.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Director Type Code

content.definition: This indicates whether the individual is employed in any capacity by an associate of the Registrable Superannuation Entity licensee.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the individual is employed in any capacity by an associate of the Registrable Superannuation Entity licensee. 
false = the individual is not employed in any capacity by an associate of the Registrable Superannuation Entity licensee.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Employed By Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Associate Indicator

content.definition: This indicates whether the individual currently holds a member account in a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) within the RSE licensee's business operations.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the individual currently holds a member account in a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) within the RSE licensee's business.
false = the individual does not currently hold a member account in a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) within the RSE licensee's business.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Member Account Held In Registrable Superannuation Entity Indicator

content.definition: This indicates, as at the relevant date, the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee ownership type.
content.guidance: The valid enumerated values are: Financial services corporation ownership = where the owner of the RSE licensee is a financial services corporation, i.e. the owner is a legal entity created for the purpose of producing financial goods and services for the market, that may be a source of profit or other financial gain to its owner(s) and it is collectively owned by shareholders who have the authority to appoint directors responsible for its general management. Excludes: a financial services corporation that is the principal employer-sponsor of all RSEs within the RSE licensee's business operations. Employer sponsor (non-public sector) ownership = where the owner of the RSE licensee is the principal employer-sponsor of an RSE within the RSE licensee's business operations. Include: where the RSE licensee is owned by employees of the employer-sponsor. Exclude: where the employer-sponsor is a public sector organisation. Public sector organisation ownership = where the owner of the RSE licensee is an organisation within the government sector or a resident corporation and quasi-corporation controlled by the general government sector. Include: where the public sector organisation is the principal employer-sponsor of an RSE within the RSE licensee's business operations. Nominating organisation ownership = where the owner of the RSE licensee is an employee association or employer association that represents the membership / employers of the RSEs within the RSE licensee's business operations. Include: where the RSE licensee is owned by directors representing the membership / employers of the RSEs within the RSE licensee's business operations. Public company ownership = where the owner of the RSE licensee is a public company. Excludes: a public company that is a financial services corporation, a public company that is the principal employer-sponsor of an RSE. Other ownership type = where the owner of the RSE licensee is not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Ownership Code

content.definition: This is the description, as at the relevant date, of the ownership type of Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Ownership Type Text

content.definition: This indicates, as at the relevant date, the profit status of the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Not for profit status =  where the RSE licensee's business operations are not a source of income, profit or other financial gain to the RSE licensee owners, or associates of the RSE licensee owners, that establish, control or finance the legal entity. 
For profit status = where an RSE licensee cannot be classified as being not for profit status.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Profit Status Code

values: Equal representation required by governing rules

content.definition: This indicates, as at the relevant date, the board structure of the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Equal representation required by legislation = where the RSE licensee is required to have an equal-representation board structure in accordance with the relevant Acts. 
Equal representation required by governing rules = where the RSE licensee chooses to have an equal-representation board structure in accordance with the relevant Acts. 
Non-equal representation = where the RSE licensee does not maintain any form of equal representation on the Board.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Licensee Board Structure Code

content.definition: This indicates, as at the relevant date, the classification of the predominant base of members within the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE). Predominant base means more than half of the overall fund membership.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Government base = where members join the fund as a result of working for a government organisation, including quasi-corporations controlled by the general government sector. A government organisation is a legal entity established by political processes that have legislative, judicial or executive authority over other institutional units in a given area; are financed mainly from taxation or government transfers; and are principally involved in the provision of goods and services free of charge or at economically insignificant prices. 
Corporate base = where members join the RSE as a result of working for a single employer-sponsor, or an associate of the employer-sponsor, of the RSE as determined in accordance with the relevant Acts. 
Industry base = where members join the RSE as a result of working in a particular industry sector. 
General base = the predominant base of members of the RSE cannot otherwise be categorised as government base, corporate base or industry base.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Registrable Superannuation Entity Membership Base Code

content.definition: This indicates whether the defined benefit Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) has at least one sub-fund.
content.guidance: A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. true = the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) has at least one sub-fund. false = the RSE has no sub-funds.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Sub Fund Existence Indicator

content.definition: This indicates how the sub-fund, or its reported information, has changed since the previous report.
content.guidance: The valid enumerated values are: Existing = where any information about an existing sub-fund has changed. Unchanged = where all information reported remains unchanged from the previous submission. Ceased = where the RSE or sub-fund is no longer offered to members and the value of assets in that RSE or sub-fund is nil. New = where the sub-fund was not previously reported.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Sub Fund Change Status Code

content.definition: This is the unique identifier of the lifecycle stage, as determined by the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Lifecycle Identifier

content.definition: This is the name of the lifecycle stage.
content.name: Superannuation Product Details Lifecycle Name Text

content.definition: This indicates how the MySuper product or lifecycle stage, or its reported information, has changed since the previous report.
content.guidance: The valid enumerated values are: Existing = where any information about an existing MySuper product or lifecycle stage has changed. Unchanged = where all information reported remains unchanged from the previous submission. Ceased = where the product or lifecycle stage is no longer offered to members and the value of assets in that product or lifecycle stage is nil. New = where the MySuper product or lifecycle stage was not previously reported. Not applicable = where the MySuper product has a single diversified investment strategy.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details MySuper Product Lifecycle Stage Change Status Code

content.definition: This indicates the type of responsible person within the superannuation industry.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are:  
Director = represents a director of a Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee, within the meaning given in the relevant section of the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act 1993 (SIS Act). A reference to 'a director' is, in the case of a group of individual trustees, an individual trustee.  
Director (Chair) = represents a director of an RSE licensee, within the meaning given in the relevant section of the SIS Act, who is serving as a chairperson of the Board.  
Executive officer: CEO = represents an executive officer (within the meaning given in the relevant section of the SIS Act) who is appointed to undertake the responsibilities of the Chief Executive Officer of the RSE licensee, howsoever named.  
Executive officer: CFO = represents an executive officer (within the meaning given in the relevant section of the SIS Act) who is appointed to undertake the responsibilities of the Chief Financial Officer of the RSE licensee, howsoever named.  
Other executive officer = represents other executive officers of the RSE licensee.  
Secretary = represents a person acting as a secretary of the RSE licensee.  
Senior manager = represents a person undertaking the responsibilities of a senior manager within the meaning given in the relevant Prudential Standard.  
Other responsible person = represents other responsible persons of the RSE licensee who are not a Director, Executive officer, Secretary or Senior manager of the RSE licensee.  Responsible persons who are the RSE auditor or the RSE actuary are not included in 'Other responsible person'.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Superannuation Responsible Person Type Code

content.definition: This is the full name by which a responsible person's employer is known.
content.guidance: The employer may be the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee or may be another entity.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Responsible Person Employer Name Text

content.definition: This indicates the entity's preferred method for receiving invoices.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Mail = Where the billing contact person prefers to receive the invoice by mail. 
Email = Where the billing contact person prefers to receive the invoice by email.
content.name: Preferences Billing Code

content.definition: This is the date when an individual person was assessed as being no longer fit and proper to hold a position of responsibility.
content.name: Organisation Control No Longer Fit And Proper Assessment Date

content.definition: This indicates whether the employer is an associate of the entity.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values. 
true = the employer is the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee or is an associate of the RSE licensee.
false = the employer is not the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee or an associate of the RSE licensee.
content.name: Organisation Control Employer Associate Indicator

values: No longer acting as a responsible person

content.definition: This indicates the status of the responsible person.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are:  
Changed = if any information about an existing responsible person has changed.  
Unchanged = if all information about an existing responsible person remains unchanged.  
No longer acting as a responsible person = if the existing responsible person is no longer a responsible person.
content.name: Organisation Control Responsible Person Status Change Code

content.definition: This is the number of Registrable Superannuation Entities (RSEs) within an RSE licensee's business operations that the RSE auditor is appointed to audit.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Audit Registrable Superannuation Entity Count

content.definition: This is the number of Registrable Superannuation Entities (RSEs) within the RSE licensee's business operations to which the RSE actuary is appointed to provide actuarial services.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Actuarial Services Registrable Superannuation Entity Count

content.definition: This is the number of sub-funds within the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee's business operations to which the RSE actuary is appointed to provide actuarial services. If there are no sub-funds within any RSEs within the RSE licensee's business operations, report '0'.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Actuarial Services Registrable Superannuation Entity Sub Funds Count

content.definition: This is the date that the individual's term in the role is expected to end or be due for renewal.
content.name: Organisation Control Term Expected End Date

content.definition: The date that the sub-fund, MySuper product, select investment option or lifecycle stage becomes effective.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Registration Start Date

content.definition: The date that the sub-fund, MySuper product, select investment option or lifecycle stage ceases to be effective.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Registration End Date

content.definition: This is the number of distinct entries recorded in the register of member accounts (or other equivalent mechanism) of the defined benefit Registrable Superannuation Entity or sub-fund.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Defined Benefit Registered Member Account Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for benefit payments made to the member of a defined benefit Registrable Superannuation Entity or sub-fund.
content.guidance: Includes insurance claim benefits or proceeds first credited to members' accounts and subsequently disbursed along with members' benefits to the member or beneficiary.
content.name: Superannuation Benefit Defined Benefit Payments Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any gains on foreign exchange recognised in the profit or loss. This item is determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Foreign Exchange Gains Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any losses on foreign exchange recognised in the profit or loss. This item is determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Foreign Exchange Losses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any defined benefit actuarial gains recognised in the profit or loss. This item is determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Defined Benefit Actuarial Gains Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any defined benefit actuarial losses recognised in the profit or loss. This item is determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Defined Benefit Actuarial Losses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any gains on the measurement of non-current assets (or disposal groups); classified as held for sale that does not meet the definition of discontinued operation. This item must be reported in accordance with the relevant accounting standard.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Non Current Assets Disposal Groups Held For Sale Not Discontinued Operation Gains Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any losses on the measurement of non-current assets (or disposal groups); classified as held for sale that does not meet the definition of discontinued operation. This item must be reported in accordance with the relevant accounting standard.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Non Current Assets Disposal Groups Held For Sale Not Discontinued Operation Losses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for equity securities held in accordance with the Australian Accounting Standards, as well as physical commodity positions held including gold.
content.name: Assets Equity Securities And Physical Commodities Held Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) domestic market activities via certain liquidity facilities. Through these facilities, eligible counterparties transact with the RBA on pre-specified terms, with liquidity made available via repurchase agreements (Repo). In the context of the RITS Regulations and Conditions of Operation, all repurchase agreements executed under the Bank's liquidity facilities are known as RBA Repos. This is separate from the RBA's open market operations.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Exchange Settlement Account Balances Held Against Reserve Bank Of Australia Repos Amount

content.definition: This is the description of the worker category where an insurance cover is only provided to members in a certain worker category as disclosed in the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) or other disclosure material.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Worker Category Description

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, of total investments that have been hedged.
content.name: Assets Investment Total Hedged Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all physical assets together with the equivalent asset position of the derivative instruments. The equivalent asset position of a derivative is the dollar amount of the underlying physical asset that needs to be held to generate the same return as holding the derivative.
content.name: Assets Investment Effective Exposure Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the sum of the movements in all physical assets together with the movement in derivative instruments.
content.name: Assets Investment Movement Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total movements in investments. Investments represent the purchase of a financial product or other item of value with an expectation of favourable future returns. This item excludes directly held derivatives.
content.name: Assets Investment Total Movements Excluding Derivatives Directly Held Amount

content.definition: This is the name of the select investment option.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Select Investment Option Name Text

content.definition: This is the unique identifier of the select investment option, as determined by the Registrable Superannuation Entity (RSE) licensee.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Select Investment Option Identifier

content.definition: This indicates how the select investment option reported information has changed since the previous report.
content.guidance:
The valid enumerated values are: 
Existing = where any information about an existing select investment option has changed. 
Unchanged = where all information reported remains unchanged from the previous submission. 
Ceased = where the select investment option is no longer offered to members and the value of assets in that select investment option is nil. 
No longer select investment option = where the select investment option no longer meets the definition of a select investment option. 
Returning = where the select investment option previously met the definition and has been reported in a prior period.
New = where the select investment option was not previously reported.
content.name: Superannuation Fund Details Select Investment Option Status Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for undrawn (off-balance sheet) commitments which can be unconditionally cancelled at any time without notice (revocable).
content.name: Off Balance Sheet Commitments Revocable Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of private health insurance policies.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Policies Private Health Count

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of insured persons.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insured Persons Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of inwards policy movements.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Policy Movements Inwards Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of outwards policy movements.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Policy Movements Outwards Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of inwards insured persons movements.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insured Persons Movements Inwards Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of outwards insured persons movements.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insured Persons Movements Outwards Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the benefits paid by the private health insurance fund.
content.name: Expense Insurance Benefits Paid Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of episodes of treatment.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Treatment Episodes Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of days of treatment.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Treatment Days Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of insured persons with a high cost claimants pool (HCCP) claim. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant risk equalisation rules.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures High Cost Claimants Pool Claim Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total gross benefit paid for high cost claimants pool (HCCP) claimants, for the current and the preceding 3 quarters, for insured persons with a HCCP claim in the current quarter. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant risk equalisation rules.
content.name: Expense Insurance High Cost Claimants Pool Benefits Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the net benefit paid for high cost claimants pool (HCCP) claimants for the current and the preceding 3 quarters, after Age Based Pooling (ABP) has been applied, for insured persons with a HCCP claim in the current quarter. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant risk equalisation rules.
content.name: Expense Insurance High Cost Claimants Pool Benefits Net After Age Based Pooling Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the net benefit paid above the threshold for high cost claimants pool (HCCP) claimants, for the current and the preceding 3 quarters after Age Based Pooling (ABP) has been applied. This amount includes any amounts already included in the HCCP. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant risk equalisation rules.
content.name: Expense Insurance High Cost Claimants Pool Benefits Net Above Threshold Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total benefit to be included in high cost claimants pool (HCCP) for the current quarter after Age Based Pooling (ABP) has been applied and excluding any benefits included in the HCCP in a previous period. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant risk equalisation rules.
content.name: Expense Insurance High Cost Claimants Pool Benefits Total Included Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total fee charged excluding the Medicare benefit component.
content.name: Expense Fees Excluding Medicare Benefit Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of Chronic Disease Management Program (CDMP) programs commenced.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Chronic Disease Management Programs Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of services supplied.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Services Count

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, of general treatment (excluding hospital-substitute treatment and Chronic Disease Management Program (CDMP)) claims processed within five working days.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures General Treatment Claims Processed Five Days Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, of in force policies that have existed for two years or more, over all states.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Policies Existing Two Years Percent

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of adults with hospital cover.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Adults With Hospital Cover Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for Medicare benefits paid.
content.name: Expense Medicare Benefits Paid Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of no gap prostheses supplied. No gap prosthesis means a prosthesis of a kind where a minimum benefit amount is set out and no maximum benefit amount is set out.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Prostheses No Gap Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for benefits paid for no gap prostheses.
content.name: Expense Insurance Benefits Paid No Gap Prostheses Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of gap permitted prostheses supplied. Gap permitted prosthesis means a prosthesis of a kind where a minimum benefit amount is set out and a different maximum benefit amount is set out.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Prostheses Gap Permitted Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the fee charged for gap permitted prostheses.
content.name: Expense Insurance Fee Charged Gap Permitted Prostheses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the benefits paid for gap permitted prostheses.
content.name: Expense Insurance Benefits Paid Gap Permitted Prostheses Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of medical services provided where a gap payment is applicable. A gap payment is where the fee charged by the medical practitioner exceeds the amount of benefits paid by the insurer.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Medical Services Gap Count

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant period, of benefits paid.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Benefits Paid Count

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the known or invoiced fee charged by the provider for treatment.
content.name: Expense Treatment Fees Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the average monthly premium rate.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Average Monthly Premium Rate Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of single equivalent units (SEUs) which are used as a standard measure of the different categories of policies that provide hospital cover.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Hospital Single Equivalent Units Number

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the premium increase assumed in the central estimate projection. This is calculated consistent with the pricing methodology prescribed in the relevant Act.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Premium Increase Assumed Central Projection Percent

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the contribution income assumed in the central estimate projection.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Contribution Income Central Estimate Projection Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the premium increase assumed in the stress test assumption constraint determined in accordance with the published methodology.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Percentage Premium Increase Given Stress Test Assumption Constraint Percent

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the contribution income in the stress test assumption constraint determined in accordance with the published methodology.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Contribution Income Given Stress Test Assumption Constraint Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the gross margin. This is calculated as the residual of dividing health insurance business benefits paid by health insurance business contribution income, given premium increase subject to the stress test assumptions constraint.
content.name: Income Private Health Insurance Gross Margin Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the net margin. This is calculated as the residual of dividing health insurance business benefits paid plus associated health insurance business expenses by health insurance business contribution income, given premium increase subject to the stress test assumptions constraint.
content.name: Income Private Health Insurance Net Margin Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the investment income margin. This equates to the margin (as a percentage of the health insurance business (HIB) contribution income, given premium increase subject to the stress test assumptions constraint that achieves the investment income estimate.
content.name: Income Investment Income Margin Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the margin. This is calculated as a percentage of all non-health insurance business income to health insurance business contribution income, given premium increase subject to the stress test assumptions constraint.
content.name: Income Health Related Business And Other Income Margin Percent

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for all transfers of capital into or out of the fund.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capital Transfers Into Or Out Of The Fund Amount

content.definition:
This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the percentile with which the:
 (a) net margin for the health insurance business; and
 (b) investment income; and
 (c) health related business income and all other income, less associated expenses;
must be measured at, in order to achieve a second percentile profit margin, incorporating allowance for correlation between (a), (b) and (c).
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Xth Percentile Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, for the monthly tax payment (as a percentage of health insurance business (HIB) contribution income, given premium increase subject to the stress test assumptions constraint that achieves the amount of annual tax attributable to the health benefit fund as defined in the relevant prudential standard. It is not the tax rate for-profit insurers.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Private Health Insurance Tax Percent

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for the investment income estimate of the health benefits fund which is the private health insurer's estimate of its health benefits fund's xth percentile investment income for the 12 months after the relevant day, taking into account all significant risks including:
 (a) market risk; and
 (b) credit risk; and
 (c) the risk of incorrect asset valuation on the balance sheet.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Annual Investment Income Estimate Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the other income estimate of the health benefits fund which is the private health insurer's estimate of its health benefits fund's xth percentile of its health related business and all other income, less associated expenses for the 12 months after the relevant day.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Other Income Estimate Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the amount of tax that may be attributable to the health benefits fund (which may be a negative amount to reflect future income tax credits), if it achieved its:
 (i) stressed net margin estimate; and
 (ii) stressed investment income estimate; and
 (iii) stressed other income estimate; and
for the 12 months after the relevant day.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Private Health Insurance Tax Amount

content.definition:
This is the percentage, during the relevant period, for the private health insurer's estimate of its health benefits fund's xth percentile net margin percentage for the health insurance business for 12 months after the relevant day calculated:
 (a) applying the same premium increases as those assumed in calculating the premium income estimate; and
 (b) excluding any possible changes in the unexpired risk liability or constructive obligation during that period.
content.name: Income Annual Private Health Insurance Net Margin Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for any deposits at call (i.e. withdrawal without notice) money held with a third party.
content.name: Assets Demand Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for unclosed business contributions. Only earned unclosed contributions/premiums are recognised. These are premiums in arrears, including those collected by third parties, measured up to the relevant balance date only.
content.name: Assets Other Non Financial Assets Earnt Unclosed Business Contribution Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for equities including listed and unlisted shares.
content.name: Assets Equities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for interest bearing assets (non-derivative).
content.name: Assets Interest Bearing Non Derivative Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for other financial instruments not reported elsewhere.
content.name: Assets Financial Instruments Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the capital adequacy default loss amount as defined in the relevant prudential standards. The capital adequacy default loss amount of a health benefits fund is a prudent estimate of the projected default loss.
content.name: Assets Exposures Uncompensated Loss Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total exposure. Exposure represents the purchase of a financial product or other item of value with an expectation of favourable future returns.
content.name: Assets Exposures Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of pre-paid expenses booked as assets as a result of the business making a payment for goods and services to be received in the near future.
content.name: Assets Insurance Prepaid Expense Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the dollar value of the risk margin held in relation to the relevant liability.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Margin For Risk Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for insurance liabilities not reported elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other creditors and borrowings not reported elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Other Creditors And Borrowings Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provision tax liabilities, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provision Tax Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the outstanding claims liability, as defined in the Rules, that includes a risk margin to produce a 75% probability of adequacy.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Outstanding Claims Liability 75th Percentile Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the future claims liability, as defined in the Rules, that includes a risk margin to produce a 75% probability of adequacy.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Future Claims Liability 75th Percentile Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the future claims liability, as defined in the Rules, that includes no risk margin to produce a 50% probability of adequacy.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Future Claims Liability 50th Percentile Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the central estimate of the sum of all amounts calculated for each risk equalisation jurisdiction and under the conditions outlined in the Rules.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Unbilled Calculated Deficit Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the central estimate of the sum of the eligible benefits notionally allocated to the age-based pool and the high cost claimants pool, calculated for each risk equalisation jurisdiction and under the conditions outlined in the relevant Rules.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Unbilled Gross Deficit Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the risk equalisation special account payments, for which an invoice from the relevant prudential authority has been received by the insurer but has not yet been paid by the insurer.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Billed Risk Equalisation Trust Fund Liability Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all other individual liabilities that meet the criteria and that are not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Other Individual Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all other collective liabilities that meet the criteria and that are not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Other Collective Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for security or other debt instruments, which has been approved by the relevant prudential authority under the relevant rule.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Approved Loss Absorbing Subordinated Debt Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for security or other debt instruments, which has been previously approved by the relevant prudential authority as subordinated debt under the relevant rules.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Previously Approved Subordinated Debt Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the supervisory adjustment for the quantum of assets test as advised by the regulator.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Supervisory Adjustment Quantum Of Assets Test Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the supervisory adjustment for the concentration of assets test as advised by the regulator.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Supervisory Adjustment Concentration Of Assets Test Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the supervisory adjustment for the liquidity test as advised by the regulator.
content.name: Financial Risk Solvency Supervisory Adjustment Liquidity Test Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the 98th percentile of all other individual liabilities that meet the criteria and that are not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Other Individual 98th Percentile Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the 98th percentile of all other collective liabilities that meet the criteria and that are not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Other Collective 98th Percentile Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for cash payments required to meet all liabilities that are, or might become, referrable to the entity.
content.name: Financial Risk Solvency Outflow Cash Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for cash receipts arising from premiums payable under policies of insurance that are referrable to the fund.
content.name: Financial Risk Solvency Inflow Cash Premiums Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for income from the investment of assets of the fund.
content.name: Financial Risk Solvency Inflow Cash Investment Revenue Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for amounts receivable on maturity from the investment of assets of the fund.
content.name: Financial Risk Solvency Inflow Cash Maturing Investments Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for any other money due to be received by the insurer in connection with its conduct of the business of the fund.
content.name: Financial Risk Solvency Inflow Cash Other Due Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for payments incurred by the entity relating to goods and/or services provided from a counterparty.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Incurred Payments Goods Services Received Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for payments earnt by the entity relating to goods and/or services provided to a counterparty.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Incurred Payments Goods Services Provided Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for outstanding receivable by an entity for goods and/or services provided to a counterparty.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Outstanding Receivable Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for outstanding payable to an entity for goods and/or services provided by a counterparty.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Outstanding Payable Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the premium payable by the policyholder, which is net of discounts and promotions, but gross of any commissions and/or fees taken by intermediaries. This is calculated in accordance with the relevant accounting standard.
content.name: Income Insurance Premium Revenue Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the premium payable by the policyholder, which is net of discounts and promotions, but gross of any commissions and/or fees taken by intermediaries. The premium revenues must be gross of any reinsurance arrangements whereby premium is ceded to a reinsurer. This is calculated in accordance with the relevant accounting standard.
content.name: Income Insurance Premium Revenue Gross Of Ceded Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any reinsurance premiums ceded.
content.name: Income Insurance Reinsurance Premiums Ceded Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the effects any discounts have on health insurance business premiums earned.
content.name: Income Insurance Discount Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the effects any promotions have on health insurance business (HIB) premiums earned
content.name: Income Insurance Promotion Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for all health related business for non-insurance revenue that is earned from outside the health benefits fund. It therefore includes revenue from non-policy holders of the health benefits fund, revenue to cover services provided by the health benefits fund and revenue from policy holders of the health benefits fund for services not covered by the insurance premium.
content.name: Income Non Insurance Activities Health Related Business External Sources Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for providing services to policy holders of the health benefits fund that are covered by their insurance premiums.
content.name: Income Non Insurance Activities Health Related Business Recorded As Health Fund Benefits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for all other operational revenue, net of expenses, attributable to the fund.
content.name: Revenue Operational Fund Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for State ambulance levies.
content.name: Expense Insurance State Ambulance Levy Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of expense of reinsurance recoveries in respect of insurance claims. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Insurance Reinsurance Recoveries Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of other business expenses not reported elsewhere.
content.name: Expense Insurance Other Business Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the claim handling portion of other business expenses.
content.name: Expense Insurance Claim Handling Portion Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for other non-operating expenses not reported elsewhere.
content.name: Expense Non Operating Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of income tax paid or payable from the health benefits fund (whether or not the liability for tax stems from the operations of the health benefits fund).
content.name: Expense Health Benefit Funds Tax Paid Or Payable Amount

content.definition: This is the date, during the relevant period, for all events that resulted in increased capital in the fund that are not otherwise recorded as revenue or benefits.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capital Transfer In Occur Date

content.definition: This is the date, during the relevant period, for all events that resulted in decreased capital in the fund that are not otherwise recorded as revenue or benefits.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capital Transfer Out Occur Date

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for plant and equipment held by the entity in accordance with the classification and measurement basis defined by the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Plant And Equipment Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for shares which are securities which represent ownership of part of a company and units in trusts which are securities that represent beneficial interest or economic ownership in a trust.
content.name: Assets Investment Equity Securities Unit Trusts Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for securities (debt) held under resale agreements and stocks (shares) borrowed.
content.name: Assets Securities Purchased Under Agreements To Resell And Stock Borrowing Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for borrowings which are not evidenced by the issue of debt securities (loans) and account balances with institutions not regarded as deposit-taking institutions (placements).
content.name: Assets Loans And Placements Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for units in trusts which are securities that represent beneficial interest or economic ownership in a trust.
content.name: Assets Investment Unit Trusts Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of plant, equipment and technology.
content.name: Assets Other Non Financial Assets Plant Equipment And Technology Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all intangible assets of finite and infinite life including goodwill.
content.name: Assets Intangible Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for securities (debt) sold under repurchase agreements and stocks (shares) loaned.
content.name: Liabilities Securities Sold Under Agreements To Repurchase And Stock Lending Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for loans which are not evidenced by the issue of debt securities and account balances with institutions not regarded as deposit-taking institutions (placements).
content.name: Liabilities Loans And Placements Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the balancing item due to the difference between the market value of securities sold under repurchase agreements and stocks loaned (resident and non-resident assets) and the collateral received.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Securities Loaned Collateral Received Balancing Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the amount of excess or deficiency in net assets that is due to over or under funding in defined benefit plans.
content.name: Liabilities Accrued Benefits Over Under Funded Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all assets resulting from the aggregate amount of all exposures with a positive market value.
content.name: Assets Gross Positive Market Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all liabilities resulting from the aggregate amount of all exposures with a negative market value.
content.name: Liabilities Gross Negative Market Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the face value of a financial instrument.
content.name: Assets Financial Instrument Exposure Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the net of all transactions of derivatives with a gross positive market value.
content.name: Income Derivative Positive Value Transactions Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of the net of all transactions of derivatives with a gross negative market value.
content.name: Income Derivative Negative Value Transactions Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the income sourced from fees and commissions associated with activities of the entity.
content.name: Income Operating Fees Commissions Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, as at the relevant date, of net return as defined within Regulation 7.9.07S of the Corporations Regulations 2001.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Net Return Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net return as defined within Regulation 7.9.07S of the Corporations Regulations 2001.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Net Return Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total fees and costs for a representative member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Fees Costs Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total fees, costs and taxes for a representative member.
content.name: Superannuation Regulatory Information Fees Costs Taxes Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the gross value of an investment held via individually managed mandate (discrete) portfolio where the decision-making regarding the making and redeeming of particular investments within the portfolio rests with the resident investment manager in accordance with the mandates prescribed by the registrable superannuation entity (RSE) licensee. Do not offset against any financing and/or other liabilities such as margin loan, derivatives etc. undertaken as part of the portfolio management.
content.name: Assets Investment Mandated Funds Placed With Resident Investment Managers Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the gross value of non-mandated investment in wholesale trusts offered by resident investment managers.
content.name: Assets Investment Non Mandated Funds Placed With Resident Investment Managers Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the gross value of mandated and non-mandated investment placed with non-resident investment managers. Do not offset against any financing and/or other liabilities such as margin loan, derivatives etc. undertaken as part of the mandated portfolio management.
content.name: Assets Investment Funds Placed With Non Resident Investment Managers Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for securities, which represent ownership of part of a company, known as shares.
content.name: Equity Shares Only Amount

content.definition: This is the value of borrowings including accrued interest that are not classified elsewhere.
content.name: Liabilities Borrowings Other Amount

content.definition: Securities sold under agreements to repurchase, represents the payable due to counterparties with whom the stock has been lent and from whom cash has been lodged.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Securities Sold Under Agreements To Repurchase Amount

content.definition: Report the value, as at the reporting date, of income tax liabilities. This includes both current and deferred tax liabilities, as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Tax Liability Total Amount

content.definition: A provision for dividends is the allowance that the reporting entity has made in terms of the obligation for declared dividends.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Dividends Amount
Liabilities Provisions Non Lending Losses Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for provision for mortgage insurance claims and unearned premium.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Mortgage Insurance Claims And Unearned Premium Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of Automatic Teller Machines (ATM) service points.
content.name: Organisation Details ATM Service Points Count

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of Electronic Funds Transfer at Point of Sale (EFTPOS) service points.
content.name: Organisation Details EFTPOS Service Points Count

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all provisions raised for the restructuring of an organisation.
Including:
- severance, termination and redundancy payments; and
- integration costs.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Restructuring Costs Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for liabilities generated from loans taken out and deposits received. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Loans Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for reporting entities holdings of debt securities as well as own issues of debt securities. Holding of debt securities comprise claims in all negotiable debt instruments. These are transferable instruments evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. This item is in accordance with accounting standards
content.name: Assets Holding Debt Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for reporting entities issues of debt securities comprising liabilities in all negotiable debt securities, including negotiable certificates of deposit, subordinated issues and issues in the reporting entities own name but on behalf of third parties.
This item is in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Issuing Debt Securities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for claims allocated to the country where the final risk lies. That is, the country in which the guarantor of a financial claim resides and/or the country in which the head office of a legally dependent branch is located. Collateral may be considered as an indicator of where the final risk lies to the extent that is recognised as a risk mitigant under the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision's capital framework.
content.guidance:
For example if credit derivatives are used to cover the counterparty risk of financial claims in the banking book, the country of ultimate risk of these positions is defined as the country in which the counterparty to the credit derivative contract resides.

In case of holdings of credit linked notes, collateral debt obligations and asset-backed securities a 'look-through' approach should be adopted. The country of ultimate risk is defined as the country where the debtor of the underlying credit, security or derivative contract resides.
content.name: Assets Ultimate Risk Claims Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the general insurance outstanding claims and unearned premium.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance General Insurance Outstanding Claims And Unearned Premium Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the life insurance policy liabilities.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Life Insurance Policy Liabilities Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item, being the Total Liabilities as per accounting standards other than:
- Intra-company borrowings,
- Total bonds, notes and long-term borrowings,
- Unvested policy holder benefits,
- Life insurance policy liabilities,
- General insurance outstanding claims and unearned premium,
- Total provisions,
- Total income tax liability,
- Total other borrowings,
- Total Deposits,
- Acceptances,
- Total due to financial institutions,
- Due to clearing houses
- Total loan capital and hybrid securities
content.name: Liabilities Creditors And Other Liabilities APRA Defined Total Amount

content.definition: Securitisation exposure is the value of on-balance sheet and off-balance sheet risk positions held by an entity arising from a securitisation including, but not limited to, investments in securities issued by a special purpose vehicle (SPV), credit enhancements, liquidity and other funding facilities and derivatives transactions.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Securitisation Exposure Amount

content.definition: The countercyclical capital buffer is an additional holding of Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1) capital applied as a percentage of total risk-weighted assets, which can be imposed by the national authority to protect the banking sector from periods of excess credit growth. This may vary over time according to market conditions.
content.guidance: Refer Prudential Standard APS 110 for further information. For an Authorised Deposit taking Institutions(ADI) with exposures in Australia only, the ADI-specific buffer is equal to the Australian jurisdictional countercyclical buffer.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Countercyclical Capital Buffer Percent

content.definition: The value of securitisation exposures that are required to be deducted from Common Equity Tier 1(CET1) capital in accordance with the requirements under Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Securitisation Exposure Common Equity Tier 1 Deductions Amount

content.definition: This is the value of securities held for securitisation programs in accordance with the requirements under Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Financial Risk Other Holdings Securities Securitisation Program Amount

content.definition: The value of outstanding securities in a securitisation program as recognised in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Financial Risk Other Outstanding Securities In Securitisation Program Amount

content.definition: The value of facilities provided to securitisation programs by the reporting entity, in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Financial Risk Other Facilities Provided To Securitisation Programs Amount

content.definition: The total value of any cash collateral that is lodged by the reporting entity in the name of the special purpose vehicle (SPV) in the form of cash and must, therefore, be treated as a securitisation exposure.
content.name: Financial Risk Other Cash Collateral Securitisation Amount

content.definition: The value of any loans that were sold, or otherwise originated, into special purpose vehicles (SPVs).
content.name: Financial Risk Other Loans Sold Or Other Originated Securitisation Arrangements Amount

content.definition: The total value of the funding received in exchange for the transferred loans in a securitisation program during the relevant reporting period.
content.name: Financial Risk Other Securitisation Funding Received Amount

content.definition: The total value of all new facilities provided to special purpose vehicles (SPVs) which the reporting entity has provided during the relevant reporting period.
content.name: Financial Risk Other New Facilities Provided To Securitisation Arrangements Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for interest accrued for but not yet paid.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Interest Payable Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding value (plus accrued interest) all of the securitised assets in a pool that have been transferred into a securitisation vehicle in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Assets Exposures Securitised Assets In Pool Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding value (plus accrued interest) all of the securitised assets in a pool which are solely for the purpose of using the securities created as collateral in order to obtain funding via a repurchase agreement with the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) known as self securitisation programs.
content.name: Assets Exposures Self Securitised Assets In Pool Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding aggregate value (plus accrued interest) all of the self securitisation structures where securities have actually been used to enter into a repurchase agreement with the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA).
content.name: Assets Exposures Self Securitised Assets With Repurchase Agreements Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding value of securities issued by the self-securitisation and sold under agreement to repurchase, where the counterparty is the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA).
content.name: Assets Exposures Value Securities Issued Self Securitisation And Sold Under Repurchase Agreements Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding value of funding received for securities sold under agreement to repurchase, where the counterparty is the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA).
content.name: Assets Exposures Value Funding Received For Securities Sold Under Repurchase Agreements Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding value (plus accrued interest)of assets that secure funding arrangements and are subject to prior notification requirements in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Assets Exposures Secured Funding Arrangement Subject Prior Notification Amount

content.definition: The value of outstanding securities issued by a secured funding arrangement that are backed by the assets that the reporting entity has sold or otherwise originated, into the secured funding arrangement subject to prior notification, in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 120 Securitisation.
content.name: Financial Risk Other Other Securities In Secured Funding Arrangement Subject Prior Notification Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for interest received but not yet earned e.g. interest received in advance on fixed interest loan portfolio.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Unearned Interest Amount

content.definition: This is the outstanding value of securities issued by the securitisation that are backed by the assets and exposures that the reporting entity has sold, or otherwise originated, into securitisation programs (collectively transferred assets).
content.name: Assets Exposures Securitised Outstanding Securities Amount

content.definition: The credit limit is the maximum amount of funds available to the borrower without additional authorisation or approval.
content.guidance: This amount should include outstanding balances (including capitalised interest or fees) and any other funds that can be drawn without additional approval by the lender.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Credit Limit Amount

content.definition: This is the amount owed by borrowers at the end of the reporting period. Credit outstanding is the original loan or lease amount, less any repayments, including any redraw facilities drawn. The balance should be reported gross of provisions.
content.guidance: Do not net any deposit balances in offset accounts against the outstanding loan amount. Exclude finance that has been written off.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Credit Outstanding Amount

content.definition: This is the number of business entities with credit outstanding for loans and leases.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Credit Outstanding Count

content.definition: This is the amount owed by business entities during the reporting period for credit outstanding on original loan or lease amount that have been subject to foreclosure.
content.guidance:
Proceeding in which the reporting institution takes possession of a mortgaged property.

Where an administrator or receiver appointed by the reporting institution takes possession of a mortgaged property, this should be considered as an instance of a foreclosure for the purposes of the relevant Reporting Standard.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Credit Outstanding Loans Leases Foreclosure Amount

content.definition: The number of business entities for which a foreclosure process has been initiated.
content.guidance:
Proceeding in which a reporting institution may take possession of property used to secure a loan or lease.

Where a reporting institution appoints an administrator or receiver, this should be considered as an instance of a foreclosure.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Foreclosure Count

content.definition: The number of business entities for which an instance of farm debt mediation has been initiated.
content.guidance: A structured negotiation process where a neutral and independent mediator assists the borrower and the creditor to try to reach agreement about current and future debt arrangements.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Debt Mediation Count

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for those institutions that have broking activity with clients who are other than financial institutions, record the amount due to clients in relation to security settlement transactions. Do not include amounts payable to financial institutions or clearing houses in relation to security settlements.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Payable To Clients For Outstanding Security Settlements Amount

content.definition: The value of adjustment amounts as determined by legislative instrument.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Adjustment Amounts Amount

content.definition: This is the daily average value of debt securities on issue by the reporting entity. The daily value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards. The daily average is calculated in accordance with the relevant legislation.
content.guidance: A debt security is a transferable instrument evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Daily Average Amount

content.definition: This is the daily average value of the amount payable in relation to debt securities sold under agreements to repurchase or stock lending. The daily value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards. The daily average is calculated in accordance with the relevant legislation.
content.name: Liabilities Debt Securities Sold Under Agreements To Repurchase Or Stock Lending Daily Average Amount

content.definition: This is the daily average value of loans, being liabilities incurred by the reporting entity through the lending of funds to it via means of a non-tradeable document, certificate or security. This excludes the situation where the funds are deposited with the reporting entity. The daily value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards. The daily average is calculated in accordance with the relevant legislation.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loans Daily Average Amount

content.definition: The daily average value of adjustment amounts as determined by the relevant legislation.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Adjustment Amounts Daily Average Amount

content.definition: The total value of all account-holders' Financial Claims Scheme (FCS) balances in protected accounts after application of the FCS limit.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Financial Claims Scheme Entitlement Maximum Amount

content.definition: The daily average balances of the entity relating to Exchange Settlement Accounts held at the Reserve Bank of Australia to settle financial obligations arising from the clearing of payments. The daily average is calculated in accordance with the relevant legislation.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Exchange Settlement Account Daily Average Amount
