content.definition: The value of other amounts as determined by legislative instrument.
content.name: Miscellaneous Other Determined Amount

content.definition: The value of the applicable liabilities as calculated in accordance with the Major Bank Levy Act.
content.name: Liabilities Applicable Bank Levy Liabilities Amount

content.definition: The amount of the major bank levy payable.
content.name: Tax Major Bank Levy Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage, for the daily average minimum liquidity holdings (MLH) ratio maintained during the reporting period.
content.name: Financial Risk Daily Average Minimum Liquidity Holdings Ratio Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, for the highest minimum liquidity holdings (MLH) ratio maintained during the reporting period.
content.name: Financial Risk Highest Minimum Liquidity Holdings Ratio Percent

content.definition: The value of any amounts of regulatory capital that are not recognised as Basel III eligible capital, but which the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined can be included as eligible regulatory capital under transitional arrangements, as determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Transitional Arrangements For Ineligible Basel III Capital Amount

content.definition: The net stable funding ratio (NSFR) regulatory capital is the value of the  amount of Tier 1 capital and Tier 2 capital as per Prudential Standard APS 111 - Capital Adequacy, before the application of regulatory adjustments, and excluding the proportion of Tier 2 capital instruments with a residual maturity of less than one year.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Net Stable Funding Ratio Regulatory Capital Amount

content.definition: The value of net stable funding ratio (NSFR) intermediated deposits due to retail customers and small and medium enterprises (SME) deemed to be retail customers when you look through to the original depositor. This must be reported in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Liabilities Net Stable Funding Ratio Retail And Small And Medium Enterprises Intermediated Deposits Amount

content.definition: The value of demand deposits and term deposits due to retail customers and small and medium enterprises (SME) deemed to be retail customers as defined in accordance with the relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Liabilities Retail And Small And Medium Enterprise Customer Deposit Amount

content.definition: The value of all deposits and other extensions of unsecured funding not included under operational deposits, non-deposit unsecured funding and secured funding.  Non-deposit unsecured funding refers to liabilities and general obligations that are not collateralised by legal rights to specifically designated assets owned by the borrowing authorised deposit taking institution (ADI) in the case of bankruptcy, insolvency, liquidation or resolution, excluding derivatives. Report those liabilities and general obligations that are collateralised by legal rights to specifically designated assets owned by the borrowing ADI in the case of bankruptcy, insolvency, liquidation or resolution as secured funding. This item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Non Operational Deposits Secured And Non Deposit Unsecured Funding Amount

content.definition: The value of liabilities, gross of variation margin posted, resulting from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Liabilities Liquidity Derivative Instruments Gross Amount

content.definition: The value of all collateral posted in the form of variation margin in connection with derivative contracts, regardless of asset type.
content.name: Assets Collateral Posted Variation Margin Derivatives Amount

content.definition: The balance sheet liability associated with variation margin received that cannot be included in calculating net stable funding ratio (NSFR) derivative assets.
content.name: Liabilities Variation Margin Received Non Net Stable Funding Ratio Derivative Assets Amount

content.definition: The balance sheet liability associated with initial margin received that cannot be included in calculating net stable funding ratio (NSFR) derivative assets.
content.name: Liabilities Initial Margin Received Amount

content.definition: This is the value for payables arising from the purchase of financial instruments, foreign currencies and commodities. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Trade Date Payables Amount

content.definition: The value for all other liabilities and equity items not reported elsewhere on the net stable funding ratio (NSFR) balance sheet.
content.name: Liabilities And Equity Items Net Stable Funding Ratio Balance Sheet Other Amount

content.definition: The value of liabilities that the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined are interdependent under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Liabilities APRA Determined Interdependent Amount

content.definition: The value of all other liability and equity items where the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined that an alternative available stable funding (ASF) factor applies under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Liabilities APRA Determined Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value for receivables arising from the sale of financial instruments, foreign currencies and commodities. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Trade Date Receivables Amount

content.definition: The value of all loans to financial institution counterparties where the loan is secured against high quality liquid assets 1 (HQLA1), and where the authorised deposit taking institution (ADI) has the ability to freely re-hypothecate the received collateral for the life of the loan. Exclude operational deposits held at other ADIs.
content.name: Assets Loans Secured HQLA1 Freely Rehypothecate Amount

content.definition: The value of all other loans to financial institution counterparties, including loans secured against collateral other than high-quality liquid assets 1 (HQLA1) and loans secured by HQLA1 where the authorised deposit taking institution (ADI) does not have the ability to freely re-hypothecate the received collateral for the life of the loan. Exclude operational deposits held at other ADIs.
content.name: Assets Loans Secured Non HQLA1 Freely Rehypothecate Amount

content.definition: The value of all high quality liquid assets 1 (HQLA1) according to Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity - excluding notes and coins immediately available to meet obligations and central bank balances, to the extent that these balances may be drawn down in times of stress.
content.name: Assets High Quality Liquid Asset 1 Excluding Notes Coins Central Bank Balances Amount

content.definition: The value of committed liquidity facility (CLF) eligible debt securities, being Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) repo-eligible securities excluding self-securitisations and securities recognised as high quality liquid assets (HQLA).
content.name: Assets Trading Securities Committed Liquidity Facility Eligible Debt Amount

content.definition: The value of self-securitised assets for contingent liquidity purposes that are held on-balance sheet and are eligible as committed liquidity facility (CLF) collateral that the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) allows to be included in the numerator of the liquidity coverage ratio (LCR).
content.name: Assets Trading Securities Committed Liquidity Facility Eligible Self Securitised Amount

content.definition: The value of debt securities that qualify as other liquidity coverage ratio (LCR) assets, including third-party debt securities that are Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) eligible securities.
content.name: Assets Trading Securities Liquidity Coverage Ratio Other Amount

content.definition: The value of all high quality liquid assets 2A (HQLA2A) according to Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment A.
content.name: Assets High Quality Liquid Asset 2A Amount

content.definition: The value of all high quality liquid assets 2B (HQLA2B) according to Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment A.
content.name: Assets High Quality Liquid Asset 2B Amount

content.definition: This is the value, of all claims on central banks that do not qualify as central bank reserves and balances.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Claims Central Bank Other Amount

content.definition: The value of all operational deposits held at other authorised deposit taking institutions (ADIs) that are subject to the relevant available stable funding (ASF) factor in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Operational Deposits Held Other ADIs Amount

content.definition: The value of all Australian equities that meet the requirements of Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Equity Holdings Liquidity Amount

content.definition: The value of residential mortgages that are subject to, or would qualify for, the relevant risk weight of Prudential Standard APS 112 - Capital Adequacy: Standardised Approach to Credit Risk including the remaining carrying value of self-securitised assets that are eligible as committed liquidity facility (CLF) collateral not reported elsewhere in the net stable funding ratio calculations.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Households Net Stable Funding Ratio Residential Mortgage Amount

content.definition: The value of assets, gross of variation margin received, resulting from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Assets Liquidity Derivative Instruments Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for payables for unsettled purchases of securities. This item only arises if securities are recorded on a trade date basis as opposed to a settlement date basis.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Securities Purchased Not Delivered Security Settlements Amount

content.definition: The value of securities that do not qualify as high quality liquid assets (HQLA) in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, and physical traded commodities, including gold.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Securities Non HQLA Amount

content.definition: The value of all defaulted securities and non-performing loans in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Defaulted Securities Non Performing Loans Amount

content.definition: The value of all collateral received in the form of variation margin in connection with derivative contracts that can be included in calculating net stable funding ratio (NSFR) derivative assets in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Liabilities Collateral Received Variation Margin Derivatives Amount

content.definition: The values of any non-residential mortgages that are loans to non-financial institution counterparties that are subject to, or would qualify for, the relevant risk weight of the Prudential Standard APS 112 - Capital Adequacy: Standardised Approach to Credit Risk in the net stable funding ratio calculation.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Households Net Stable Funding Ratio Non Residential Mortgage Amount

content.definition: The value of any other non-financial institution net stable funding ratio (NSFR) loans that are subject to, or would qualify for, the relevant risk weight of Prudential Standard APS 112 - Capital Adequacy: Standardised Approach to Credit Risk.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Households Net Stable Funding Ratio Loans Other Amount

content.definition: The value of the total net stable funding ratio (NSFR) initial margin posted on the authorised deposit-taking institution's (ADI) own derivative positions, whether on- or off-balance sheet. For securities or other assets posted as initial margin on the ADI's own derivative positions, report only where the securities or other assets would otherwise receive a required stable funding (RSF) factor of 85 per cent or lower.
content.name: Assets Net Stable Funding Ratio Initial Margin Posted ADIs Own Derivative Positions Amount

content.definition: The value of the total net stable funding ratio (NSFR) initial margin posted on behalf of the authorised deposit-taking institution's customer, whether on- or off-balance sheet. Report only where the authorised deposit taking institution (ADI) does not guarantee performance of the third party.
content.name: Assets Net Stable Funding Ratio Initial Margin Posted Customer Amount

content.definition: The value of the cash or other assets provided to contribute to the default fund of a central counterparty (CCP).
content.name: Assets Net Stable Funding Ratio Contribute Default Fund Central Counterparty Amount

content.definition: The value of deductions from regulatory capital , as approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority and in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 111 - Capital Adequacy: Measurement of Capital.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Deduction Amount

content.definition: The value of assets that the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined are interdependent under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Assets APRA Determined Interdependent Amount

content.definition: The value of all assets not reported elsewhere in net stable funding ratio (NSFR), under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Assets Net Stable Funding Ratio Other Amount

content.definition: The value of all other asset items where the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined that an alternative available stable funding (ASF) factor applies under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Assets APRA Determined Other Amount

content.definition: The value of other off balance sheet obligations where the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined that an alternative required stable funding (RSF) factor applies under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Assets APRA Determined Other Off Balance Sheet Obligations Amount

content.definition: The rate applied to on or off balance sheet obligations where the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined that an alternative required stable funding (RSF) factor applies under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Financial Risk APRA Determined Required Stable Funding Factor Rate

content.definition: The rate applied to on or off balance sheet obligations where the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) has determined that an alternative available stable funding (ASF) factor applies under Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity.
content.name: Financial Risk APRA Determined Available Stable Funding Factor Rate

content.definition: This is the percentage, for the highest liquidity coverage ratio (LCR) during the reporting period calculated in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Financial Risk Liquidity Coverage Ratio Highest Percent

content.definition: This is the percentage, for the mean liquidity coverage ratio (LCR) during the reporting period calculated in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Financial Risk Liquidity Coverage Ratio Mean Percent

content.definition: Report the amount of foreign currency liquidity coverage ratio (LCR) for all currencies where the authorised deposit taking institutions (ADI's) total liabilities in that currency (before any hedging) exceed five per cent of the ADI's total liabilities at any time during the quarter.
content.name: Financial Risk Foreign Currency Liquidity Coverage Ratio Amount

content.definition: This is the weighted average interest rate for variable-rate loans calculated as the average of the individual loans' contractual interest rates, weighted by the credit limit during the relevant period.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Interest Rate Variable Weighted Average Rate

content.definition: This is the weighted average loan serviceability assessment rate calculated as the average of the individual loans interest rates, weighted by the credit limit during the relevant period. The loan serviceability assessment rate is the interest rate used in the lender's serviceability assessments, such as an interest-rate floor or actual interest-rate rate plus interest-rate buffer.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Loan Serviceability Assessment Rate Weighted Average Rate

content.definition: Report the value, as at the reporting date, of share capital repayable on demand. This includes members' shares in co-operatives classified as liabilities, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Share Capital Repayable On Demand Amount

content.definition: The value of any increase in credit limit during the relevant period where the credit limit is the maximum amount of funds available to the business entity without additional authorisation or approval.
content.guidance: This amount should include outstanding balances (including capitalised interest or fees) and any other funds that can be drawn without additional approval by the lender.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Credit Limit Increase Amount

content.definition: The credit limit of loans funded during the relevant period. A loan is considered funded once any portion of the funds is made available for the borrower to draw down according to the terms of the contract, whether or not it is drawn down within that period. The credit limit is the maximum amount of funds available to the borrower without additional authorisation or approval.
content.guidance: This amount should include outstanding balances (including capitalised interest or fees) and any other funds that can be drawn without additional approval by the lender.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Credit Limit Funded New Amount

content.definition: The gross deposit balance in deposit accounts that are offset against the balance of an outstanding loan when calculating the interest owing.
content.guidance: Exclude accounts with no credit outstanding associated with them, and all-in-one facilities where it is not possible to separate the loan balance from the borrower's deposits.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Offset Account Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for debt securities that have been notified by the offshore central Bank as being acceptable collateral in its domestic market operations.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Debt Securities Eligible Collateral Offshore Central Bank Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for debt securities (both trading and investment) on the entity's books other than securities that have been notified by the offshore central bank as being acceptable collateral in its domestic market operations of the relevant country.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Not Eligible Collateral Offshore Central Bank Amount

content.definition: The value of any other sources of material contractual cash inflows in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Material Contractual Cash Inflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value of an authorised deposit taking institution's (ADI's) notes and coin, central bank balances, loans, securities and other material sources of cash inflows.
content.name: Assets Funded Amount

content.definition: The value of any other sources of material contractual cash outflows in accordance with the relevant prudential standard.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Material Contractual Cash Outflows Amount

content.definition: This is the value of an authorised deposit taking institution's (ADI's) unsecured deposit funding, unsecured debt securities issued, secured funding, other interest bearing liabilities and any other material sources of cash outflow plus capital.
content.name: Liabilities Funded And Capital Amount

content.definition: The value of assets in cover pools used as collateral for covered bond issuance.
content.name: Assets Cover Pool Collateral Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the suspense or unreconciled/unidentified transactions/balances that are in a liability position. A list of examples is not provided as these may vary between institutions. It is recommended that the institution's internal procedures be adopted regarding the recording and reporting of these types of balances.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Items In Suspense Amount

content.definition: The values of total assets on the entities domestic books adjusted to exclude goodwill, assets in cover pools (and any related loans to a covered bond special purpose vehicle) and double-counting.
content.name: Assets Adjusted Covered Bond Amount

content.definition: The value of intermediated deposits when you look through to the original transaction for net stable funding ratio calculation purposes for any customers  other than retail and small and medium enterprise (SME) and SME deemed to be retail customers; and those depositors that get a 100 per cent run-off rate in the liquidity coverage ratio (LCR). This must be reported in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 210 - Liquidity, Attachment C.
content.name: Liabilities Net Stable Funding Ratio Non Retail And SME Intermediated Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for Specialised Credit Card Institutions, to report any amounts owed to merchants as a result of acquiring credit card transactions.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Merchants Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item, being the Total Liabilities as per accounting standards other than:
- Total bonds, notes and long-term borrowings,
- Total provisions,
- Total income tax liability,
- Total other borrowings,
- Total deposits,
- Acceptances,
- Total due to financial institutions,
- Due to clearing houses
- Total loan capital and hybrid securities
- Defined benefit liabilities - Current, Non-current,
- Interest payable,
- Unearned interest,
- Amounts payable to clients - outstanding security settlements,
- Derivative financial instruments,
- Securities purchased not delivered security settlements,
- Liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale,
- Share capital repayable on demand,
- Items in suspense
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Creditors And Other Liabilities As Defined By APRA Form ARF320 Amount

content.definition: Report the value of loan capital and hybrid securities on issue by the reporting party as at the reporting date. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Total Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the credit union member withdrawable shares. 

This item should be prepared in accordance with the prudential treatment and relevant Australian Accounting Standards. For prudential purposes, a credit union member share is classified as a liability and is not capital. In the event of redemption, the liability would be reduced by the issue value of shares redeemed.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Members Withdrawable Shares Amount

content.definition: Report the value of loan capital on issue by the reporting party as at the reporting date.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital Amount

content.definition: Report the value of hybrid securities on issue by the reporting party as at the reporting date. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Hybrid Securities Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.guidance: Shareholders' equity as per accounting standards
content.name: Equity Shareholders Equity Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for ordinary share capital on issue.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Ordinary Shares Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for preference shares which have a priority over dividend payments and claims on assets of the reporting company.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Preference Shares Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the total of all reserves that have been measured and disclosed in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date of General Reserves determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves General Reserves Amount

content.definition: Capital profits reserve represents the realised value of revaluations associated with an asset or class of assets that have been disposed of.
content.name: Equity Reserves Capital Profits Reserve Amount

content.definition: Report the value, as at the relevant date, of all asset revaluation reserves, determined in accordance with Accounting Standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the asset revaluation reserve relating to the revaluation of owner-occupied property.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Owner Occupied Property Amount

content.definition: This is the value, at the relevant date, of the balance of the Asset Revaluation Reserve relating to the revaluation of plant and equipment
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Plant And Equipment Amount

content.definition: Report the value, as at the relevant date, of all asset revaluation reserves, determined in accordance with Accounting Standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Intangibles Revaluation Surplus Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the balance of the asset revaluation reserve relating to the revaluation of investment in subsidiaries.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Investment In Subsidiaries Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the balance of the asset revaluation reserve relating to the revaluation of investments in associates.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Investments In Associates Or Share Of Associates Amount

content.definition: Report the value as at the relevant date of the balance of the Asset Revaluation Reserve relating to the revaluation of non-current assets or disposal groups held for sale, determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Reserve Relating To Non Current Assets Or Disposal Groups Held For Sale Amount

content.definition: Report the value of the reserve relating to exchange rate differences arising on translation of assets and liabilities in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Foreign Currency Translation Reserve Amount

content.definition: Report the value of the reserve in relation to marketable securities (debt and equity), classified as available for sale consistent with the classification and measurement basis used by institutions in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Marketable Securities Available For Sale Reserve Amount

content.definition: Report the value of the reserve in relation to assets classified as available for sale other than marketable securities (debt and equity), consistent with the classification and measurement basis used by institutions in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Available For Sale Reserves Other Amount

content.definition: Report the value of the reserve in relation to the effective portion of the gain or loss on the cash flow hedging instrument as determined in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Cash Flow Hedge Reserve Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the equity settled share based payment reserve amounts in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards: Share-based Payment.
content.name: Equity Reserves Share Based Payments Reserve Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for total financial assets available for sale balances categorised in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards, other than:
- Debt Securities Available for Sale
- Equity Securities Available for Sale
- Loans and Advances available-for-sale, including those "tainted" held-to-maturity investments that can no longer be classified as held-to-maturity investments.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Other Financial Assets Available For Sale Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for financial assets at fair value through profit and loss balances categorised in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards, other than:
- Banking book derivative assets at fair value through profit and loss
- Trading book derivative assets at fair value through profit and loss 
- Debt securities assets at fair value through profit and loss 
- Equity securities assets at fair value through profit and loss.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the financial liabilities at fair value through profit and loss balances categorised in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards, other than:
- Banking book derivative liabilities at fair value through profit and loss,
- Trading book derivative liabilities at fair value through profit and loss.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for financial assets, other than debt securities, held to maturity at amortised cost balances categorised in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Non Debt Securities Held To Maturity At Amortised Cost Other Amount

content.definition: This is an identifier issued by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) for authorised licensees who provide financial services.
content.guidance: Provide the AFSL number.
content.name: Identifiers Australian Financial Services Licence Number Identifier

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reserve in relation to assets classified as available-for-sale, consistent with the classification and measurement basis used in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Reserves Available For Sale Reserves Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for when the transferee of the stock effectively receives a lender's rate of return (i.e. the underlying risks and rewards of ownership of the underlying stock is not effectively transferred), these transactions are to be accounted for as collateralised borrowing activities (treating stock borrowing as on balance sheet exposures). Securities purchased under agreements to resell, represents the receivable due from counterparties from whom the stock has been borrowed and with whom cash has been lodged. Under this method of accounting the bank's physical stock positions recorded on the balance sheet in either Trading Securities or Investment Securities sections is not affected. This is consistent with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Securities Purchased Under Agreements To Resell Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, to record receivables for unsettled sales of securities. This item arises only if the reporting institution records securities on a trade date basis as opposed to settlement date basis
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Securities Sold Not Delivered Or Security Settlements Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.name: Expense Operating Continuing Operations Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the balancing item between interest income and total operating income, defined in this form only.
content.name: Income Other Operating Or Non Interest Income Total Amount

content.definition: This is the total of operating Revenue plus any Other Income as described in the Accounting Standard references provided.
content.guidance: This is the total of operating Revenue plus any Other Income as described in the Accounting Standard references provided
content.name: Income Operating Continuing Operations Total Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.guidance: This is the total of operating Revenue plus any Other Income as described in the Accounting Standard references provided less any charge for bad and doubtful debts.
content.name: Income Operating Continuing Operations After Bad And Doubtful Debts Charge Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest expense incurred on borrowings related to bonds notes and long term borrowings.
content.name: Expense Interest Bonds Notes And Long Term Borrowings Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest expense incurred on borrowings related to deposits.
content.name: Expense Interest Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest expense incurred on borrowings related to banking book derivatives.
content.name: Expense Interest Derivatives Banking Book Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest expense incurred on borrowings related to loan capital.
content.name: Expense Interest Loan Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest expense incurred on borrowings related to other borrowings.
content.name: Expense Interest Other Borrowings Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.name: Expense Interest Total Amount

content.definition:
Capital expenditure is the expenditure by an entity of a significant amount for the purchase or improvement of a fixed asset; the amount expended would warrant the item being depreciated over an estimated useful life of a reasonably 'extended' period. Capital expenditure is not charged against the profits of the entity when it takes place, but is regarded as an investment to be capitalised in the balance sheet as a fixed asset and subsequently charged against profits by depreciating the asset over its estimated useful life.

Buildings and other structures includes industrial and commercial buildings, houses, flats, home units, water and sewerage installations, lifts, heating, ventilating and similar equipment forming an integral part of buildings and structures, land development and construction site development, roads, bridges, wharves, harbours, railway lines, pipelines, power and telephone lines. It also includes mine development (e.g. construction of shafts in underground mines, preparation of mining and quarrying sites for open cut extraction and other developmental operations primarily for commencing or extending production). It excludes purchases of land, previously occupied buildings and speculatively built projects intended for sale before occupation.

This is the capital expenditure for new buildings and other structures, and associated capitalised costs only (e.g. real transfer costs incurred upon acquiring the assets) and does not include capital expenditure on any other asset types.
content.name: Capital Expenditure New Buildings and Other Structures Actual Amount

content.definition: This is the text, during the relevant period, for comments that give the reporter of data the opportunity to add extra information.
content.name: Report Comments Form Comments Text

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from investment in securities.
content.name: Income Interest Investment Securities Physical Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for superannuation entities that are pooled super trusts.  Record the dollar value of contributions income received and receivable from pooled super trust members for the period to date, including contributions from self-employed members.

Do not include 'rollovers received'. Show contributions gross of contributions tax and do not deduct entry fees, deferred entry fees, commissions, management fees or any other ongoing fees or charges deducted from the contributions received (where applicable to the superannuation entity).
content.name: Superannuation Contribution Pooled Super Trusts Contributions Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any contributions paid in from all possible sources.
content.name: Superannuation Contribution Total Amount

content.guidance:
Record:
* The Net value of member's benefits that have been rolled over/transferred in to the reporting superannuation entity from another superannuation entity ; less
* The Net value of member's benefits that have been rolled over/transferred out from the reporting superannuation entity to another superannuation entity
content.name: Superannuation Rollover Net Amount

content.definition: Where the reporting party has repatriated superannuation funds to an employer sponsor, report the value of the funds repatriated during the reporting period. Do not include other types of payments to the employer sponsor (for example, administration fees paid to the employer sponsor).
content.name: Superannuation Payment Repatriation To Employer Sponsor Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits that have been paid by the trustee to the nominated beneficiary/dependent or the deceased member's estate due to the death of a member.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Death Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits paid to members as a result of retirement. This does not include amounts paid to members' accounts with other superannuation entities.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Retirement Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits paid to members as a result of retrenchment or redundancy.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Retrenchment And Redundancies Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits paid to members resulting from total and permanent disability, and for temporary disability/income protection.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Disability Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits paid to members as a result of member resignation from the employer.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Resignation Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits paid to members by the trustee(s) under the early release provisions relating to grounds of severe financial hardship.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Financial Hardship Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the expense for benefits paid to members by the trustee(s) under the early release provisions relating to compassionate grounds.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Lump Sum Compassionate Grounds Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for superannuation entities that are pooled super trusts. Report the expense for payments to unit holders.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Lump Sum Pooled Super Trusts Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total of all lump sum and pension benefit paid directly to members, i.e. excluding rollovers.
content.name: Superannuation Payment Benefit Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the tax expense in relation to taxable contributions made into the superannuation entity, and specified rollover amounts.
content.name: Income Tax Superannuation Contributions Tax Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the surcharge expense . This is represented by the amount paid by the superannuation entity to the Australian Taxation Office, plus any amount taken up as a liability by the superannuation entity for any unpaid surcharge as at the end of the reporting period, less any liability for unpaid surcharge taken up at the end of the previous reporting period.
content.name: Income Tax Superannuation Contributions Surcharge Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the proceeds received/receivable from the insurer for the reporting period in relation to the death of a member.
content.name: Insurance Proceeds Death Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for proceeds received/receivable from the insurer and/or accrued in relation to disability of members, including amounts for total and permanent disability and temporary disability/income protection.
content.name: Insurance Proceeds Disability Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any rebates received/receivable from insurers in relation to members' total death and/or disability insurance premiums paid or payable.
content.name: Insurance Rebate Premium Members Death Disabilty Amount

content.guidance: Represents members' total death and/or disability insurance premiums paid or payable during the reporting period less any rebates received in respect of those premiums.
content.name: Insurance Expense Premium Members Death Disabilty Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for total investment revenue including investment income after impairment expense (dividends, interest, trust, rental), gains/losses on investments and any other investment income measured in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Income Investment Total Investment Revenue Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for investment income after doubtful debts expense.
content.name: Income Operating Investment Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for any realised/unrealised foreign exchange gains/losses relating to the translation/conversion of all investments of the entity (except derivatives) which are denominated in a currency other than the Australian dollar (AUD).
Only report the gain/loss that is attributable to movements in the currency in which investments are denominated, relative to the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Foreign Exchange Physical Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for any realised/unrealised foreign exchange gains/losses relating to the currency translation/conversion of derivative contracts.

Such contracts may be held in relation to the underlying investment portfolios (e.g. as hedges of the interest rate or equity investment portfolios) or as outright position taking to alter the asset allocation strategy.

Only report the gain/loss that is attributable to movements in the currency in which the derivative contract is denominated, relative to the Australian dollars (AUD).
content.name: Profit Or Loss Foreign Exchange Derivatives Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for any realised/unrealised foreign exchange gains/losses relating to the translation/conversion of all investments of the entity which are denominated in a currency other than the Australian dollar (AUD).
Only report the gain/loss that is attributable to movements in the currency in which investments are denominated, relative to the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Foreign Exchange Total Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for unrealised gains/losses associated with the entity's holdings of deposits, placements, loans and debt securities. 
Exclude:
- Gains and losses associated with the investment in cash management trusts; and
- Gains/losses on interest rate related derivative financial instruments.

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Deposits Placements Loans Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for realised gains/losses associated with the entity's holdings of deposits, placements, loans and debt securities.
Exclude:
- Gains/losses associated with the investment in cash management trusts; and
- Gains/losses on interest rate related derivative financial instruments.

Realised gains/losses:
Where the entity disposed of an asset during the reporting period, the value of the gain or loss from the disposal is to be reported.
If an asset has not been disposed of during the annual reporting period, then any gains or losses are unrealised.
Only include the movement in the market value of the asset, do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Deposits Placements Loans Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for unrealised gains/losses attributable to the movement in net market value of the entity's derivative exposures.
Exclude:
Unrealised or realised gains/losses relating to the currency translation of foreign currency derivative contracts.

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Derivatives Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for unrealised gains/losses associated with the entity's investment in property assets.

Do not include gains/losses on investments in:
- Listed property trusts;
- Unlisted private property unit trusts; and
- Unlisted public offer/retail property trusts.

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Property Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for realised gains/losses associated with the entity's investment in property assets.

Do not include gains/losses on investments in:
- Listed property trusts;
- Unlisted private property unit trusts; and
- Unlisted public offer/retail property trusts.

Realised gains/losses:
Where the entity disposed of an asset during the reporting period, the value of the gain or loss from the disposal is to be reported.
If an asset has not been disposed of during the annual reporting period, then any gains or losses are unrealised.
Only include the movement in the market value of the asset, do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Property Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for unrealised gains and losses in the value of investments placed by the entity with overseas investment managers.

Exclude:
- Amounts directly invested overseas by the entity in underlying assets such as equity securities, bonds and direct property; and
- Amounts placed with Australian investment managers for investment overseas.

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Overseas Investment Managers Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for realised gains and losses in the value of investments placed by the entity with overseas investment managers.
Exclude:
- Amounts directly invested overseas by the entity in underlying assets such as equity securities, bonds and direct property; and
- Amounts placed with Australian investment managers for investment overseas.

Realised gains/losses:
Where the entity disposed of an asset during the reporting period, the value of the gain or loss from the disposal is to be reported.
If an asset has not been disposed of during the annual reporting period, then any gains or losses are unrealised.
Only include the movement in the market value of the asset, do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Overseas Investment Managers Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for unrealised gains/losses on funds placed with external investment managers in the form of individually managed mandates or discretely managed portfolios where the asset portfolio is tailored for or chosen by the entity.

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Individually Managed Mandates Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for realised gains/losses on funds placed with external investment managers in the form of individually managed mandates or discretely managed portfolios where the asset portfolio is tailored for or chosen by the entity.

Realised gains/losses:
Where the entity disposed of an asset during the reporting period, the value of the gain or loss from the disposal is to be reported.
If an asset has not been disposed of during the annual reporting period, then any gains or losses are unrealised.
Only include the movement in the market value of the asset, do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Individually Managed Mandates Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total amount of interest income derived from investment in trading securities.
content.name: Income Interest Trading Securities Total Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for unrealised gains/losses associated with the investments in insurance or life policies. Include:
- The change in net market value of unit-linked insurance or investment policies; and
- The change in net market value of policies in respect of death, total, permanent or temporary disablement.
Important:
If the superannuation entity invests in statutory funds of a life insurer and does not know the realised gains and losses, the superannuation entity should only account for the total change in net market value. An estimate can be provided to calculate realised and unrealised gains and losses on a pro rata basis.

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Insurance Policies Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for  realised gains/losses associated with the investments in insurance or life policies. Include:
- The change in net market value of unit-linked insurance or investment policies; and
- The change in net market value of policies in respect of death, total, permanent or temporary disablement.

Important:
If the superannuation entity invests in statutory funds of a life insurer and does not know the realised gains and losses, the superannuation entity should only account for the total change in net market value.
An estimate can be provided to calculate realised and unrealised gains and losses on a pro rata basis.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Insurance Policies Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for a balancing item within the list in which it is being used.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for total unrealised gains/losses associated with the entity's investments. 

Unrealised gains/losses:
The change in the net market value is the increase or decrease in the market value of each asset compared to the value of that asset at the beginning of the reporting period. These assets are still owned by the entity at the end of the period, they have not been disposed of, and as a result, the gains or losses on the assets are unrealised. If the assets are disposed of during the period, then the gains or losses are realised.
Only include the movement in the net market value of the asset. Do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar (AUD) if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the AUD.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Gains Or Losses On Investments Total Amount

content.guidance:
Report total realised gains/losses associated with the entity's investments. 
Realised gains/losses
Where the entity disposed of an asset during the reporting period, the value of the gain or loss from the disposal is to be reported.
If an asset has not been disposed of during the annual reporting period, then any gains or losses are unrealised.
Only include the movement in the market value of the asset, do not include the movement in the value of the currency relative to the Australian dollar if the asset is denominated in a currency other than the Australian dollar.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Investment Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for recording any fee income associated with scrip lending activities of the entity. This refers to the situation where the superannuation entity buys/borrows securities from another party in exchange for cash. The entity agrees to return the securities to the other party in the future in exchange for the return of the cash (plus an additional amount of earnings, fees or commissions).
content.name: Income Investment Fees And Commissions Scrip Lending Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.name: Income Interest Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any fee income or commission associated with the entity providing or guaranteeing to underwrite the issue of securities (e.g. equity securities).
content.name: Income Investment Fees And Commissions Underwriting Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total of any fee or commission income associated with any form of investment activity or member activity of the entity.
content.name: Income Investment Fees And Commissions Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for any other investment income that is not already listed in the form.
content.name: Income Investment Other Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of fee expense of the reporting party that relates to the management of the entity's investment portfolios. Include fees paid to investment managers and asset consultants.
content.name: Expense Operating Investment Management And Asset Consultant Fees Amount

content.definition: Report the value of custodian fees expense recognised by the reporting party for the reporting period. Custodian fees are those charged by an entity for holding title of assets on behalf of the reporting party, but where the powers of investment management remain with the reporting party.
content.name: Expense Operating Investment Custodian Fees Amount
Expense Operating Investment Property Maintenance Costs Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for all expenses related to investment activities.

Include all expenses which are associated with the generation of income on the investment portfolio of the entity. Do not include expenses of an administrative or operating nature.

Important - Do not net the following revenue items off against investment expenses:
- Fee related income rebates off against investment expenses; or
- Rebates provided by investment managers (often in the form of extra units when investment performance does not meet targets).
Commissions or deductions should be shown on a gross basis here. For example, where there is a separately identifiable charge to the entity, fees charged by the investment manager should not be netted against investment income.
content.name: Expense Operating Investment Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from investment in cash and liquid assets.
content.name: Income Interest Cash And Liquid Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of fee expense of the reporting party that do not relate to the management of the entity's investment portfolios. Investment management fees include fees paid to investment managers and asset consultants, including independent third parties as well as related entities.
content.name: Expense Operating Management Fees Non Investment Amount
Expense Operating Administration Fees Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for fees paid/payable by the entity to the Directors/trustee(s) for the services in carrying out the functions of a trustee/director, including any consulting or administration services provided. Do not include amounts paid to Directors/trustee(s) that represent a direct reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Directors/trustee(s) on behalf of the entity. Do not include the expense for trustee indemnity insurance. Do not include commissions collected by the trustee for payment to a third party.
content.name: Expense Operating Fees Paid Or Payable To Trustees Or Directors Amount

content.definition: Report the value of all fees and expenses recognised during the reporting period, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards, for the rendering of professional services to the reporting party by an external audit firm. This includes all fees and expenses paid to the firm which is conducting the external audit of the reporting party, for the provision of both audit and non-audit services.
content.name: Auditor Disclosures Remuneration Total Amount

content.guidance: This is a subtotal item within the list in which it is being used
content.name: Expense Operating Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total value of dividend imputation credits associated with total dividend income received or received through distributions by unit trusts.
content.name: Income Tax Franking Credits Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for superannuation entities that receive interest in respect of Commonwealth, State or Semi-Government securities issued before 1 November 1968 are entitled to a rebate of taxation calculated at 10 cents for each dollar of interest received.
content.name: Rebate Loan Interest Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for a complying superannuation entity entitled to a rebate of tax under legislation (ITAA 36 section 160AAB (5A)) where an 'eligible 26 AH amount' is included in its assessable income under ITAA36 section 26AH. These amounts are reversionary bonuses (i.e. bonuses paid on maturity, forfeiture or surrender of a life assurance policy) received under short-term life assurance policies issued by a life office whose investment income was not tax exempt or by a State Government Insurance Office or friendly society. The rebate can be offset against tax payable from any source, but is not refundable.
content.name: Tax Offset Claim Reversionary Bonus Rebate Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for all distributions from trusts that are not subject to taxation in the hands of the superannuation entity. This may include distributions from pooled superannuation trusts or a distribution of capital by a trust.
Tax deferred distributions must not be included.
content.name: Income Tax Exempt Income Received Via Trust Distribution Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from credit cards.
content.name: Income Interest Loans And Advances Credit Cards Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from housing loans.
content.name: Income Interest Loans And Advances Housing Loans Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the total of all investment income that is receivable by the entity. Includes (but is not limited to): Interest, dividends, unit trust distributions, and rental income that is accrued but not yet received. Do not include receivables relating to sales of investments or outstanding fees.

Assets are to be measured at net market value.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Investment Income Receivable Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the accumulated balance of impairment charges against the identified asset as at the reporting date.
content.guidance:
The amount of any provision for doubtful debts that relates to the investment income receivables.

Doubtful debt means it is no longer considered probable that amounts of accrued investment income (e.g. interest, dividends, distributions associated with the investment/asset) will be able to be collected by the entity.

Assets are to be measured at net market value.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Impairment Investment Income Receivable Gross Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the total of all investment income that is receivable by the entity net of any related provisions for doubtful debts. Includes (but is not limited to): Interest, dividends, unit trust distributions, and rental income that is accrued but not yet received. Do not include receivables relating to sales of investments or outstanding fees.
Assets are to be measured at net market value.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Investment Income Receivable Net Amount
Assets Other Financial Assets Member Contributions Receivable Amount
Assets Other Financial Assets Employer Contributions Receivable Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for  amounts receivable from Commonwealth and State Governments in respect of recognised unfunded liabilities to superannuation entities for public sector employees.
Assets are to be measured at net market value.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Government Contributions Receivable Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from lease financing.
content.name: Income Interest Loans And Advances Lease Financing Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for proceeds receivable on insurance claims that have been made or accepted by the insurer during the reporting period, but are not yet received from the insurer as at the end of the reporting period. Amounts should only be reported here when they are recognised for accounting purposes in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards. Assets are to be measured at net market value.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Insurance Proceeds Receivable Amount
Assets Investment Placements Loans And Debt Securities Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the reporting party's holdings of real property that has not been completed, i.e. where the value of the holding is not contingent on the development being approved or completed.
content.name: Assets Investment Real Estate Property Incomplete Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the  reporting party's holdings of real property that has been completed, i.e. where the value of the holding is contingent on the development being approved or completed.
content.name: Assets Investment Real Estate Property Complete Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for amounts placed with external individually managed mandates/portfolios or discretely managed portfolio where the asset portfolio is tailored for or chosen by the superannuation entity.

Assets are to be measured at net market value.
content.name: Assets Individually Managed Mandates And Portfolios Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the balancing item in the list in which it is being used.
content.name: Income Interest Loans And Advances Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all other securities that are not categorised elsewhere.
content.name: Assets Investment Securities Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the item to include but are not limited to the following:
- Securities sold under agreements to repurchase;
- Drawn down balance of overdraft facilities, standby lines or other forms of off-balance sheet funding; and
- Short-term loans or borrowings.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Including Off Balance Sheet Borrowings Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for total borrowings that are secured against the assets of the reporting entity, regardless of their expected repayment term i.e. total of both current and noncurrent borrowings.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Secured Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for other legal debts or obligations that arise during the course of business operation. This is a balancing item within the list in which it is being used.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from overdrafts.
content.name: Income Interest Loans And Advances Overdrafts Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for members' accrued benefits. This is to be determined in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards. The liability for accrued benefits for a defined contribution superannuation entity is the superannuation entity's present obligation to pay benefits to members and beneficiaries in the future and is calculated as the difference between the carrying amounts of the assets and the carrying amounts of the liabilities and reserves. Accrued benefits of a defined benefit superannuation entity shall be measured, using actuarial assumptions and valuations where appropriate, as the present value of expected future payments to members arising from membership of the superannuation entity up to the measurement date. In absence of formal actuarial review, the amount is calculated as the difference between the carrying amounts of the assets and the carrying amounts of the liabilities.
content.name: Equity Liability For Allocated Accrued Benefits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for defined benefit superannuation entities. The excess/deficiency of assets available for use for a defined benefit superannuation entity will be determined by an actuary when a formal valuation is conducted. Accordingly, only complete this item where this is applicable.
content.name: Equity Excess Or Deficiency Of Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the amount of interest income derived from term loans.
content.name: Income Interest Loans And Advances Term Loans Amount

content.definition: The amount of expenses incurred in cleaning.
content.name: Expense Operating Cleaning Amount

content.definition: The amount of legal fees paid on a particular item.
content.name: Expense Operating Legal Fees Amount

content.definition: The amount incurred on water charges during the reporting period.
content.name: Expense Operating Water Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.name: Profit Or Loss Non Current Assets And Disposal Groups Classified Held For Sale Not Qualifying As Discontinued Operations Amount

content.definition: For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
content.name: Profit Or Loss After Tax And Discontinued Operations And Before Minority Interest Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for total gross premium revenue.
content.name: Income Prospective Premium Revenue Gross Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the premium revenue less outwards reinsurance expense.
content.name: Income Prospective Premium Revenue Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the total of demands made against insurance policies.
content.name: Expense Prospective Incurred Claims Gross Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the sum of revenue from reinsurance recoveries on direct business and inwards reinsurance business. In relation to future years, this will reflect any movement in the value of expected reinsurance recoveries that are associated with insurance liabilities recognised in the measurement of Premium Liabilities. The amount of recoveries received or receivable associated with claims for current and prior years are also included.
content.name: Income Prospective Recoveries Reinsurance Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the balancing item within the list in which it is being used.
content.name: Income Prospective Recoveries Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the revenue from all recoveries in respect of claims. Where appropriate, other recoveries revenue is to be reported net of the reinsurer's share of other recoveries revenue. It includes any movement in the value of expected reinsurance recoveries in relation to future years. It also includes the amount of recoveries received or receivable associated with claims for current and prior years.
content.name: Income Prospective Recoveries Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the net claims being gross claims less recoveries revenue.
content.name: Expense Prospective Incurred Claims Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for all acquisition costs as recognised under Australian Accounting Standards. Acquisition costs are incurred in obtaining and recording new business contracts. They include commission or brokerage paid to agents or brokers for obtaining business for the reporting party, selling and underwriting costs such as advertising and risk assessment, the administrative costs of accepting, issuing and initially recording the new business.
content.name: Expense Prospective Underwriting Acquisition Costs Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the relevant period, of levies and charges payable by the reporting party and determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Levies And Charges Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, for recognised upfront fees and commission revenue related to the insurance business. This does not include 'premium rebates' received from reinsurers.

For regulatory reporting purposes it is fully recognised from the date of acceptance of the risk. Do not defer and amortise in accordance with Accounting Standards.
content.name: Income Prospective Commission Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for a subtotal item within the list in which it is being used.
content.name: Expense Prospective Underwriting Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the underwriting results is the net premium revenue less claims and direct underwriting expenses.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Prospective Underwriting Result Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the profit or loss of an entity before income tax, for the purposes of prudential reporting using prospective accounting basis.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Prospective Continuing Operations Before Tax Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for the net profit or loss of an entity after income tax, for the purposes of prudential reporting using prospective accounting basis.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Prospective Continuing Operations After Tax Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the relevant period, of net profit or loss after tax, calculated in accordance with prospective accounting principles
content.name: Profit Or Loss Prospective After Income Tax Attributable To Company Members Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the relevant period,  that has been transferred to (from) retained profits from (to) reserves, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards
content.name: Equity Transfers To From Retained Profits From To Reserves Amount

content.definition: Report the value of funds received and allocated to retained earnings during the report period. This item refers only to funds that are capital contributions and are not required to be repaid.
content.name: Equity Capital Contributions Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, for that component of gross claims expense which is due to changes in modelling assumptions applied to outstanding claims provision.
content.name: Expense Prospective Claims Expense Due To Valuation Assumptions Changes Or Model Not Included In Underwriting Result Gross Amount
