content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of amortisation charged to profit and loss in respect of intangible assets with a finite life as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Amortisation Intangible Assets Finite Life Amount

content.definition: This is the value of amortisation charged to profit and loss in respect of intangible assets other than those with a finite life as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Amortisation Intangible Assets Infinite Life Amount

content.definition: This is the value of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of plant and equipment as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Plant And Equipment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of property as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Property Amount

content.definition: This is the value of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of investment in controlled entities in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Controlled Entities Amount

content.definition: This is the value of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of investment in associates and joint ventures in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Associates Joint Ventures Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of goodwill as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Goodwill Amount

content.definition: This is the value of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of intangible assets other than goodwill as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Intangible Assets Non Goodwill Amount
Expense Operating Impairment Tangible Assets Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value of impairment charged to profit and loss in respect of impairment losses on financial assets not measured at fair value through profit or loss, as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Losses Financial Assets Not Measured FV Through PL Amount

content.definition: This is the value of reversals of impairment losses on financial assets as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Impairment Losses Reversals Financial Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value of non-lending losses and fraud expenses for the relevant period as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Fraud Losses Non Lending Amount
Expense Operating Other Per ARF_330_3 Item 4_9 Amount

content.definition:
This is the net value of realised gains and losses in relation to the disposal of all debt and equity securities during the relevant period.

Securities are paper certificates (definitive securities) or electronic records (book-entry securities) evidencing ownership of equity or debt obligations.
content.name: Income Realised Gain Loss Securities Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, during the relevant period, of the net realised gains and losses in relation to the disposal of derivatives during the relevant period.

Derivatives are generally defined as those instruments/contracts, where the value is based on other products, and/or on prices associated with financial products. Derivative contracts involve:
- Future delivery, receipt or exchange of financial items such as cash or another derivative instrument; or
- Future exchange of real assets for financial items where the contract may be tradeable and has a market value.
The contracts can either be binding on both parties (e.g. as with a currency swap) or subject to the exercise by one party of a right contained within the contract (as with options).

This item excludes foreign exchange gains (losses) from currency conversions of derivatives.
content.name: Income Realised Gain Loss Derivatives Net Amount

content.definition: Record any fee income or commission associated with the lending activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Commissions Lending Amount

content.definition: Record any service fee income associated with the deposit-taking activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Service Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of any fee income or commission associated with funds management activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Commissions Funds Management Amount

content.definition: Record any fee income or commission associated with the broking activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Commissions Broking Amount

content.definition: Record any fee income or commission associated with the syndication activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Commissions Syndication Amount

content.definition: Record any fee income or commission associated with the corporate advisory activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Commissions Corporate Advisory Amount

content.definition: Record any fee income or commission associated with the securitisation activities of the reporting party.
content.name: Income Fees Commissions Securitisation Amount
Income Fees Commissions Other ARF_330_2 Amount

content.definition: This is the change in the excess of the market value over the net assets of life insurance subsidiaries in which the reporting party has invested, that has been recognised as income in the relevant period, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Income Insurance Life Movement Excess NMV Over Net Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the net value of realised gains and losses in relation to the disposal of intangible assets during the relevant period.
content.name: Income Realised Gain Loss Intangible Assets Amount
Income Unrealised Gain Loss Other ARF_330_2 Amount

content.definition: This is the value of unrealised gains or losses from the revaluation of plant and equipment.
content.name: Income Unrealised Gain Loss Plant Equipment Amount

content.definition:
This is, for the duration of the relevant period, the net value of unrealised gains and (losses) from the revaluation of the reporting party's investment property portfolio, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Investments are assets or liabilities acquired or incurred principally for profit-taking purposes.

Gains (losses) are realised where the entity disposed of an asset during the relevant period. If an asset has not been disposed of during the relevant period, then any increases or decreases in the fair value of the asset are recognised as unrealised gains (losses).
content.name: Income Unrealised Gain Loss Investment Property Amount

content.definition:
This is the net value of unrealised gains and (losses) in relation to the disposal of equity securities during the relevant period.

Securities are paper certificates (definitive securities) or electronic records (book-entry securities) evidencing ownership of equity or debt obligations.
content.name: Income Unrealised Gain Loss Equity Securities Net Amount

content.definition: This is the net value of unrealised gains and losses in relation to the disposal of intangible assets during the relevant period.
content.name: Income Unrealised Gain Loss Intangible Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value of property held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, in accordance with the classification and measurement basis under the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Property Amount

content.definition: This is the value of plant and equipment held by the reporting party as at the relevant date in accordance  with the classification and measurement basis defined by the accounting standards. This item excludes all Information technology costs, both tangible and intangible.
content.name: Assets Plant And Equipment Excluding IT Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the principal amount of loans and advances provided, including any accrued interest, net of associated provisions for impairment and deferred fee income. Loans and advances are those financial assets measured at the appropriate valuation method and categorised as "Loans and receivables" in the relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Advances Including Accrued Interest Net Provisions Impairment And Deferred Fee Income Amount

content.definition: This is the value of assets classified as information technology held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Information Technology Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of assets classified as information technology held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.

For the purpose of this item exclude development and other on costs. These costs typically include, but are not limited to, those associated with software development, hardware installation, and relevant overheads.
content.name: Assets Information Technology Excluding Development And On Costs Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of assets classified as information technology held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards. 

For the purpose of this item only report the value of development and other on costs. These costs typically include, but are not limited to, those associated with software development, hardware installation, and relevant overheads.
content.name: Assets Information Development And On Costs Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of fixed assets held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, other than those classified as, property, plant and equipment or information technology. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Fixed Excluding Property Plant Equipment And IT Amount

content.definition: The amount of interest income derived from holdings of securities and recognised as income under the Accounting Standards during the relevant period.  Securities are paper certificates (definitive securities) or electronic records (book-entry securities) evidencing ownership of equity or debt obligations.
content.name: Income Interest Securities Amount

content.definition: The amount of interest income derived from anything other than securities and recognised as income under the Accounting Standards during the relevant period.  Securities are paper certificates (definitive securities) or electronic records (book-entry securities) evidencing ownership of equity or debt obligations.
content.name: Income Interest Not Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of assets classified as fixed or operational assets held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards. 

For the purpose of this item include property held for both operational and investment purposes.
content.name: Assets Fixed Including Investment Property Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of intangible assets other than loan and credit card servicing rights  held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which are deemed to have a finite life. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards. 

Loan and credit card servicing rights are those rights to receive existing loan payments and credit card receivables in consideration for providing lending and credit card services to those customers.
content.name: Assets Intangible Finite Life Excluding Loan Credit Card Servicing Rights Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of intangible assets held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which are deemed to have an infinite life. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards. 

For the purposes of this item exclude goodwill.
content.name: Assets Intangible Infinite Life Excluding Goodwill Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of goodwill net of impairment. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.

Goodwill is calculated as the excess of the cost of a business combination over the acquirer's interest in the net fair value of the identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities. It represents the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognised.
content.name: Assets Intangible Goodwill Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of intangible assets held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards. 

For the purposes of this item exclude all information technology assets.
content.name: Assets Intangible Excluding Information Technology Amount

content.definition: The amount of interest expense incurred in relation to holdings of securities and recognised as expense under the Accounting Standards during the relevant period.  Securities are paper certificates (definitive securities) or electronic records (book-entry securities) evidencing ownership of equity or debt obligations.
content.name: Expense Interest Securities Amount

content.definition: The amount of interest expense incurred in relation to anything other than securities and recognised as expense under the Accounting Standards during the relevant period.  Securities are paper certificates (definitive securities) or electronic records (book-entry securities) evidencing ownership of equity or debt obligations.
content.name: Expense Interest Not Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of capitalised expenses other than those which are classified as:
- debt raising or funding costs;
- establishment or set up costs of securitisation vehicles/programs; and
- loan and lease origination fees and commissions paid to mortgage originators and brokers.

The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Other Capitalised Expenses Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of derivative financial instruments held by the reporting entity. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
A derivative is a financial instrument that is derived from some other asset, index, value or other variable (known as the underlying). Derivatives allow risk about the price of the underlying asset to be transferred from one party to another.
content.name: Assets Derivative Financial Instruments Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value of wages and salaries expenditure, including the value of any provisions for employee entitlements but excluding the value of any employer superannuation contributions, as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Wages Salaries Including Provisions Employee Entitlements Excluding Superannuation Amount

content.definition: This is the value of operating lease payments in relation to the occupation of buildings that have been expensed in the relevant period in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Lease Building Amount

content.definition: This is the value of operating lease payments in relation to office equipment, fixtures and fittings that have been expensed in the relevant period in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Lease Equipment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of postage, mailing and courier costs expensed during the relevant period in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Postage Mailing Courier Amount

content.definition: This is the value of telecommunications expenses determined in accordance with accounting standards
content.name: Expense Operating Telecommunications Amount

content.definition: This is the value of insurance premiums. other than those for workers' compensation, that have been expensed in the relevant period in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Insurance Premiums Not Workers Compensation Amount

content.definition: This is the value of advertising costs expensed during the relevant period, other than those for sponsorship and those related to employee costs. Advertising expenses are the costs incurred by a business for promotional and publicity campaigns aimed at bringing the activities of the business to the attention of consumers for the purpose of increasing sales.
content.name: Expense Operating Advertising Not Sponsorship Or Employee Amount

content.definition: This is the value of advertising costs paid or payable to advertising agencies only, that have been expensed during the relevant period, other than those for sponsorship. Advertising expenses are the costs incurred by a business for promotional and publicity campaigns aimed at bringing the activities of the business to the attention of consumers for the purpose of increasing sales.
content.name: Expense Operating Advertising Agencies Amount

content.definition: This is the value of advertising costs paid or payable directly to radio or television stations only, that have been expensed during the relevant period, other than those for sponsorship. Advertising expenses are the costs incurred by a business for promotional and publicity campaigns aimed at bringing the activities of the business to the attention of consumers for the purpose of increasing sales.
content.name: Expense Operating Advertising Radio TV Direct Amount

content.definition: This is the value of advertising costs paid or payable directly to newspaper organisations, that have been expensed during the relevant period, other than those for sponsorship. Advertising expenses are the costs incurred by a business for promotional and publicity campaigns aimed at bringing the activities of the business to the attention of consumers for the purpose of increasing sales.
content.name: Expense Operating Advertising Press Direct Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of advertising costs that have been expensed during the relevant period, other than those for sponsorship and other than those paid to:
- advertising agencies
- directly to radio and television stations; or
- directly to newspaper organisations.

Advertising expenses are the costs incurred by a business for promotional and publicity campaigns aimed at bringing the activities of the business to the attention of consumers for the purpose of increasing sales.
content.name: Expense Operating Advertising Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value of paper, printing and stationery expenses incurred for office supplies and printing carried out by or for the reporting party during the relevant period.
content.name: Expense Operating Paper Printing Stationery Amount

content.definition: This is the value of data processing services recognised as expense during the relevant period in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Data Processing Amount

content.definition: This is the value of expenses recognised in relation to payments to consultants, institutions or other businesses for the provision of staff training and education services.
content.name: Expense Operating Staff Training Services Amount

content.definition: This is the amount incurred on travelling, accommodation and entertainment expenses. Travelling costs are costs incurred for transportation services relating to business activities which occur away from the normal place of business. These costs are only to be included if they are incurred in connection with business activities. Accommodation expenses are those costs incurred in providing accommodation to staff when business activities occur away from the normal place of business. Entertainment expenses are the costs incurred by a business for the provision of entertainment activities.
content.name: Expense Operating Travel Accommodation Entertainment Amount

content.definition: Record the total of any commission expense incurred by the reporting party during the relevant period.
content.name: Expense Operating Commissions Amount

content.definition: This is the value of  land rates assessed to the reporting party levied by local Government for the provision of local Government services.
content.name: Expense Operating Land Rates Amount

content.definition: This is the value of electricity and gas expenses incurred by the reporting party during the relevant period.
content.name: Expense Operating Electricity Gas Amount

content.definition: This is the total value of all the selected expenses in Part A of forms ARF_332_0 and RRF_332_0.
content.name: Expense Operating Selected Expenses ARF332 Amount
Labour Statistics Employees Per ARF332 Count

content.definition: Capital expenditure is the expenditure by an entity of a significant amount for the purchase or improvement of a fixed asset; the amount expended would warrant the item being depreciated over an estimated useful life of a reasonably extended period. Capital expenditure is not charged against the profits of the entity when it takes place, but is regarded as an investment to be capitalised in the balance sheet as a fixed asset and subsequently charged against profits by depreciating the asset over its estimated useful life. Capital expenditure for computer hardware is limited to computer hardware and associated capitalised costs only (e.g. legal fees) and does not include capital expenditure on any other asset types.
content.name: Capital Expenditure Hardware Amount

content.definition: This is the value of capital expenditure on electronic and electrical machinery incurred during the relevant period other than computer hardware and communications equipment.
content.name: Capital Expenditure Electrical Machinery Amount
Capital Expenditure Plant Equipment Other Amount

content.definition: This is the total value of capital expenditure during the relevant period. Capital expenditure is the expenditure by an entity of a significant amount for the purchase or improvement of a fixed asset; the amount expended would warrant the item being depreciated over an estimated useful life of a reasonably extended period. Capital expenditure is not charged against the profits of the entity when it takes place, but is regarded as an investment to be capitalised in the balance sheet as a fixed asset and subsequently charged against profits by depreciating the asset over its estimated useful life.
content.name: Capital Expenditure Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value of employee expenses other than wages and salaries that have been capitalised during the relevant period and included in the value of total capital expenditure for the relevant period.
content.name: Capital Expenditure Employees Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the proceeds on disposals of plant and equipment recognised in the accounts during the relevant period.
content.name: Assets Disposal Proceeds Plant Equipment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the proceeds on disposals of land recognised in the accounts during the relevant period.
content.name: Assets Disposal Proceeds Land Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the proceeds on disposals of buildings and other structures recognised in the accounts during the relevant period.
content.name: Assets Disposal Proceeds Buildings Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the proceeds on disposals of intangibles recognised in the accounts during the relevant period.
content.name: Assets Disposal Proceeds Intangibles Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the reporting party's defined benefit assets as at the relevant date. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Defined Benefit Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_320_0, report the value of all other 'other assets' as per item 9.13.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_320 9_13 Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_321_0, report the value of all other 'other assets' as per item 9.9.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_321 9_9 Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_322_0, report the value of all other 'other assets' as per item 11.15.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_322 11_15 Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_323_0, report the value of all other 'other assets' as per item 10.12.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_323 10_12 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_323_0, report the value of all 'other assets' as per item 10.13.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_323 10_13 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_322_0, report the value of all 'other assets' as per item 11.16.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_322 11_16 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_321_0, report the value of all 'other assets' as per item 9.10.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_321 9_10 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is used.

For the purposes of ARF_320_0, report the value of all 'other assets' as per item 9.14.
content.name: Assets Other ARF_320 9_14 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of deposits, debt securities and loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date and which are of a subordinated nature. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards. 

A subordinated asset is typically an asset that ranks below other assets of the same nature should the company be wound up.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Deposits Debt Securities And Loans Subordinated Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of deposits, debt securities and loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date and which are of a secured nature. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards. 

A secured asset is typically an asset that ranks above other assets of the same nature should the company be wound up.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Deposits Debt Securities And Loans Secured Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of deposits, debt securities and loans on issue by the reporting party, as at the relevant date, and which are not subordinated or secured in nature. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.

A subordinated item is typically an item that ranks below other items of the same nature should the company be wound up.

A secured item is typically an item that ranks above other items of the same nature should the company be wound up.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deposits Debt Securities And Loans Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value of assets held by the reporting party as at the relevant date that have been sold to or originated into a special purpose vehicle (SPV). These securitised assets must meet APRA's operational requirements for regulatory capital relief under the relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Securitised Special Purpose Vehicle Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of Bills of Exchange held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and that have been accepted by a bank. The value of this item is to be determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards and legislative acts where applicable.

A bill of exchange is an unconditional order drawn (issued) by one party, sent to another party for acceptance and made out to, or to the order of, a third party, or the bearer. It is a negotiable instrument that binds each endorser of the bill to pay on redemption should the acceptor fail to do so. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Bills Of Exchange Bank Accepted Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of Bills of Exchange held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and that have not been accepted by a bank. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.

A bill of exchange is an unconditional order drawn (issued) by one party, sent to another party for acceptance and made out to, or to the order of, a third party, or the bearer. It is a negotiable instrument that binds each endorser of the bill to pay on redemption should the acceptor fail to do so. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Bills Of Exchange Not Bank Accepted Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of debt securities held by the reporting party. For the purposes of this item, exclude those debt securities which are classified as bills of exchange. The value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.A debt security is a transferable instrument evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.A bill of exchange is an unconditional order drawn (issued) by one party, sent to another party for acceptance and made out to, or to the order of, a third party, or to bearer. It is a negotiable instrument that binds each endorser of the bill to pay on redemption should the acceptor fail to do so. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Not Bills Of Exchange Amount

content.definition: This is the value of settlement account balances due by the reporting party as at the relevant date.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Settlement Accounts Due Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of the reporting party's acceptances as at the relevant date. Acceptances comprise undertakings by the reporting party to pay bills of exchange drawn on customers. These bills of exchange are not held as part of the reporting party's asset portfolio. 

Acceptances are accounted for and disclosed as a liability with a corresponding contra asset. The contra asset is recognised to reflect the reporting party's claim against each drawer of the bills of exchange. The measurement and classification basis used is to be in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Bill Acceptances Amount

content.definition: This is the value of debt securities on issue by the reporting party as at the relevant date, excluding those debt securities classified as negotiable certificates of deposit. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Excluding NCDs Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of Loans, being liabilities incurred by the reporting party through the lending of funds to it via means of a non-tradeable document, certificate or security. This excludes the situation where the funds are deposited with the reporting party.

For the purposes of this item exclude loan capital and subordinated loans, as determined in accordance with prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loans Excluding Loan Capital Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of all debt securities other than those classified as sold under agreements to repurchase, notes or negotiable certificates of deposit. The value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of the reporting party's borrowings as at the relevant date. This subtotal item represents the sum of the following:
- debt securities, excluding negotiable certificates of deposit, preference shares and convertible notes; and
- loans, being liabilities incurred by the reporting party through the lending of funds to it via means of a non-tradeable document, certificate or security. This excludes the situation where the funds are deposited with the reporting party.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Excluding Deposits Amount
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Provisions Other BS ARF320 Series Excluding ARF322 Amount
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Provisions Other BS ARF322 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of deposits, debt securities and loans on issue by the reporting party as at the relevant date and which are of a secured nature. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.

A secured item is typically an item that ranks above other items of the same nature should the company be wound up.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deposits Debt Securities And Loans Secured Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of deposits, debt securities and loans on issue by the reporting party as at the relevant date and which are of a subordinated nature. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.

A subordinated item is typically an item that ranks below other items of the same nature should the company be wound up.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deposits Debt Securities And Loans Subordinated Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of deposits, debt securities and loans held by the reporting party, as at the relevant date, and which are not subordinated or secured in nature. This item is to be determined in accordance with the accounting standards.

A subordinated item is typically an item that ranks below other items of the same nature should the company be wound up.

A secured item is typically an item that ranks above other items of the same nature should the company be wound up.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Deposits Debt Securities And Loans Other Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the receivable due in relation to debt securities purchased under agreements to resell or stock borrowing as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Purchased Under Agreements To Resell Or Stock Borrowing Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the receivable due in relation to equity securities purchased under agreements to resell or stock borrowing as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Equity Securities Purchased Under Agreements To Resell Or Stock Borrowing Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the amount payable in relation to debt securities sold under agreements to repurchase or stock lending as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Debt Securities Sold Under Agreements To Repurchase Or Stock Lending Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the amount payable in relation to equity securities sold under agreements to repurchase or stock lending as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Equity Securities Sold Under Agreements To Repurchase Or Stock Lending Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of issued share capital other than ordinary and preference shares.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Not Ordinary Preference Amount
Equity Reserves Other ARF320 Series Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all deposits other than demand deposits. Demand deposits are those withdrawable or redeemable within 24 hours. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Non Demand Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of 'Other Investments' as per Item 8.5 on form ARF_322_0.
content.name: Assets Investment Other ARF 322 0 Item 8 5 Amount
Assets Investment Total Other ARF322 Item 8 6 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of term deposits held by the reporting party as at the relevant date of accounts for which the reporting party has issued a cheque book, and which are classified as non-interest bearing accounts.

Deposits are amounts which are redeemable or withdrawable by depositors from the reporting party.

Term deposits refer to an account in which money has been placed for a fixed period of time for a stated interest rate.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Non Interest Bearing Term Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all funds placed with a financial institution on deposit.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Deposits Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of Bills of Exchange held by the reporting party as at the relevant date that have been accepted, or accepted and endorsed, by the reporting party.

A bill of exchange is an unconditional order drawn (issued) by one party, sent to another party (usually a bank) for acceptance and made out to, or to the order of, a third party, or to bearer.

Accepted bills of exchange have been signed by an entity as the drawee which 'accepts' liability to pay out the funds on the due date.

Endorsement of a bill of exchange creates a contingent liability by the endorser to pay out the funds conditional on the bearer/holder demanding payment
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Bills Of Exchange Accepted Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of Bills of Exchange held by the reporting party as at the relevant date that have been accepted by parties other than an Approved Deposit-taking Institution  and endorsed as the first endorser by the reporting party.

A bill of exchange is an unconditional order drawn (issued) by one party, sent to another party (usually a bank) for acceptance and made out to, or to the order of, a third party, or to bearer.

Endorsement of a bill of exchange creates a contingent liability by the endorser to pay out the funds conditional on the bearer/holder demanding payment.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Bills Of Exchange Non ADI Endorsed Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of Bills of Exchange held by the reporting party as at the relevant date that have been:

(a)  accepted, or accepted and endorsed, by the reporting party; or 

(b) accepted by anyone other than an Approved Deposit-taking Institution and endorsed as the first endorser by the reporting party.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Bills Of Exchange Own Acceptance And Non ADI Endorsed Amount
Assets Investment Total Other ARF 321 Item 6 6 Amount

content.definition: This is the value of loans and advances receivable by the reporting party as at the relevant date, including tainted held-to-maturity investments. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Advances Including Tainted Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of interest accrued but not yet received and not accounted for elsewhere on APRA form RRF320.0.
Exclude:
- interest added to loan accounts; and
- interest accrued on securities included in their carrying value.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Interest Accrued Other RRF320 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of debt securities on issue by the reporting party, as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.

For the purposes of this item, include hybrid securities classified as debt securities, loan capital, and certificates of deposit.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Including CDs Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Amount

content.definition: This is amounts drawn down on new loans and any increases (top-up amounts) on existing loans held by the reporting party during the relevant period. This represents the gross increase in credit associated with newly originated term loans as well as redraws on existing fixed-term loans.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Drawdowns And Redraws Amount

content.definition: This is the value of scheduled repayments (interest plus principal) during the relevant period in accordance with the conditions of term loans held by the reporting party.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Scheduled Repayments Amount

content.definition: This is the value of term loans net of scheduled repayments, that are repaid in full during the relevant period as a result of the borrower either selling or refinancing the loan held by the reporting party.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Excess Repayments Due To Sale Or Refinancing Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of term loans, net of scheduled repayments, that are repaid in full during the relevant period, and which are not due to the borrower either selling or refinancing the loan held by the reporting party. 

For the purposes of this item exclude term loans that were in payment deficiency.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Excess Repayments Excluding Sale Refinancing Or Deficiencies Amount

content.definition:
This is the value by which scheduled interest payments and principal repayments exceeded actual repayments for term loans held by the reporting party that was in payment deficiency as at the relevant date.

For the purposes of this item exclude term loans that did not record a payment deficiency.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Excess Repayment Deficiencies Amount

content.definition: This is the value of term loans held by the reporting party which have been written-off during the relevant period. This is net of any amounts recovered from previously written-off term loans that were subsequently recovered during the period.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Net Write Off Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is, for the duration of the relevant period, the value of any other adjustments to outstanding term loans, as required to be reported on Table 1 of APRA form ARF_320_8.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Other Adjustments ARF 320 8 Amount

content.definition:
This is the balance outstanding of term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, with an offset account attached to them. This balance is gross of offset deposit accounts.

An offset account is typically a deposit account in which the balance is either wholly or party offset against the loan balance for the purposes of calculating interest.

Where the account is an all-in-one facility (that is, where the loan and deposits are effectively combined in a single account) and it is not possible to separate the loan balance form the borrower's deposits, report the net balance of the account.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Offset Amount

content.definition:
This is the balance in deposit accounts that are offset against the balance of outstanding term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date.

An offset account is typically a deposit account in which the balance is either wholly or partly offset against the loan balance for the purposes of calculating interest.

Where the account is an all-in-one facility (that is, where the loan and deposits are effectively combined in a single account) and it is not possible to separate the loan balance form the borrower's deposits, report zero for those accounts.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Offset Against Term Loans Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of all financial assets that have not been reported elsewhere on APRA form RRF 320.0
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Balancing Item Form RRF320 Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of all non financial assets other than receivables from operating leases of terms of one year or more for tangible assets (e.g. motor vehicles and other plant and equipment, but not land & buildings)
content.name: Assets Other Non Financial Assets Balancing Item RRF320 Amount

content.definition: This is the balance of interest only term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Interest Only Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is used.

This is the value of all non financial assets plus the value of financial assets other than:
- Intangibles
- Loans and Advances
- Acceptance of customers
- Investment and Trading Securities; and
- Cash and Liquid Assets;
as determined in accordance with the requirements of APRA form RRF320.0
content.name: Assets Balancing Item RRF320 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date of reverse loans advanced by the reporting party.

Reverse loans allow for the borrowing of money against a secured asset, typically a primary residence in the case of reverse mortgage loans. Reverse loans do not require principal and interest payments until termination of the facility, which is not fixed and normally occurs when nominated borrowers die, vacate the mortgaged property or the asset is sold.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Reverse Product Amount

content.definition:
This is the balance outstanding of low-documentation loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. 

Low-documentation loans are generally loans where the lender has not, prior to loan approval, documented, assessed and verified the ability of the borrower to meet the repayment obligations. This is to be determined in accordance with prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Low Documentation Amount

content.definition: This is the value of Loans, being liabilities incurred by the reporting party through the lending of funds to it via means of a non-tradeable document, certificate or security. This excludes the situation where the funds are deposited with the reporting party.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loans Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any other non-standard term loans, as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, as required to be reported on APRA form ARF_320_8.

This balancing item represents all term loans other than those classified as any of the following:
- Loans with offset facilities;
- Interest only loans;
- Reverse loans; or
- Low-documentation loans.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Non Standard Other ARF 320 8 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of all liabilities as at the relevant date that are not:
- Deposits;
- Loans
- Derivatives; or
- Debt Securities
content.name: Liabilities Balancing Item RRF320 Amount

content.definition:
This is the number of individual term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date.

Term loans are non securitised debt financing with a specified maturity date by which the loan must be repaid. 

For the purposes of this form, exclude term loans previously written-off.
content.name: Assets Term Loans Count

content.definition:
This is the number of term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which have an offset account attached to them.

An offset account is typically a deposit account in which the balance is either wholly or party offset against the loan balance for the purposes of calculating interest.

For the purposes of this item exclude loans that have been written-off, but include all-in-one facilities (that is where the loan and deposits are effectively combined in a single account).
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Offset Count

content.definition:
This is the number of individual term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which have a redraw facility attached to them.

Term loans with redraw facilities are loans that allow the borrower to make advance repayments with the option of subsequently withdrawing the accumulated excess down to the extent of the loan balance specified in the loan schedule.

For the purposes of this form, exclude term loans written-off.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Redraw Facilities Count

content.definition:
This is the number of interest only term loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date.

For the purposes of this form, exclude term loans written-off.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Interest Only Count

content.definition:
This is the number of individual reverse loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date.

Reverse loans are generally loans where the loan is repayable when the borrower is deceased or, in the case of a reverse mortgage loan, no longer lives in the property.

For the purposes of this form, exclude term loans written-off.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Reverse Product Count

content.definition:
This is the number of individual low-documentation loans held by the reporting party as at the relevant date. 

Low-documentation loans are generally loans where the lender has not, prior to loan approval, documented, assessed and verified the ability of the borrower to meet the repayment obligations. This is to be determined in accordance with prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Low Documentation Count
Assets Loans And Receivables Term Non Standard Other ARF 320 8 Count

content.definition: This is the value of deposits and placements repayable by the reporting party as at the relevant date. Deposits are funds placed with the reporting party that are redeemable or withdrawable by the depositor. Placements are settlement account balances and items in the course of collection in relation to the payments system and security trades.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deposits Placements Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of term loans held by the reporting party and which were approved during the relevant period, irrespective of whether the funds have been advanced to the borrower.

Term loans are non securitised debt financing with a specified maturity date by which the loan must be repaid. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Approved Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of low-documentation term loans held by the reporting party and which were approved during the relevant period, irrespective of whether the funds have been advanced to the borrower. 

Low-documentation loans are generally loans where the lender has not, prior to loan approval, documented, assessed and verified the ability of the borrower to meet the repayment obligations. This is to be determined in accordance with prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Low Documentation Approved Amount

content.definition: This is the value of interest only term loans held by the reporting party and which were approved during the relevant period, irrespective of whether the funds have been advanced to the borrower.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Interest Only Approved Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of any other non-standard term loans held by the reporting party and approved during the relevant period, irrespective of whether the funds have been advanced to the borrower. This is to be determined in accordance with prudential standards and reported as required on APRA form ARF_320_8.

This balancing item represents all term loans other than those classified as any of the following
- Interest only loans; or
- Low-documentation loans.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Non Standard Approved Other ARF 320 8 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of term loans held by the reporting party which originated through a broker or other third party, and were approved during the relevant period, irrespective of whether the funds have been advanced to the borrower.

Term loans are non securitised debt financing with a specified maturity date by which the loan must be repaid. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Approved Third Party Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of term loans held by the reporting party which were approved during the relevant period, irrespective of whether the funds have been advanced to the borrower. 

For the purposes of this item only report those loans approved as an exception to the reporting party's serviceability policy, either by overriding a minimum requirement or any other mechanism that advances credit below the policy minimum.

Term loans are non securitised debt financing with a specified maturity date by which the loan must be repaid. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Term Approved Outside Serviceability Policy Amount

content.definition:
This is the value as at the relevant date of Notes issued by the reporting party.

A Note is an unconditional promise in writing made by one party to another, signed by the maker, engaging to pay on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time a sum certain in money for, or to the order of, a specified person or to bearer. It does not bind any other party to payment on redemption. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Notes Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value as at the relevant date of Debt Securities, other than Notes, issued by the reporting party.

A Note is an unconditional promise in writing made by the reporting party to another party, signed by the reporting party, engaging to pay on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time a sum certain in money for, or to the order of, a specified person or to bearer. It does not bind any other party to payment on redemption. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.

Debt securities are transferable instruments evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Other Than Notes Amount

content.definition: This is the value of debt securities on issue by the reporting entity. The value of this item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.guidance: A debt security is a transferable instrument evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. It is characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of all liabilities of the reporting party as at the relevant date other than those specifically identified elsewhere on APRA form RRF320.0
content.name: Liabilities Other RRF320 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the total of all liabilities classified as "Other Liabilities" in accordance with the instructions to APRA form RRF320.0
content.name: Liabilities Other Total RRF320 Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for payments and settlements due from financial institutions.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Payment Settlement Amount
Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Other RRF320 Amount
Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Other ARF320 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value as at the relevant date of Notes held by the reporting party.

A Note is an unconditional promise in writing made by one party to another, signed by the maker, engaging to pay on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time a sum certain in money for, or to the order of, a specified person or to bearer. It does not bind any other party to payment on redemption. These securities are issued at a discount to face value.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Notes Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of interest accrued but not paid as at the relevant date that has not been included in any other item on APRA form RRF320.0
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Interest Accrual RRF320 Amount

content.definition: This is the value of debt securities on issue by the reporting party as at the relevant date, excluding those debt securities classified as negotiable certificates of deposit, preference shares and convertible notes. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Debt Securities Excluding NCDs Preference Shares And Convertible Notes Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of General Reserves, as determined in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 111.

General reserves are created from the appropriation of profits by an entity (or the group of entities) after the payment of all dividends and tax. These may include:

     (a) reserves representing the offset to a charge to profit and loss of the entity arising from equity-settled share-based payments (i.e. shares and/or share options) granted to employees as part of their remuneration package (including any shares or share options granted to employees by way of bonus arrangements associated with their employment, and shares or share options granted to employees of an acquired institution in return for continued services). This is provided that:
          (i) the shares or share options granted relate only to the ordinary shares of the entity itself; and
          (ii) there are no circumstances in which such remuneration (including bonuses) can be realised, in part or full, other than by way of the issue of ordinary shares of the entity i.e. there is no right for remuneration to be converted to a payment in another form (e.g. cash).

All other reserves associated with share-based payments (refer to Australian accounting standard AASB 2 Share-based Payment) must be excluded from this item; and

     (b) cumulative unrealised gains or losses on hedges that offset gains or losses on reserves included in Tier 1 capital (e.g. movements in the currency value of foreign-currency-denominated hedging instruments which offset movements in foreign-currency-denominated items recognised in the foreign currency translation reserve). This includes fair value gains or losses on derivatives representing effective economic hedges of assets.

Exclude General Reserves for Credit Losses from this item.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy General Reserves Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of current year profits (or losses), as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Equity Current Year Earnings Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of retained earnings.

For the purposes of this item, exclude the value of  all current year earnings.
content.name: Equity Retained Earnings Excluding Current Year Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Fundamental Tier 1 capital. This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.

This item is to be reported gross of any applicable capital adequacy deductions.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Fundamental Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of minority interests arising from consolidation at Level 2 of the Tier 1 capital of subsidiaries. This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standard APS.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Attributable To Minority Interests Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Non-Innovative Residual Tier 1 capital. This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.

This item is to be reported gross of any applicable capital adequacy deductions.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Residual Non Innovative Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Innovative Tier 1 capital. This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.

Innovative Tier 1 capital is limited to 15 per cent of net Tier 1 capital, except for entities that are subject to APRA-approved transition arrangements. Any excess amount is counted as Upper Tier 2 capital.

This item to be reported gross of any applicable capital adequacy deductions.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Residual Innovative Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Residual Tier 1 capital. This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.

Residual Tier 1 capital represents the sum of Non-innovative Residual Tier 1 capital and Innovative Residual Tier 1 capital. Report this item gross of any applicable capital adequacy deductions.

Residual Tier 1 capital is limited to 25 per cent of net Tier 1 capital. Any excess amount is counted as Upper Tier 2 capital.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Residual Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Gross Tier 1 capital. This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.

Gross Tier 1 capital represents the sum of Fundamental Tier 1 capital and Residual Tier 1 capital, gross of Tier 1 capital deductions.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Gross Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net Tier 1 capital. 

Net Tier 1 capital represents the sum of Fundamental Tier 1 capital and Residual Tier 1 capital, net of total Tier 1 capital deductions.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Net Tier 1 Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the cash flow hedge reserve that relates to the hedging of items that are not recorded at fair value on the accounting balance sheet (including projected cash flows). This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Unrealised Fair Value Gains Net Effective Cash Flow Hedges Amount

content.definition: This is the net value, as at the relevant date, of any unrealised fair value gains and (losses) arising from changes in the reporting party's creditworthiness.
content.guidance: A gain may arise, for example, from a reduction in fair value of the reporting party's outstanding debt due to a change in credit rating.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Unrealised Change In Creditworthiness Fair Value Gains Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the intangible component of investments in non-consolidated subsidiaries arising on acquisition, net of amortisation and impairment.

Intangible assets are defined in accordance with Accounting Standards, but also include any other assets designated as intangible under Prudential Standard APS 111.
content.name: Financial Risk Intangible Assets in Non Consolidated Subsidiaries APS 111 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of capitalised loan and lease origination fees and commissions paid to mortgage originators and brokers. 

Loan/lease origination/broker fees and commissions that are capitalised as an asset are to be set off against the balance of upfront loan/lease fees associated with the lending portfolios that are treated as deferred income and recognised as a liability.

Where the net amount for loan/lease origination fees and commissions:

     (a) has a positive balance, this item must be reported as a positive figure.

     (b) has a negative balance, provided the deferred income satisfies the criteria set out in APS 111, this item may be reported as a negative figure. Where the criteria are not satisfied, this item must be reported as zero.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capitalised Loan Lease Origination Fees Commissions Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of capitalised costs associated with debt raisings and other similar transaction-related costs.

The balance of any transaction costs and like items that are capitalised and deferred as an asset must be netted off against the balance of any income deferred as a liability relating to the capitalised transaction costs.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capitalised Debt Raising Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of capitalised costs associated with issuing capital instruments.

The balance of any transaction costs and like items that are capitalised and deferred as an asset must be netted off against the balance of any income deferred as a liability relating to the capitalised transaction costs.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capitalised Issuing Capital Instruments Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of capitalised information technology software costs, capitalised in accordance with accounting standards.

The balance of any transaction costs and like items that are capitalised and deferred as an asset must be netted off against the balance of any income deferred as a liability relating to the capitalised transaction costs.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with the relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capitalised Information Technology Software Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used. This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other intangible assets.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Intangible Assets Other ARF 110 0 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reporting party's holdings of its own Tier 1 capital instruments, unless exempted by APRA. Include any unused trading limit on these instruments where agreed with APRA.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Holdings Of Own Tier 1 Capital Instruments Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all increases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances resulting from business combinations during the relevant period.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Increases Business Combinations Amount
Financial Risk Securitisation Costs Excluding Start Up And Establishment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all new increases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances that resulted in a charge to profit and loss during the relevant period.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Increases Charged to PL Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all decreases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances that resulted in a reversal or write back to profit and loss during the relevant period.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Decreases Charged to PL Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all decreases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances assessed on the collective basis due to transfers to specific provisions during the relevant period. Specific and Collective provisions are determined in accordance with the requirements of the International Financial Reporting Standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Collective Transfers To Accounting Specific Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all increases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances assessed on the collective basis due to transfers from specific provisions during the relevant period. Specific and Collective provisions are determined in accordance with the requirements of the International Financial Reporting Standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Collective Transfers From Accounting Specific Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all decreases in specific provisions for impairment of loans and advances due to transfers to provisions assessed on the collective basis during the relevant period. Specific and Collective provisions are determined in accordance with the requirements of the International Financial Reporting Standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Accounting Specific Transfers To Collective Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all increases in specific provisions for impairment of loans and advances due to transfers from provisions for impairment of loans and advances assessed on the collective basis during the relevant period. Specific and Collective provisions are determined in accordance with the requirements of the International Financial Reporting Standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Accounting Specific Transfers From Collective Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all decreases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances that were used to fund the write-off of facilities deemed to be bad debts during the relevant period.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Decreases Bad Debt Write Off Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all increases in provisions for impairment of loans and advances that were written back during the relevant period due to the recovery of funds previously deemed to be bad debts.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Increases Bad Debt Recovery Amount

content.definition: This is the net value of all increases/decreases during the relevant period in provisions for impairment of loans and advances that resulted from movements in foreign currency exchange rates.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions FX Adjustments Amount

content.definition: This is the value of net increases/decreases to General Reserves for Credit Losses (GRCL) during the relevant period due to transfers to/from retained earnings resulting from an excess or deficiency in GRCL in accordance with the requirements of the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions GRCL Net Transfers Retained Earnings Amount

content.definition: This is the value of bad debts not provided for that have been written off directly to profit and loss during the relevant period.
content.name: Expense Operating Bad Debts Direct To PL Amount

content.definition: This is the value of bad debt recoveries that have been written back directly to profit and loss during the relevant period.
content.name: Expense Operating Bad Debt Recoveries Direct To PL Amount

content.definition: This is the value of net increases/decreases to General Reserves for Credit Losses (GRCL) during the relevant period due to reasons other than transfers to/from retained earnings resulting from an excess or deficiency in GRCL in accordance with the requirements of the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions GRCL Net Transfers Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the aggregate surpluses in employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation plans, net of deferred tax liabilities (DTL). 

Report this item for superannuation funds as follows, where applicable:
     - At Level 1, in any of the reporting party's employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation funds; or
     - At Level 2, in any of the reporting party's or other Level 2 group member's employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation funds.

Surpluses and deficits must not be netted across employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation plans.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Employer Sponsored Defined Benefit Plans Surplus Net Deferred Tax Liabilities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the aggregate deficits in employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation plans, net of deferred tax assets (DTA).

Report this item for superannuation funds as follows, where applicable:
     - At Level 1, in any of the reporting party's employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation funds; or
     - At Level 2, in any of the reporting party's or other Level 2 group member's employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation funds.

For the purposes of this item, only include deficits to the extent not already reflected in Gross Tier 1 capital. Surpluses and deficits must not be netted across employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation plans.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Employer Sponsored Defined Benefit Plans Deficit Net Deferred Tax Assets Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any deductions (refer to APS 111) from Tier 1 capital due to a shortfall in Tier 2 capital. This occurs where the reporting party does not hold sufficient capital to absorb required deductions from Tier 2 capital, and it must deduct an amount equivalent to the shortfall in its Tier 2 capital from its Tier 1 capital. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Deduction Due to Shortfall in Tier 2 Capital Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any other Tier 1 specific capital deductions, as required to be reported on APRA forms ARF_110_0_1 and ARF_110_0_2. 

This item is reported as a deduction to Tier 1 capital for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Specific Deductions Other ARF 110 0 1 And ARF 110 0 2 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of equity exposures and other capital investments held by the reporting party.

For the purposes of this item, exclude equity exposures and other capital investments where:

     (a) the equity exposure or other capital investment is held for trading purposes, in which case it is to be included in the reporting party's risk weighted assets (RWA).
     (b) the equity exposure is acquired through underwriting of a new equity instrument and the equity instrument is disposed of within 90 days of the date of issue. If the equity instrument is not disposed of within 90 days of issuance, it must be deducted in accordance with the relevant limits for equity exposures and other capital investments, unless the position forms part of the reporting party's trading book; or
     (c) the equity exposure or other capital investment is held under a legal agreement on behalf of:
          (i) at Level 1 - an external third party, even if held in the name of the reporting party; or
          (ii) at Level 2 - a party outside the Level 2 consolidated group, even if held in the name of the reporting party (or another member of its Level 2 consolidated group.).

Where a facility, including a guarantee, provided to a related party or a non-related party constitutes 'capital support', it must be treated as 'other capital investments'.

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item. This amount is to be deducted from both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Equity Exposures And Capital Investments Fifty Per Cent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of guarantees and credit derivatives that provide for a materiality threshold and where the is an equivalent to retained first loss positions.

Equivalents to retained first loss positions arise:
     (a) where credit protection provides for a materiality threshold on payments below which no payment will be made in the event of loss.; and
     (b) in the context of securitisation, where there is partial coverage of an underlying exposure by a credit derivative, there is a difference in seniority between protected and unprotected tranches, and the credit derivative contract contains a materiality threshold.

This amount is capped at the amount of capital the reporting party would be required to hold against the full value of the exposure or underlying expose, as appropriate.

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item. This amount is to be deducted from both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.
