This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Guarantees And Credit Derivatives That Provide Materiality Threshold Fifty Per Cent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non-repayable loans advanced by the reporting party under APRA's certified industry support arrangements

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item. This amount is to be deducted from both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Non Repayable Loans APRA Certified Industry Support Arrangements Fifty Per Cent Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other deductions relating to securitisation. This item is reported as a deduction to Tier 1 capital for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with Accounting Standards, the Banking Act 1959, relevant Prudential Standards and associated Guidance Notes.

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item, being the deduction from Tier 1 capital. The other 50 per cent is to be reported as a deduction from Tier 2 capital.
content.name: Assets Securitisation Related Items Other 50 Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the shortfall in provisions for credit losses. 

The reporting party must compare:
     (a) the total expected loss (EL) amount (before any tax effects) for non-defaulted Internal Ratings Based (IRB) exposures to the total eligible provisions (net of any associated DTA) for non-defaulted IRB exposures; and
     (b) the total EL amount (before any tax effects) for defaulted IRB exposures to the total eligible provisions (net of any associated DTA) for defaulted IRB exposures.

In both cases, where the EL amount is higher than the eligible provisions, 50% of the difference must be reported at this item.

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item. This amount is to be deducted from both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Shortfall Provisions For Credit Losses IRB Fifty Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of unsettled non-DvP transactions. This represents the value transferred (including any replacement costs) and the positive current exposure of non-delivery-versus-payment (non-DvP) transactions that remain unsettled for five business days or more after their due delivery dates (refer APS 112 or APS 113, as appropriate)..

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item. This amount is to be deducted from both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Unsettled Non DvP Transactions Fifty Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of undercapitalised non-consolidated subsidiaries. This represents an amount that APRA has required the reporting party to deduct from its capital to cover the undercapitalisation of a non-consolidated subsidiary (or subsidiaries) of the reporting party.

This item represents a 50/50 capital adequacy deduction, therefore only report 50 per cent of the asset amount at this item. This amount is to be deducted from both Tier 1 and Tier 2 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Undercapitalised Non Consolidation Subsidiaries Fifty Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it appears.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other capital adequacy deductions that are required to be made 50 per cent from Tier 1 capital and 50 per cent from Tier 2 capital (i.e. 50/50 capital adequacy deductions), as required to be reported on APRA forms ARF_110_0_1 and ARF_110_0_2.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Other Fifty Percent ARF 110 0 1 And ARF 110 0 2 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all capital adequacy deductions that are required to be made 50 per cent from Tier 1 capital and 50 per cent from Tier 2 capital (i.e. 50/50 capital adequacy deductions). For the purposes of this item only report 50 per cent of the amount of the full deduction.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Deductions Fifty Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other Tier 1 capital adequacy deductions as advised by APRA.

This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy APRA Advised Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any other adjustments to Tier 1 capital as approved by APRA. This includes both reductions in deductions and additions to Tier 1 capital as well as transition amounts affecting Tier 1 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Adjustments APRA Approved Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total Tier 1 capital deductions.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Capital Deductions Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of paid up perpetual cumulative preference shares on issue by the reporting party.

This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Perpetual Cumulative Preference Shares Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of paid up perpetual cumulative mandatory preference shares on issue by the reporting party.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Perpetual Mandatory Preference Shares Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of paid up perpetual cumulative subordinated debt on issue by the reporting party.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Perpetual Cumulative Subordinated Debt Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any excess amounts of Tier 1 capital instruments ineligible for inclusion in Tier 1 capital due to the limits prescribed under relevant prudential standards, and which is now classed as Upper Tier 2 capital. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Excess Tier 1 Capital Instruments Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other Upper Tier 2 capital instruments perpetual and cumulative in nature,, as required to be reported on the APRA ARF_110_0 form series. These capital instruments must satisfy the relevant criteria under Prudential Standard APS 111.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 Perpetual Cumulative Capital Instruments Other ARF 110 0 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of General Reserve for Credit Losses (GRCL), net of tax, determined using the standardised approach to credit risk. Any deferred tax assets (DTA) associated with the collective provisions eligible to be included in the GRCL must be removed.

The amount reported at this item must be limited to 1.25% of Risk Weighted Assets.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy General Reserve For Credit Losses Net Deferred Tax Assets Standardised Approach Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of surplus provisions on non-defaulted exposures, determined using the internal ratings based (IRB) approach to credit risk. This amount is to be reported net of deferred tax assets associated with eligible collective provisions, and is limited to 0.6% of credit risk weighted assets (RWA) of the reporting party.

For non-defaulted exposures, when there is a surplus of total eligible provisions over the total expected loss (EL) amount, the difference is reported at this item (to a maximum of 0.6% of credit RWA) where the surplus provisions are eligible to be treated as General Reserve for Credit Losses (GRCL).

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy General Reserve For Credit Losses Surplus Provisions Non Defaulted Exposures Net Deferred Tax Assets Internal Ratings Based Approach Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reserves arising from the revaluation of readily marketable securities, but only where those securities are classified as Upper Tier 2 capital. The amount to be reported at this item is limited to 45 percent of the pre-tax revaluation reserves for this category of ARR.

Where a particular asset belongs to a class of assets for which the Asset Revaluation Reserve (ARR) are included in Upper Tier 2 capital and the asset has been identified as impaired and losses arise, the losses may be offset against any existing revaluations of the asset or class of revalued assets.

If the ARR is negative after adjustment for revaluations of assets included in the reserve, for losses due to impairment of assets covered by the reserve, and for any gains or losses on hedges offsetting revaluations of assets included in the reserve, report zero at this item. 

This item is net of any fair value gains and losses, and any gains or losses on hedges offsetting revaluations included in reserves.

For the purposes of this item, do not include any ARR amounts that have been included as Capital Profit Reserves.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 Asset Revaluation Reserve Readily Marketable Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reserves arising from the revaluation of property (including owner-occupied and investment property readily available to be sold), but only where that property is classified as Upper Tier 2 capital. The amount to be reported at this item is limited to 45 percent of the pre-tax revaluation reserves for this category of ARR.

Where a particular asset belongs to a class of assets for which the Asset Revaluation Reserve (ARR) are included in Upper Tier 2 capital and the asset has been identified as impaired and losses arise, the losses may be offset against any existing revaluations of the asset or class of revalued assets.

If the ARR is negative after adjustment for revaluations of assets included in the reserve, for losses due to impairment of assets covered by the reserve, and for any gains or losses on hedges offsetting revaluations of assets included in the reserve, report zero at this item.

This item is net of any fair value gains and losses, and any gains or losses on hedges offsetting revaluations included in reserves.

For the purposes of this item, do not include any ARR amounts that have been included as Capital Profit Reserves.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 Asset Revaluation Reserves Property 45 Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reserves arising from the revaluation of the Eligible Component of Investments in Associates, Joint Ventures and non-consolidated Subsidiaries, and which can be classified as Upper Tier 2 capital. The amount to be reported at this item is limited to 45 percent of the pre-tax revaluation reserves for this category of ARR.

Where a particular asset belongs to a class of assets for which the Asset Revaluation Reserve (ARR) are included in Upper Tier 2 capital and the asset has been identified as impaired and losses arise, the losses may be offset against any existing revaluations of the asset or class of revalued assets.

If the ARR is negative after adjustment for revaluations of assets included in the reserve, for losses due to impairment of assets covered by the reserve, and for any gains or losses on hedges offsetting revaluations of assets included in the reserve, report zero at this item.

This item is net of any fair value gains and losses, and any gains or losses on hedges offsetting revaluations included in reserves.

For the purposes of this item, do not include any ARR amounts that have been included as Capital Profit Reserves.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 Asset Revaluation Reserve Eligible Component Of Investments 45 Percent Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of gross Upper Tier 2 capital.

Gross Upper Tier 2 capital represents all Upper Tier 2 capital before other adjustments approved by APRA and any Upper Tier 2 capital deductions.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 Gross Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other adjustments to Upper Tier 2 capital approved by APRA. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 APRA Adjustments Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions No Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Partial Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Full Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions No Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Partial Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Full Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured With Provisions Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured Without Provisions Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements. This category excludes  property controlled under 'mortgagee in possession' rights.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures OREO Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all assets other than real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Other Assets Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, that have been newly classified as impaired during the relevant period.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Newly Impaired Amount

content.definition: This is the total value of any security held in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Security Held Amount

content.definition: This is the total value of security held in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Security Held Amount

content.definition:
This is the total value of security held in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured With Provisions Security Held Amount

content.definition:
This is the total value of security held in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured Without Provisions Security Held Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions No Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Partial Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Full Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions No Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Partial Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Full Performance Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Restructured With Provisions Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Restructured Without Provisions Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements. This category excludes  property controlled under 'mortgagee in possession' rights.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures OREO Amount

content.definition: This is the amount of any income actually received during the relevant period from all assets other than real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements.
content.name: Income Credit Exposures Other Assets Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions No Performance Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Partial Performance Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Full Performance Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any forgone received during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions No Performance Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Partial Performance Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Full Performance Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero and no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual Without Provisions Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured With Provisions Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) no specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured Without Provisions Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements. This category excludes  property controlled under 'mortgagee in possession' rights.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures OREO Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount of any income forgone during the relevant period from all assets other than real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements.

Income forgone is the difference between what the reporting party would have received had the exposure performed as expected and that income actually received.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Other Assets Income Forgone Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, as required to be reported on forms ARF_220_0_L and ARF_220_0_C.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Personal Other ARF 220 0 Amount

content.definition:
This is the number of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category One facilities, being:
(a) an exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property and is insured by an eligible lenders mortgage insurer for 100 per cent of the outstanding balance;
(b) an exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property, where the ratio of the outstanding balance, less the amount of mortgage insurance, to the valuation of the security is no more than 80 per cent (where the exposure is 6 months or more worth of payments past due, the valuation must be no older than 12 months); and
(c) an exposure that is secured by a qualifying registered second mortgage where:
(i) the ratio of the outstanding balances of the facilities secured by both first and second mortgages to the valuation of the residential property does not exceed 80 per cent, and the first mortgage cannot be extended without it being subordinated to the second mortgage; or
(ii) where the ratio of the outstanding balances of the facilities secured by both first and second mortgages to the valuation of the residential property exceeds 80 per cent, and the first mortgage cannot be extended without it being subordinated to the second mortgage, and the outstanding balance is 100 per cent mortgage insured by an eligible lenders mortgage insurer.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category One Facilities Count

content.definition:
This is the outstanding balance of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category One facilities, being:
(a) an exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property and is insured by an eligible lenders mortgage insurer for 100 per cent of the outstanding balance;
(b) an exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property, where the ratio of the outstanding balance, less the amount of mortgage insurance, to the valuation of the security is no more than 80 per cent (where the exposure is 6 months or more worth of payments past due, the valuation must be no older than 12 months); and
(c) an exposure that is secured by a qualifying registered second mortgage where:
(i) the ratio of the outstanding balances of the facilities secured by both first and second mortgages to the valuation of the residential property does not exceed 80 per cent, and the first mortgage cannot be extended without it being subordinated to the second mortgage; or
(ii) where the ratio of the outstanding balances of the facilities secured by both first and second mortgages to the valuation of the residential property exceeds 80 per cent, and the first mortgage cannot be extended without it being subordinated to the second mortgage, and the outstanding balance is 100 per cent mortgage insured by an eligible lenders mortgage insurer.

Outstanding balances should be reported net of interest and other income not taken to profit, and net of any amounts written off. For overdraft facilities and revolving lines of credit, the outstanding balance is to be reported as the total amount of the facility outstanding, and not the amount that the facility exceeds the previously approved limit. For overdrawn savings accounts, the outstanding balance represents the debit balance of the account.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category One Facilities Amount

content.definition: This is the number of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category Two facilities, being an exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property, where the ratio of the outstanding balance, less the amount of mortgage insurance, to the valuation of the security is greater than 80 per cent but no more than 100 per cent (where the loan is 6 months or more worth of payments past due, the valuation must be no older than 12 months).
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Two Facilities Count

content.definition:
This is the outstanding balance of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category Two facilities, being an exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property, where the ratio of the outstanding balance, less the amount of mortgage insurance, to the valuation of the security is greater than 80 per cent but no more than 100 per cent (where the loan is 6 months or more worth of payments past due, the valuation must be no older than 12 months).

Outstanding balances should be reported net of interest and other income not taken to profit, and net of any amounts written off. For overdraft facilities and revolving lines of credit, the outstanding balance is to be reported as the total amount of the facility outstanding, and not the amount that the facility exceeds the previously approved limit. For overdrawn savings accounts, the outstanding balance represents the debit balance of the account. The balance outstanding should not be adjusted for any collateral value.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Two Facilities Amount

content.definition: This is the number of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category Four facilities, being overdrawn savings accounts and overdrawn limits on credit cards, overdrafts and line of credit advances.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Four Facilities Count

content.definition:
This is the outstanding balance of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category Four facilities, being overdrawn savings accounts and overdrawn limits on credit cards, overdrafts and line of credit advances.

Outstanding balances should be reported net of interest and other income not taken to profit, and net of any amounts written off. For overdraft facilities and revolving lines of credit, the outstanding balance is to be reported as the total amount of the facility outstanding, and not the amount that the facility exceeds the previously approved limit. For overdrawn savings accounts, the outstanding balance represents the debit balance of the account.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Four Facilities Amount

content.definition: This is the number of accounts at the relevant date classified by the reporting party as Category One, Two, Three or Four facilities in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Prescribed Provisioning Facilities Count

content.definition: This is the outstanding balance of accounts at the relevant date classified and measured by the reporting party as Category One, Two, Three or Four facilities in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Prescribed Provisioning Facilities Amount

content.definition: This is the number of accounts at the relevant date that meet the provisioning requirements in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards, but have not been classified by the reporting party as Category One, Two or Four facilities.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Three Facilities Count

content.definition:
This is the outstanding balance of accounts at the relevant date that meet the provisioning requirements in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards, but have not been classified by the reporting party as Category One, Two or Four facilities.

Outstanding balances should be reported net of interest and other income not taken to profit, and net of any amounts written off. For overdraft facilities and revolving lines of credit, the outstanding balance is to be reported as the total amount of the facility outstanding, and not the amount that the facility exceeds the previously approved limit. For overdrawn savings accounts, the outstanding balance represents the debit balance of the account.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Three Facilities Amount

content.definition:
The percentage to be applied to the outstanding balance, or other relevant amount, as prescribed in the prudential standards for calculating the prescribed provision for Category Two facilities of the reporting party as at the relevant date..

Category Two facilities are any exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property, where the ratio of the outstanding balance, less the amount of mortgage insurance, to the valuation of the security is greater than 80 per cent but no more than 100 per cent (where the loan is 6 months or more worth of payments past due, the valuation must be no older than 12 months).
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Category Two Percent

content.definition:
The percentage to be applied to the outstanding balance, or other relevant amount, as prescribed in the prudential standards for calculating the prescribed provision for Category Three facilities of the reporting party as at the relevant date..

Category Three facilities are any exposures at the relevant date that meet the provisioning requirements in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards, but have not been classified by the reporting party as Category One, Two or Four facilities.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Category Three Percent

content.definition:
The percentage to be applied to the outstanding balance, or other relevant amount, as prescribed in the prudential standards for calculating the prescribed provision for Category Four facilities of the reporting party as at the relevant date..

Category Two facilities are any overdrawn savings accounts and overdrawn limits on credit cards, overdrafts and line of credit advances.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Category Four Percent

content.definition:
This is the adjusted balance of accounts at the relevant date that meet the provisioning requirements in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards, but have not been classified by the reporting party as Category One, Two or Four facilities.

The adjusted balance is the "Outstanding balance" (see below) offset by the amount of any collateral security held that satisfies the requirements of the relevant prudential standards, or APRA has agreed on an appropriate basis to ascribe value for security purposes.

Outstanding balances should be reported net of interest and other income not taken to profit, and net of any amounts written off. For overdraft facilities and revolving lines of credit, the outstanding balance is to be reported as the total amount of the facility outstanding, and not the amount that the facility exceeds the previously approved limit. For overdrawn savings accounts, the outstanding balance represents the debit balance of the account.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Category Three Facilities Adjusted Balance Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reporting party's holdings of its own Upper Tier 2 capital instruments, unless exempted by APRA in writing, and include any unused trading limit on these instruments, where agreed with APRA in writing.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Holdings Of Own Upper Tier 2 Capital Instruments Amount

content.definition:
The prescribed provision for Category Three facilities as determined in accordance with the prudential standards.

Category Three facilities are any exposures at the relevant date that meet the provisioning requirements in accordance with the Prescribed Provisioning methodology outlined in the relevant prudential standards, but have not been classified by the reporting party as Category One, Two or Four facilities.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Category Three Amount

content.definition:
The prescribed provision for Category Two facilities as determined in accordance with the prudential standards.

Category Two facilities are any exposure that is secured by a registered first mortgage against a residential property, where the ratio of the outstanding balance, less the amount of mortgage insurance, to the valuation of the security is greater than 80 per cent but no more than 100 per cent (where the loan is 6 months or more worth of payments past due, the valuation must be no older than 12 months).
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Category Two Amount

content.definition:
The prescribed provision for Category Four facilities as determined in accordance with the prudential standards.

Category Four facilities are overdrawn savings accounts and overdrawn limits on credit cards, overdrafts and line of credit advances.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Category Four Amount

content.definition: The prescribed provision for all facilities as determined in accordance with the prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Prescribed Provision Total Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net, or eligible, Upper Tier 2 capital.

Upper Tier 2 capital is comprised of components that are essentially permanent in nature, including some forms of hybrid capital instruments.

Net Upper Tier 2 capital represents gross Upper Tier 2 capital, net of Upper Tier 2 capital deductions and any other adjustments to Upper Tier 2 capital approved by APRA.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Upper Tier 2 Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of term subordinated debt classified as Lower Tier 2 capital.

Term subordinated debt instruments have significant deficiencies as constituents of capital in view of their fixed maturity and inability to absorb losses except in a liquidation. These deficiencies justify an additional restriction on the amount of such debt capital which is eligible for inclusion within the capital base.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 Term Subordinated Debt Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of limited life redeemable preference shares classified as Lower Tier 2 capital.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 Limited Life Redeemable Preference Shares Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all Lower Tier 2 capital instruments, other than those classified as term subordinated debt or limited life redeemable preference shares, as required to be reported in the APRA ARF_110_0 form series. Only report the amount that is eligible for inclusion at this item. This is calculated based on each instruments residual term to maturity.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 Other Capital Instruments Eligible ARF 110 0 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of gross Lower Tier 2 capital. 

Gross Lower Tier 2 capital represents all Lower Tier 2 capital before other adjustments approved by APRA and any Lower Tier 2 capital deductions.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 Gross Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other adjustments to Lower Tier 2 capital approved by APRA, including any transition amounts affecting Lower Tier 2 capital.

Additions are to be reported as a positive figure and deductions are to be reported as a negative figure.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 APRA Adjustments Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reporting party's holdings of its own Lower Tier 2 capital instruments, unless exempted by APRA in writing, and include any unused trading limit on these instruments, where agreed with APRA in writing.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Holdings Of Own Lower Tier 2 Capital Instruments Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net, or eligible, Lower Tier 2 capital.

Net, or eligible, Lower Tier 2 capital represents gross Lower Tier 2 capital, net of Lower Tier 2 capital deductions and any other adjustments to Lower Tier 2 capital approved by APRA.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net, or eligible, Tier 2 capital. 

Net, or eligible, Tier 2 capital represents the sum of net Upper Tier 2 capital and net Lower Tier 2 capital, net of any Tier 2 capital deductions.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 2 Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other Tier 2 capital deductions, as advised by APRA. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 2 Deductions Other APRA Advised Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total Tier 2 specific capital deductions. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 2 Deductions Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reporting party's capital base, representing the sum of total Tier 1 capital and Tier 2 capital, net of any deductions from capital. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capital Base Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of General Reserve for Credit Losses (GRCL), net of tax. Any deferred tax assets (DTA) associated with the collective provisions eligible to be included in the GRCL must be removed.

General Reserve for Credit Losses represents a reserve established that, as a minimum, covers credit losses prudently estimated but not certain to arise over the full life of all the individual facilities making up the business of an entity. GRCL is to be determined in accordance with Prudential Standard APS 220.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit General Reserve For Credit Losses Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provisions for impairment in relation to loans and advances receivable by the reporting party.

Loans and advances are those financial assets categorised as "Loans and Receivables" in the accounting standards, other than "Trade Receivables" and "Cash".
content.name: Assets Loans And Advances Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the past due amount (see below) of all revolving credit facilities.
          
The past due amount is calculated as:
(1) if the facility is not subject to a regular repayment schedule it is the amount that has remained continuously outside contractual or approved arrangements; or
(2) if the facility is subject to a regular repayment schedule then it is the total amount of contractual payments that remain unpaid beyond their due dates.
          
Revolving credit is a loan arrangement in which the borrowing party may repay funds on loan and immediately borrow it again up to an agreed limit.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Revolving Credit Past Due Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other past due amounts of the reporting party, as required to be reported on Part 2A on APRA forms ARF_220_0_L and ARF_220_0_C.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Past Due Other ARF 220 0 Part2A Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of provisions for impairment in relation to revolving credit provided by the reporting party, as at the relevant date.

Revolving credit is a loan arrangement in which the borrowing party may repay funds on loan and immediately borrow it again up to an agreed limit.
content.name: Assets Revolving Credit Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of provisions for impairment in relation to credit card balances receivable by the reporting party as at the relevant date.

A credit card is a card whose holder has been granted a revolving credit line up to a pre-arranged limit.
content.name: Assets Credit Card Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of provisions for impairment in relation to term loans receivable by the reporting party as at the relevant date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.

Term loans are non securitised debt financing with a specified maturity date by which the loan must be repaid.
content.name: Assets Term Loans Impairment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of provisions for impairment in relation to finance leases receivable as at the relevant date as determined in accordance with the accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Leases Impairment Amount
Assets Balancing Item ARF322 Item6_8 Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of on-balance sheet credit exposures.

A credit exposure represents an asset, liability, claim or commitment of an entity, which may be recorded on or off the balance sheet and which gives rise to credit risk.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit On Balance Sheet Exposures Amount
Assets Balancing Item Household Loans Advances Impairment Amount
Assets Balancing Item ARF323 Item6_2_5_6 Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of provisions for impairment in relation to margin loans receivable by the reporting party as at the relevant date.

Margin loans are amounts lent for the purpose of purchasing equities, where the underlying security is equities.
content.name: Assets Margin Lending Impairment Amount
Assets Balancing Item ARF321 Item5_6_10 Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of the Basel II transitional floor adjusted risk weighted exposure of the reporting party determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards. 

The transitional floor adjusted RWA amount is used to calculate the reporting party's actual risk-based capital ratio and assess whether the entity is meeting its prudential capital ratio.
content.name: Financial Risk Transitional Floor Adjusted Exposure Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of credit-related provisions for impairment.

This represents provisions on credit exposures and includes both specific provisions and the amount in the general reserve for credit losses. This amount is on an after-tax basis and is net of any associated deferred tax assets (DTA). 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting and prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Provisions Net Of Deferred Tax Assets Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of any partial write-offs of assets that form part of the reporting party's total eligible provisions. This is on an after-tax basis and net of any associated deferred tax assets (DTA). 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Partial Write Off Net Of Deferred Tax Assets Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of discounts on defaulted assets that form part of the reporting party's total eligible provisions. This is on an after-tax basis and net of any associated deferred tax assets (DTA). 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Discounts On Defaulted Assets Net Of Deferred Tax Assets Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of eligible provisions. This is on an after-tax basis and net of any associated deferred tax assets (DTA). 

This item represents the sum of, where applicable, credit-related provisions, partial write-offs and discounts on defaulted assets.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Eligible Provisions Net Of Deferred Tax Assets Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of expected losses (EL) arising from both on-balance sheet and off-balance sheet credit exposures (refer APS 113).

This item is reported for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Expected Losses Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of on and off balance sheet credit exposures.

A credit exposure represents an asset, liability, claim or commitment of an entity, which may be recorded on or off the balance sheet and which gives rise to credit risk.

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Asset Exposures Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of equity exposures and other capital investments held by the reporting party, after deducting the intangible component of the investments where applicable. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Equity Exposures and Capital Investments After Deducting Intangible Assets Fifty Per Cent Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for deposits placed on a call, 11am or 24 hours basis.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Deposits At Call Eligible Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of paid-up ordinary share capital issued by the reporting party.

For the purposes of this item, only include proceeds of share issues that have been received by the issuer. Any partly paid issue is reported only to the extent that it has been paid up; and

Ordinary shares issued prior to 1 January 1992 by way of fully paid bonus issue arising from capitalisation of property revaluation reserves are to be recorded at this item. All such shares issued after that date are to be excluded.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Paid Up Ordinary Share Capital Excluding Post 1992 Bonus Issue Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for debt securities that have been notified by the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) as being acceptable collateral in its domestic market operations, known as RBA repo-eligible securities.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Debt Securities Eligible Collateral Reserve Bank Of Australia

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for negotiable certificates of deposit (NCD). NCDs are short-term debt securities, repayable at a fixed date. The NCD trades at a discount from face value.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Negotiable Certificates Of Deposit Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all bills of exchange and certificates of deposit (both negotiable/transferrable and not) held by the reporting party as at the relevant date.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Bills CD NCD Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for deposits that are not at call but that are eligible for liquidity calculation. These are deposits that are redeemable or withdrawable by the entity within 2 business days.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Deposits Not At Call Eligible Amount

content.definition: This is the description of the individual securities that have been approved by APRA for inclusion as High Quality Liquid Assets that do not otherwise meet the requirements of the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets HQLA Other Approved Text

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the securities that have been approved by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) for inclusion as Minimum Liquidity Holdings (MLH) that do not otherwise meet the requirements of the relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Minimum Liquidity Holdings Other Approved Amount

content.definition: This is the value of all High Quality Liquid Assets as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets HQLA Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for deposits/money market loans placed with the reporting entity on a call, 11am or 24 hours basis.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits At Call Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for deposits not at call, but that are redeemable or withdrawable by the entity's depositors within 2 business days.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Not At Call Amount

content.definition: This is the value of deposits held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which are capable of being redeemed or withdrawn by depositors from the reporting party within 2 business days, with or without penalty.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits Readily Convertible 2 Days Amount

content.definition:
This is the amount by which the value of Deposit Liabilities exceeds the net value of Deposit Assets. If the Deposit Liabilities do not exceed the Deposit Assets then report zero.

Deposit Liabilities are deposits held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which are capable of being redeemed or withdrawn by depositors from the reporting party within 2 business days, with or without penalty.

Deposit Assets are the deposits at the relevant date redeemable or withdrawable by the reporting party on demand or within 2 business days. The net value is determined by reducing the deposit amount by any break costs or early withdrawal penalties that would be applied for redeeming the deposit within 2 business days.
content.name: Liabilities Deposits ARF210 Excess Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of all High Quality Liquid Assets as determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, net of the value of adjusted HQLA Deposit Liabilities.

Adjusted HQLA Deposit Liabilities are High Quality Liquid Asset deposits held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, and which are capable of being redeemed or withdrawn by depositors from the reporting party within 2 business days, with or without penalty. The value of Adjusted HQLA Deposit Liabilities is limited to the value of HQLA Deposit Assets, which are the High Quality Liquid Asset deposits at the relevant date redeemable or withdrawable by the reporting party on demand or within 2 business days. The net value is determined by reducing the deposit amount by any break costs or early withdrawal penalties that would be applied for redeeming the deposit within 2 business days.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets HQLA Adjusted Total Amount

content.definition: The value of any securitisation start-up costs and other establishment costs that are capitalised and deferred as an asset, rather than written off in the entity's profit and loss.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Securitisation Capitalised Start Up Costs Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of capitalised expenses other than those already listed on ARF_110_0_1 and ARF_110_0_2 (where applicable). This includes capitalised expenses of a general nature, such as strategic business development initiatives, and other forms of transaction costs and like costs that are required to be deferred/capitalised and amortised in accordance with accounting standards.

This item is reported as a deduction from Tier 1 capital for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with the Banking Act 1959, relevant Prudential Standards and associated Guidance Notes.

The balance of any transaction costs and like items that are capitalised and deferred as an asset must be netted off against the balance of any income deferred as a liability relating to the products giving rise to the capitalised transaction costs (i.e. only deferred costs and income in particular product portfolios may be netted). 

Any positive net balance of capitalised transaction costs must be deducted from Tier 1 capital in accordance with the relevant Prudential Standard. Any surplus of up-front fee income received over deferred costs may be added to Tier 1 capital provided the up-front fee income received satisfies the criteria set under Prudential Standard APS 111. Otherwise, up-front fee income received must not be added to capital.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Capitalised Other ARF 110 0 1 And ARF 110 0 2 Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the provisions for impairment in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving no, or only sporadic, payments.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions No Performance Impairment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the provision for impairment in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving only partial payments relative to the contractual obligations.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Partial Performance Impairment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the provision for impairment in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero; a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and the reporting party is receiving full contractual payments.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Full Performance Impairment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the provision for impairment in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where the estimates of future interest income are zero.
content.name: Financial Risk.Credit Credit Exposures Non Accrual With Provisions Impairment Amount

content.definition:
This is the value of the provision for impairment in relation to all exposures of the reporting party that give rise to counterparty credit risk, determined in accordance with the relevant prudential standards, where:
(a) the estimates of future interest income are not zero;
(b) a specific provision for impairment has been raised in respect of it; and
(c) the original contractual terms have been modified via a formal (written) agreement to provide for concessions of interest or principal for reasons related to the financial difficulties of the counterparty, rendering the facility non-commercial to the reporting party. In considering whether a facility is non-commercial, the reporting party needs to consider whether it would extend credit on similar terms and conditions to a new counterparty exhibiting similar risk characteristics.
content.name: Financial Risk Credit Credit Exposures Restructured With Provisions Impairment Amount

content.definition: This is the value of the provision for impairment in relation to all real estate acquired by the reporting party in full or partial settlement of a loan or similar facility through enforcement of security arrangements. This category excludes  property controlled under 'mortgagee in possession' rights.
