DAC = Deferred Acquisition Cost as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.  This represents the portion of acquisition costs that relate to the unearned portion of premium revenue and which are capitalised as a result.

DRE = Deferred Reinsurance Expense as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.  This represents the portion of reinsurance expenses that relate to the unearned portion of premium revenue and which are capitalised as a result.

URL = Unexpired Risk Liability as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.

Other items include anything else required under the relevant accounting standards to be included in the calculation of Net Premium Liabilities.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Premiums Liabilities Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the sum of premiums liabilities net of any recoveries, determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards (Prudential Net Premium Liabilities) plus Net Premium Liabilities after adjustments for LAT sufficiency, determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards (Adjusted Accounting NPL) .

Prudential Net Premium Liabilities relates to all future claim payments arising from future events post the valuation date that will be insured under the reporting party's existing policies that have not yet expired, net of any recoveries on those claims. The value of the Prudential Net Premium Liabilities must include an amount in respect of the expenses that the reporting entity expects to incur in administering and settling the relevant claims and allow for expected premium refunds. 

The value of Prudential Net Premium Liabilities must not include any Government charges directly imposed on the insurer such as levies, duties and taxes, and must be net of input tax credit recoveries. Also a deferred acquisition cost asset must not be reported as part of Prudential Premium Liabilities. 

The Prudential Net Premium Liabilities will be measured as the present value of the future expected payments net of any recoveries, i.e. discounted for future investment income, plus a risk margin determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards. The risk margin must be assessed at the level specified by APRA for capital purposes; this may not be the same risk margin used for other purposes.


Adjusted Accounting NPL is calculated as UPL - DE + DR + URL + TPD where:
                                                                                                                                        
UPL = Unearned Premium Liability as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.
                                                                                                                             
DE = Deferred Expenses which are any capitalised costs relating to the unearned portion of premium revenue (net of any write-downs resulting from the liability adequacy test), or relating to the deferred portion of existing outwards reinsurance arrangements (for deferred outwards reinsurance expenses), that have been deferred and recognised in accordance with the relevant accounting standards. This includes Deferred Acquisition Costs (DAC) and Deferred Reinsurance Expense (DRE) as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.  
                                                                                                                                    
DR = Deferred Revenue which are any unearned revenues (other than UPL) that represent income used to meet the costs of future claims that will arise under current general insurance contracts that have been deferred in accordance with the relevant accounting standards. This includes deferred reinsurance exchange commission and unearned commission revenue.
                                                                                                                        
URL = Unexpired Risk Liability as determined in accordance with the relevant accounting standards.

TPD = Technical Provision Deficiency recognised in premium liability valuations as a result of Liability Adequacy Test determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Premiums Liabilities Net Adjusted Amount

content.definition: This item represents the basis used by which premiums liabilities are reported.
content.guidance:
Allowable values for this item are:     
- Prudential;    
- Accounting; and   
- Mix
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Basis Used Premiums Liabilities Code

content.definition: This is the amount, as at the relevant date, by which the premiums liabilities technical provision determined in accordance with accounting standards exceeds (or is in deficit of) the net premiums liability determined in accordance with prudential standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Excess Technical Provisions Premiums Liability Surplus Deficit Amount

content.definition:
This is the probability of sufficiency used when calculating the net outstanding claims liabilities for the purposes of the statement of financial position.

The probability of sufficiency is the probability that an estimated provision will prove to be sufficient for the purpose for which it was created.
content.name: Financial Risk Probability Of Sufficiency Percent

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of net goodwill and intangible assets as determined in accordance with relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Goodwill And Intangible Assets Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all liabilities resulting from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments in accordance with relevant accounting standards. (That is, derivative positions held that represent a net loss to the entity as at the relevant date).
content.name: Liabilities Derivative Instruments Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for all assets resulting from contracts that meet the criteria of being accounted for as derivative instruments in accordance with relevant accounting standards. (That is, derivative positions held that represent a net gain to the entity as at the relevant date).
content.name: Assets Derivative Instruments Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of deferred (non current) tax assets attributable to carried forward unused tax losses as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards. For the purposes of this item exclude those DTAs related to surplus/deficit in defined benefit superannuation funds.
content.name: Assets Insurance Deferred Tax Assets From Tax Losses Excluding Relating To Surplus Deficit Defined Super Fund Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of recoveries receivable by the reporting party in relation to unpaid insurance claims other than reinsurance recoveries, net of any provisions for depreciation or impairment.

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of input tax credit associated with recoveries receivable by the reporting party in relation to unpaid insurance claims other than reinsurance recoveries, net of any provisions for depreciation or impairment.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Input Tax Credit Outstanding Claims Liability Recoveries Not Reinsurance Net Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of amounts receivable by the reporting party as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Total Amount

content.definition: Report the date the insurance premium was invoiced.
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Premium Invoiced Date

content.definition: Report the date the invoiced insurance premium takes effect.
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Premium Invoiced Effective Date

content.definition: Report 'Yes' if the reporting party provided a First Home Saver Account (FHSA) at any time during the relevant period.

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the First Home Saver Accounts (FHSA) held by the reporting party.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Amount

content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Count

content.definition:
This is the number of new First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs) opened by individual account holders and provided by the reporting party at any time during the relevant period.

For the purposes of this item exclude the number of accounts that are opened as the result of a transfer of FHSA business from another provider.

content.definition: This is the value of new First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs) opened by individual account holders and provided by the reporting party at any time during the relevant period. For the purposes of this item exclude the value of accounts that are opened as the result of a transfer of FHSA business from another provider.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities New First Home Saver Account Amount

content.definition: This is the number of new First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), held by the reporting party at any time during the relevant period, and opened as the result of a transfer of FHSA business from another provider.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities New First Home Saver Account Transfer Count

content.definition: This is the value of new First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), held by the reporting party at any time during the relevant period, and opened as the result of a transfer of FHSA business from another provider.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities New First Home Saver Account Transfer Amount

content.definition: This is the number of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed because the account holder has given the FHSA provider a notice that the holder has acquired a qualifying interest in a home.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Proceed Used For Housing Count

content.definition: This is the value of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed because the account holder has given the FHSA provider a notice that the holder has acquired a qualifying interest in a home.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Proceed Used For Housing Amount

content.definition: This is the number of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed at the request of individual account holders following a transfer to another FHSA provider in accordance with the FHSA Act.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Transfer Other Provider Count

content.definition: This is the value of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed at the request of individual account holders following a transfer to another FHSA provider in accordance with the FHSA Act.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Transfer Other Provider Amount

content.definition:
This is the number of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed as a result of FHSA business being transferred to another FHSA provider in accordance with the FHSA Act. 

This is where accounts are transferred because a provider ceases to exist or ceases to offer FHSA accounts.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Transfer Of Business To Other Provider Count

content.definition:
This is the value of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed as a result of FHSA business being transferred to another FHSA provider in accordance with the FHSA Act.

This is where accounts are transferred because a provider ceases to exist or ceases to offer FHSA accounts.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Transfer Of Business To Other Provider Amount

content.definition: This is the number of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed because the account holder has given the FHSA provider a notice that the holder has either reached retirement age or is otherwise ineligible to hold a FHSA account. Proceeds of the account are transferred to superannuation fund.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Proceed To Superannuation Fund Count

content.definition: This is the value of First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs), closed because the account holder has given the FHSA provider a notice that the holder has either reached retirement age or is otherwise ineligible to hold a FHSA account. Proceeds of the account are transferred to superannuation fund.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Proceed To Superannuation Fund Amount
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Other Count
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Closed Other Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used. This should generally be data on contributions made to accounts that existed at the start of the financial year during the relevant period.

This is the value of any other changes to the First Home Saver Accounts (FHSAs) as required on FRF_100_0 form.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Changes Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of the First Home Saver Accounts (FHSA) held by the reporting party that meet the four-year-rule in accordance with relevant FHSA Act..
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Meet Four Year Rule Count

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the First Home Saver Accounts (FHSA) held by the reporting party that meet the four-year-rule in accordance with relevant FHSA Act..
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Meet Four Year Rule Amount

content.definition: This is the number, as at the relevant date, of the First Home Saver Accounts (FHSA) held by the reporting party that do not meet the four-year-rule in accordance with relevant FHSA Act..
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Do Not Meet Four Year Rule Count

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the First Home Saver Accounts (FHSA) held by the reporting party that do not meet the four-year-rule in accordance with relevant FHSA Act..
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities First Home Saver Account Do Not Meet Four Year Rule Amount

content.definition: This is the number, during the relevant date, of investment strategy options offered to the First Home Saver Account (FHSA) holder by the reporting party.
content.name: Financial Services First Home Saver Account Investment Strategy Options Count

content.definition: This is the maximum term, expressed in months, of fixed interest investments. This refers to the maximum term of the instruments invested in by the First Home Saver Account (FHSA) provider, at any time during the relevant period.
content.name: Financial Services First Home Saver Account Fixed Interest Maximum Term Count

content.definition: This is the value of maximum exposure to unlisted assets at any time during the relevant period.
content.name: Assets Exposures Unlisted Amount

content.definition:

This is the value of investments within the investment option offered to First Home Saver Account holders, other than unlisted assets and listed equities.
content.name: Assets Investment Other FRF100 Amount

content.definition: This is the investment return, the change in unit price or crediting rate, for the relevant period.

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of  balances due to related corporations and overseas offices. This includes intra-group deposits, other accounts payable (e.g. fees and commissions payable) and debt securities issued by related corporations and overseas offices.
content.name: Liabilities Balances Due To Related Corporations And Overseas Offices Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of  liabilities other than those classifies as:
- Deposits held by the reporting party and which are redeemable or withdrawable by depositors from the reporting party, plus negotiable bearer debt securities classified as certificates of deposit; and
- Balances due to related corporations and overseas offices. This includes intra-group deposits, other accounts payable (e.g. fees and commissions payable) and debt securities issued by related corporations and overseas offices.
content.name: Liabilities Other ARF326 Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for assets generated from loans granted and deposits made. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans Deposits Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of  balances due from related corporations and overseas offices. This includes intra-group deposits, other accounts receivable (e.g. fees and commissions payable) and debt securities issued by related corporations and overseas offices.
content.name: Assets Balances Due From Related Corporations And Overseas Offices Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of  assets other than those classifies as:
- Debt and equity securities;
- Deposits and loans; and
- Balances due from related corporations and overseas offices. This includes intra-group deposits, other accounts receivable (e.g. fees and commissions payable) and debt securities issued by related corporations and overseas offices.
content.name: Assets Other ARF326 Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total reserves that have been measured and disclosed according to accounting principles. For the purposes of this item exclude the value of any asset revaluation reserve.
content.name: Equity Reserves Excluding Asset Revaluation Reserves Amount
Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Gross Other MRF120 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of Tier 1 deductions other than:.
      - Goodwill;
      - Identifiable intangible assets; and
      - Deferred tax assets (net of any deferred tax liabilities).

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Tier 1 Capital Deductions Other MRF120 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all Lower Tier 2 capital instruments, other than those classified as term subordinated debt as required to be reported in the APRA MRF_120_0 form. 

This item is calculated for capital adequacy purposes and is to be determined in accordance with relevant Prudential Standards.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Adequacy Lower Tier 2 Other Capital Instruments MRF 120 Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of recoveries receivable by the reporting party in relation to paid and unpaid insurance claims, that are current, other than reinsurance recoveries, gross of any provisions for depreciation or impairment.

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

content.name: Assets Insurance Current Reinsurance Recoverables Doubtful Debt Amount

content.definition:
This is  the value, as at the relevant date, net of provisions for doubtful debts, of reinsurance recoverables, that are current, in relation to reinsurance contracts on paid and unpaid insurance claims against the reporting party.
                                                                                                                                                       
Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

content.definition:
This is  the value, as at the relevant date, net of provisions for doubtful debts, of reinsurance recoverables, that are current, in relation to reinsurance contracts on outstanding insurance claims against the reporting party.

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Reinsurance Recoverables Net Outstanding Claims Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

content.definition:

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of recoveries receivable by the reporting party in relation to paid and unpaid insurance claims, that are non-current, other than reinsurance recoveries, gross of any provisions for depreciation or impairment.

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of recoveries receivable by the reporting party in relation to paid and unpaid insurance claims, that are non-current, other than reinsurance recoveries, net of any provisions for depreciation or impairment.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Insurance Recoveries Not Reinsurance Net Amount

This is  the value, as at the relevant date, gross of provisions for doubtful debts, of reinsurance recoverables, that are non-current, in relation to reinsurance contracts on paid and unpaid insurance claims against the reporting party.
                                                                                                                                                       
Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

Reinsurance recoverables are any amounts due to the reporting party from a reinsurer that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant prudential standards.

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is  the value, as at the relevant date, of other receivables that are non-current, as required in MRF_300_0.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Other MRF300 Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of trade creditors and accruals, that are current, including goods and services tax payable but excluding income tax payable.
content.name: Liabilities Current Trade Creditors Accruals Including GST Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of amounts payable by the reporting party on reinsurance contracts, classified current as per relevant accounting standards.

For the purposes of this item, include the net amount payable by the insurer to reinsurers or retrocessionaires where a legal right of set-off exists. This reflects the current working balance due for settlement. Include premiums payable but not yet due for payment under the terms of the reinsurance contracts and deposits withheld from reinsurers which should correspond to the recognition of DRE under prudential standards and represent the total premium payable under reinsurance contracts. Include items such as the reinsurer's portion of recoveries and salvage and commissions due to reinsurers.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Current Payable On Reinsurance Contracts Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of borrowings classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Borrowings are generally amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
content.name: Liabilities Current Borrowings Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of borrowings classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Borrowings are generally amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Borrowings Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of current provisions other than those classified as employee entitlements and restructuring costs. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Current Provisions Other Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non-current provisions other than those classified as employee entitlements and restructuring costs. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Provisions Other Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This the value, as at the relevant date, of other current liabilities as requested on MRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Current Other MRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This the value, as at the relevant date, of total other current liabilities as requested on MRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Current Total Other MRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This the value, as at the relevant date, of other non-current liabilities as requested on MRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Other MRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This the value, as at the relevant date, of total other non-current liabilities as requested on MRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Total Other MRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of amounts payable by the reporting party on reinsurance contracts, classified non-current as per relevant accounting standards.

For the purposes of this item, include the net amount payable by the insurer to reinsurers or retrocessionaires where a legal right of set-off exists. This reflects the current working balance due for settlement. Include premiums payable but not yet due for payment under the terms of the reinsurance contracts and deposits withheld from reinsurers which should correspond to the recognition of DRE under prudential standards and represent the total premium payable under reinsurance contracts. Include items such as the reinsurer's portion of recoveries and salvage and commissions due to reinsurers.

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of creditors and accruals, that are non-current, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Creditors And Accruals Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provision for non-current deferred tax liabilities, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Provision Deferred Tax Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value of the balance of the asset revaluation reserve relating to assets other than intangibles and investment in subsidiaries and associates.
content.name: Equity Reserves Asset Revaluation Other MRF300 Amount
Equity Reserves Other MRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of equity securities that are classified as current as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Equity securities are, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, contracts that evidence a residual interest in the assets of an entity after deducting all its liabilities. This includes equity securities lent or sold by the entity under repurchase agreements, where the transaction does not result in the transfer of the rights of ownership of the securities away from the entity to another party.
content.name: Assets Current Equity Securities Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of equity securities that are classified as non-current as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Equity securities are, as defined by the Australian Accounting Standards, contracts that evidence a residual interest in the assets of an entity after deducting all its liabilities. This includes equity securities lent or sold by the entity under repurchase agreements, where the transaction does not result in the transfer of the rights of ownership of the securities away from the entity to another party.
content.name: Assets Non Current Equity Securities Amount

content.definition: This is the value of property held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, that are classified as current assets, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Current Property Amount

content.definition: This is the value of property held by the reporting party as at the relevant date, that are classified as non-current assets, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Non Current Property Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the exemption category, as determined in the relevant insurance regulations, where Australian insurance risks can be placed with unauthorised foreign insurers.
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Exemption Type Code

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the Atypical exemption category by applicable risk class, as determined in accordance with the relevant insurance regulations.
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Atypical Risk Class Type Code

content.definition: This is the reason provided, as at the relevant date, for an insurance contract placed with an unauthorised foreign insurer (UFI), under the Customised exemption arrangement.
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Customised Exemption Reason Code

content.definition: This is the value, during the relevant period, of outwards reinsurance expense as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards.
content.name: Expense Prospective Outwards Reinsurance Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of subscription and membership income.
content.name: Income Insurance Subscription Membership Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of retained earnings available for appropriation in the form of a distribution to equity holders. This item is reported after transfers from reserves.
content.name: Equity Retained Earnings Available For Distribution After Transfers From Reserves Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of relevant period, reinsurance recoveries received on a cash flow basis in the current financial year, regardless of the financial year in which the reinsurance recovery may have been recognised as revenue.
content.name: Income Insurance Recoveries Reinsurance Received Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of relevant period, claims paid on a cash flow basis in the current financial year, regardless of the financial year in which the reinsurance recovery may have been recognised as revenue.
content.name: Expense Insurance Claims Paid Amount

content.definition: This is the value of remuneration expenses, other than wages and salaries, for the duration of the relevant period as determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Operating Other Excluding Wages And Salaries Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of other operating income. This item represents all income which is not associated with the generation of investment income (i.e. income that is not related to investment portfolios). This item is determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Income Operating Total Other APRA Insurance Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the central estimate component of outstanding claims liability (OCL), gross of any recoveries, determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards.

OCL relates to all claims incurred prior to the valuation date, whether or not they have been reported to the reporting party. The value of the OCL must include an amount in respect of the expenses that the reporting party expects to incur in settling these claims. The value of OCL must not include any Government charges directly imposed on the reporting party such as levies, duties and taxes, but must be gross of input tax credit recoveries.

The central estimate will be measured as the present value of the future expected payments, i.e. discounted for future investment income, determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards. The central estimate is intended to reflect the mean value in the range of possible values for the outcome (that is, the mean of the distribution of probabilistic outcomes), and so does not include any risk margin.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Prospective Outstanding Claims Liability Gross Central Estimate Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the risk margin component of outstanding claims liability (OCL), gross of any recoveries, determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards.

OCL relates to all claims incurred prior to the valuation date, whether or not they have been reported to the reporting party. The value of the OCL must include an amount in respect of the expenses that the reporting party expects to incur in settling these claims. The value of OCL must not include any Government charges directly imposed on the reporting party such as levies, duties and taxes, but must be gross of input tax credit recoveries.

The risk margin is the component of the value of OCL that relates to the inherent uncertainty that outcomes will differ from the central estimate.

The risk margin relates to the central estimate measured as the present value of the future expected payments gross of any recoveries, i.e. discounted for future investment income, determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards. The central estimate is intended to reflect the mean value in the range of possible values for the outcome (that is, the mean of the distribution of probabilistic outcomes), and the risk margin, when added to the central estimate, is intended to increase the likelihood that the OCL will be sufficient to the level required in relevant reporting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Prospective Outstanding Claims Liability Gross Risk Margin Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the outstanding claims liability (OCL), gross of any recoveries, determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards.

The OCL relates to all claims incurred prior to the valuation date, whether or not they have been reported to the reporting party. The value of the OCL must include an amount in respect of the expenses that the reporting party expects to incur in settling these claims. The value of OCL must not include any Government charges directly imposed on the reporting party such as levies, duties and taxes, but must be gross of input tax credit recoveries.

The OCL will be measured as the present value of the future expected payments, i.e. discounted for future investment income, plus a risk margin determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Prospective Outstanding Claims Liability Gross Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of recoveries, other than reinsurance recoveries, receivable by the reporting party in relation to outstanding (unpaid) claims, gross of any provisions for depreciation or impairment. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards. 

Recoveries to be included at this item include salvage, subrogation, and input tax credit recoveries, amongst others.
content.name: Assets Insurance Prospective Recoveries Not Reinsurance Outstanding Claims Provision Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reinsurance recoverables, being amounts due to the reporting party under a reinsurance arrangement that arise from the recognition of Outstanding Claims Liabilities in accordance with relevant reporting standards.  The value must be reported net of any provisions for doubtful debts.
content.name: Assets Insurance Prospective Recoveries Reinsurance Outstanding Claims Provision Gross Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the outstanding claims liability (OCL), net of any recoveries that relate to the gross OCL, determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards.

OCL relates to all claims incurred prior to the valuation date, whether or not they have been reported to the reporting party. The value of the OCL must include an amount in respect of the expenses that the reporting party expects to incur in settling these claims. The value of OCL must not include any Government charges directly imposed on the reporting party such as levies, duties and taxes.

The OCL will be measured as the present value of the future expected net payments, i.e. discounted for future investment income, plus a risk margin determined in accordance with relevant reporting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Prospective Outstanding Claims Liability Net Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of off-balance sheet exposures.

An off-balance sheet exposure are those that have not been recorded on the balance sheet of the reporting party.
content.name: Financial Risk Off Balance Sheet Exposures Accounting Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all exposures regardless of whether it has been recognised on or off-balance sheet.
content.name: Financial Risk Exposures Accounting Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the reporting party's capital base.
content.name: Financial Risk Capital Base Amount

content.definition:
Report the value, including interest and principal in arrears where appropriate, of those financial assets listed below:

- any financial assets that are created through the lending of funds by a creditor (lender) to a debtor (borrower) and that are not represented by negotiable securities, including interbank borrowings, loans and inter-office balances; 
- foreign trade-related credits; 
- holdings of international notes and coins that are in circulation
- international loans granted and deposits made on a trust basis
- Sale and repurchase transactions (repos)
- financial leases 
- promissory notes
- non-negotiable debt securities
-  endorsement liabilities arising from bills rediscounted abroad
- subordinated loans (including subordinated non-negotiable debt securities)
- Loans which have become negotiable de facto should be classified under debt securities (For doing so there needs to be evidence of a secondary market trading.)

Borrowing and lending of securities and gold without cash collateral should not be reported.

The reporting of negative positions is accepted in those cases where it is the result of the short selling of securities acquired in the context of repo or bond lending transactions.
content.name: Assets Loans And Advances International Exposures Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the traded and non-traded market risk, as determined in accordance with relevant prudential standards..
content.name: Financial Risk Market Traded And Non Traded Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of borrowings as determined in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards. 

Borrowings are amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding
content.name: Liabilities Loan Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of a credit available to a taxpayer who received foreign income that is taxable in Australia and for which they paid (or are taken to have paid) foreign tax. This amount includes credits for foreign source capital gains.
content.name: Income.International Dealings Foreign Tax Offset Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of borrowings other than finance leases classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Borrowings are generally amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
content.name: Liabilities Current Borrowings Not Finance Lease Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total other non-current liabilities as requested on DRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Total Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: Detail types of insurance (classes/risks/maximum sum insured) which are not automatically reinstated.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Types Not Automatically Reinstated Text

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provision for doubtful debts in relation to insurance and other recoveries that are classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Insurance and other recoveries may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Insurance And Other Recoveries Provision For Doubtful Debts Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other non-current liabilities as requested on DRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Non Current Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of revenue received (on cashflow basis) in respect of claims from insurance recoveries.
content.name: Income Insurance Recoveries Cashflow Basis Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for the duration of the relevant period, of the reporting party being a reporting entity under the Corporations Act.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = reporting party being a reporting entity under the Corporations Act.
FALSE = reporting party not being a reporting entity under the Corporations Act.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Reporting Entity Under Corporation Act Indicator

content.definition: Indicate if all insurances have a feature that reduces the deductible to nil when the underlying pool of funds (aggregate deductible) is exhausted.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = when the pool of funds/aggregate deductible becomes nil, the insurer pays the full claim of the member net of any member excess or franchise
FALSE = when the pool of funds/aggregate deductible becomes nil, the insurer does not pay the full claim of the member
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Feature Reduces Deductible Indicator

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of cash at bank and in hand. For the purposes of this item, include notes and coins; overnight money (deposits at call); cash management trusts; and commercial paper.

Commercial paper is an unsecured promissory note with a fixed maturity of 1 to 270 days. Commercial Paper is a money-market security issued (sold) by large banks and corporations to get money to meet short term debt obligations (for example, payroll), and is only backed by an issuing bank or corporation's promise to pay the face amount on the maturity date specified on the note.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Cash At Bank And In Hand Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other assets classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards, as required in DRF_300_0.
content.name: Assets Current Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: This is the value of claims paid on a cashflow basis during the relevant period, gross of any associated insurance recoveries.
content.name: Expense Claims Paid Cashflow Basis Amount

content.definition: This is, for the duration of the relevant period, the basis used to establish Maximum Event Retention (MER).
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Maximum Event Retention Basis Code

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it has been used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of reserves other than those classified as asset revaluation reserves. This item has been measured and disclosed according to accounting principles.
content.name: Equity Reserves Other Than Asset Revaluation Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of insurance and other recoveries outstanding, which may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries. This item is net of any provision for doubtful debts and is classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Insurance And Other Recoveries Net Amount

content.definition: This is the number of insurance claims reported, for the duration of the relevant period.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Claims Number

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of the maximum amount of a call on a member
content.name: Financial Risk Insurance Maximum Call On Member Amount

content.definition: This is the value of contribution income received in advance which is still unearned and is classified as a current liability in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Current Unearned Contribution Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of other operating income as required on DRF_310_0. For the purposes of this item exclude revenue from calls.

Calls are made by the trustee for members to pay additional insurance premiums on a wide range of circumstances such as exposure to additional risk, to cover cost of default.
content.name: Income Operating Other APRA Insurance DRF310 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total other assets classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards, as required in DRF_300_0.
content.name: Assets Current Total Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for the duration of the relevant period, that the financial statements comply with Accounting Standard AASB 1023 General Insurance contracts.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The financial statements comply with Accounting Standard AASB 1023 General Insurance contracts
FALSE = The financial statements do not comply with Accounting Standard AASB 1023 General Insurance contracts
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Compliance Accounting Standards AASB 1023 General Insurance Contracts Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of calls receivable for additional contribution revenue. This is made by the governing body to cover a wide range of circumstances such as exposure to additional risk, to cover cost of default.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Calls For Additional Insurance Premiums Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other receivables as required on DRF_300, classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Other DRF 300 Amount

content.definition: Indicate if the member discontinues cover mid term and contributions (after allowing for administration charges) are refunded to the member for the unexpired period of cover.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = in the event of the member wanting to discontinue cover mid-term, the member receives a pro-rata refund of contribution paid
FALSE = in the event of the member wanting to discontinue cover mid-term, the member does not receive a pro-rata refund of contribution paid
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Discontinued Member Refund Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of the profit (loss) before income tax of the reporting party, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Before Tax Amount

content.definition: This is the percentage of capital applied to determine the Maximum Event Retention (MER).
content.name: Financial Risk Maximum Event Retention Percentage Of Capital Percent

content.definition:
This is the indicator for the reason of modification being other than:
- Limitation of Scope;
- Disagreement with those charged with Governance; or
- Not all Australian Accounting Standards applied.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was Other than Limitation of Scope, Disagreement with those charged with Governance or Not all Australian Accounting Standards applied.
FALSE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was not Other than Limitation of Scope, Disagreement with those charged with Governance or Not all Australian Accounting Standards applied.
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Modification Reason Other Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the event exposure based on the gross sum insured amounts for any one risk.
content.name: Financial Risk Value Of Event Exposure Amount

content.definition: Description of the structure of insurance programme and where this feature applies.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Structure Description

content.definition: This is the detailed text for the basis used, during the relevant period, to determine Maximum Event Retention (MER) other than 'probability modelling' or 'percentage of capital' approach.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Maximum Event Retention basis Other Text

content.definition: Is a Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) issued to all prospective members?
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = a Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) is issued to all prospective members
FALSE = a Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) is not issued to all prospective members
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Product Disclosure Statement Issued Indicator

content.definition: This is the indicator for the duration of the relevant period, that the financial statements comply with accrual and going concern principle.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The financial statements comply with accrual and going concern principle
FALSE = The financial statements do not comply with accrual and going concern principle
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Compliance Accrual Going Concern Principle Indicator

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of expected insurance recoveries from the maximum loss event.

Maximum Loss is the largest gross loss to which the reporting party will be exposed (taking into account the probability of that loss) without any allowance for potential insurance recoveries.
content.name: Assets Insurance Expected Insurance Recoveries Amount

content.definition: Indicate if the insurance contract pays out the claim, irrespective of whether the claim is within the protection wording of the cover offered to the member for all policies.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = insurance contract pays out the claim, irrespective of whether the claim is within the protection wording of the cover offered to the member for all policies
FALSE = insurance contract does not pay out the claim, if the claim is outside the protection wording of the cover offered to the member for all policies
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Contract Pay Out Claim Irrespective Of Protection Wording Indicator

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other provisions classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards, other than provisions for dividends and employee entitlements.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Current Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of contributions receivable and deductibles receivable from members, classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards that are gross of any provision for doubtful debts. 

The contribution receivable is the contribution revenue that is receivable from members.

The deductible receivable is the excess of the amount insured that is receivable from members.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Contribution Deductible Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of contribution income received that is earned, gross of any outwards insurance expense, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Income Contribution Earned Gross Of Outwards Insurance Expense Amount

content.definition: This is the list of types of cover/products sold which members are not able to purchase from licensed Australian insurers.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Cover Products Not Available To Members Text

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of contribution income received that is earned, net of any outwards insurance expense.
content.name: Income Insurance Contribution Net Of Outwards Insurance Expense Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total cash and cash equivalents. For the purposes of this item, include notes and coins; overnight money (deposits at call); cash management trusts; commercial paper; and deposits at call.

Commercial paper is an unsecured promissory note with a fixed maturity of 1 to 270 days. Commercial Paper is a money-market security issued (sold) by large banks and corporations to get money to meet short term debt obligations (for example, payroll), and is only backed by an issuing bank or corporation's promise to pay the face amount on the maturity date specified on the note.

Deposits at call are redeemable or withdrawable by the reporting party on demand or within 24 hours.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Deposits At Call Cash At Bank And In Hand Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of insurance recoveries outstanding, gross of any provision for doubtful debts. Insurance recoveries are amounts expected to be recovered under arrangements in relation to the outstanding claims liabilities.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Insurance Recoveries Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of partially paid-up share capital issued by the reporting party, as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Partially Paid Share Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for an audit opinion of except for, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was Except for
FALSE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was not Except for
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Except For Indicator

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total other assets classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards, as required in DRF_300_0.
content.name: Assets Non Current Total Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: Indicate if annual audited financial statements are distributed to all members.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = annual audited financial statements are distributed to all members
FALSE = annual audited financial statements are not distributed to all members
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Audited Financial Statements Distributed All Members Indicator

content.definition: This is the description of the methodology used to calculate the maximum call amount, if the basis was not "specified amount" or "percent of contribution".
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Basis Maximum Call Amount Other Description

content.definition: This is the indicator for the reason of modification being disagreement with those charged with governance, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was Disagreement with those charged with Governance
FALSE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was not Disagreement with those charged with Governance
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Modification Reason Disagreement With Those Charged With Governance Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant date, of underwriting expenses other than those associated with acquisition costs. This item is to be determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Expense Insurance Expense Acquisition Other Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of contributions receivable and deductibles receivable from members, classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards that are net of any provision for doubtful debts. 

The contribution receivable is the contribution revenue that is receivable from members.

The deductible receivable is the excess of the amount insured that is receivable from members.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Contribution Deductible Net Amount

content.definition: Indicate if products are sold under a Australian Financial Services License (AFSL).
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = products are sold under a Australian Financial Services License
FALSE = products are not sold under a Australian Financial Services License
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Product Sold Under Australian Financial Services License Indicator

content.definition: This is the indicator for an audit opinion of subject to, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was Subject to
FALSE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was not Subject to
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Subject To Indicator

content.definition:
This is the number of potential beneficiaries during the relevant period.

The potential beneficiary is the party that may become eligible to receive a payment once a claim is made.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Beneficiary Count

content.definition: This is the indicator for the duration of the relevant period, that the financial statements comply with cash basis of accounting.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The financial statements comply with Cash Basis of Accounting
FALSE = The financial statements do not comply with Cash Basis of Accounting
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Compliance Cash Basis Of Accounting Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of insurance and other recoveries outstanding, which may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries. This item is gross of any provision for doubtful debts and is classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Insurance And Other Recoveries Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the detailed text for the contingent liabilities as defined by Australian Accounting Standards. Provide brief details of any contingent liabilities and any estimates.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Contingent Liabilities Details Text

content.definition: This is the indicator for an audit opinion of adverse, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was Adverse
FALSE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was not Adverse
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Adverse Indicator

content.definition: This is the indicator for the reason of modification being limitation of scope, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was Limitation on Scope
FALSE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was not Limitation on Scope
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Modification Reason Limitation Of Scope Indicator

content.definition: In the event of wind-up, indicate the recipient of the excess monies that were not needed, after satisfying liabilities.
content.guidance:
Valid enumeration values are:
Charity;
Members; or
Other.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Excess Recipient Code

content.definition: If calls can be made on members and there is a contractual obligation to pay, report the basis used for determining the maximum call amount.
content.guidance:
Valid enumeration values are:
Specified Amount;
Percent of contribution; or
Other.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Maximum Call Amount Basis Code

content.definition: This is a description of the recipient of the profits/surpluses and how those surpluses are made use of.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Surplus Recipient And Use Description

content.definition: This is the indicator for the duration of the relevant period, that the financial statements comply with Historical Cost Basis (does not take into account changing market values).
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The financial statements comply with Historical Cost Basis (does not take into account changing market values)
FALSE = The financial statements do not comply with Historical Cost Basis
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Compliance Historical Cost Basis Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of the underwriting result. This represents net premium revenue, less net incurred claims and underwriting expenses in accordance with the relevant Accounting Standards.
content.name: Profit Or Loss Insurance Underwriting Result Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provision for doubtful debts in relation to insurance and other recoveries that are classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Insurance and other recoveries may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Insurance And Other Recoveries Provision For Doubtful Debts Amount

content.definition: This is the period of current insurance cover, expressed in months,  provided by an insurer to the reporting party.
content.name: Financial Services Insurance Period Of Current Cover Count

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of calls and other receivables as required on DRF_300, classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Total Calls And Other DRF 300 Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for an audit opinion of disclaimer, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion for the relevant period included a Disclaimer
FALSE = The audit opinion for the relevant period did not include a Disclaimer
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Disclaimer Indicator

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other assets classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards, as required in DRF_300_0.
content.name: Assets Non Current Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: Indicates that the reporting party is a member of an external resolution body.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = reporting party is a member of an external resolution body
FALSE = reporting party is not a member of an external resolution body
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Member Of External Dispute Resolution Body Indicator

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of total other current liabilities as requested on DRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Current Total Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: This is the number of contributing members during the relevant period.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Contributing Members Count

content.definition:
This is the detailed text for the reason of modification being other than:
- Limitation of Scope;
- Disagreement with those charged with Governance; or
- Not all Australian Accounting Standards applied.
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Modification Reason Other Text

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of borrowings other than finance leases classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

Borrowings are generally amounts of money on loan from financial institutions or other creditors with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of insurance and other recoveries outstanding, which may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries. This item is net of any provision for doubtful debts and is classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Insurance And Other Recoveries Net Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for the reason of modification being not all Australian Accounting Standards applied, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was that not all Australian Accounting Standards applied
FALSE = If not unqualified, the reason for audit opinion modification was not that not all Australian Accounting Standards applied

FALSE = when calls are made on members over and above contributions the member does not have a contractual obligation to pay

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of contributions receivable and deductibles receivable from members, classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards that are net of any provision for doubtful debts. 

The contribution receivable is the contribution revenue that is receivable from members.

The deductible receivable is the excess of the amount insured that is receivable from members.
