content.definition: Indicate if all insurances are automatically reinstated after loss for all policies.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = all insurances are automatically reinstated after loss for all policies
FALSE = not all insurances are automatically reinstated after loss for all policies
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Automatically Reinstated Indicator

content.definition: This is the indicator for an audit opinion of unqualified, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was Unqualified
FALSE = The audit opinion for the relevant period was not Unqualified
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Unqualified Indicator

content.definition: This is the indicator for an audit opinion of emphasis of matter, for the relevant period.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion for the relevant period included an Emphasis of Matter
FALSE = The audit opinion for the relevant period did not include an Emphasis of Matter
content.name: Auditor Report Opinion Emphasis Of Matter Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of amounts recoverable in relation to an insured event.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Insurance Claims Recoverable Amount

content.definition: This is the list of types of cover (classes/risks/maximum sum insured) offered to members which fall within the protection wording and are not insured.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Types Of Cover Text

content.definition: This is the description of the balancing item other or other accident in the list of classes of business as required on the DRF_310 series.
content.name: Income Insurance Other DRF 310 Series Description

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the risk retained by the reporting party.

Risk retention involves accepting the loss, or benefit of gain, from a risk when it occurs. All risks that are not avoided or transferred are retained by default. This includes risks that are so large or catastrophic that they either cannot be insured against or the premiums would be infeasible.
content.name: Financial Risk Retention Amount

content.definition: This is the value of contribution income received in advance which is still unearned and is classified as classified as non-current liability in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Liabilities Insurance Non Current Unearned Contribution Amount

content.definition: This is the value of gross claims expenses recognised during the relevant period, which has no associated recoveries, because insurance cover has not been taken out.
content.name: Expense Claims Gross No Insurance Recovery Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, for the duration of the relevant period, of revenue earned from calls. 

Calls are made by the trustee for members to pay additional insurance premiums on a wide range of circumstances such as exposure to additional risk, to cover cost of default.
content.name: Income Insurance Calls Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of prior year adjustments, increase (decrease), to retained earnings as determined in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Retained Earnings Prior Year Adjustments Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other current liabilities as requested on DRF_300_0.
content.name: Liabilities Current Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provision for doubtful debts in relation to contributions receivable and deductibles receivable that are classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

The contribution receivable is the contribution revenue that is receivable from members.

The deductible receivable is the excess of the amount insured that is receivable from members.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Contribution Deductible Provision For Doubtful Debts Amount

content.definition: Indicate if annual audited financial statements are lodged with ASIC.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = annual audited financial statements are lodged with ASIC
FALSE = annual audited financial statements are not lodged with ASIC
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Audited Financial Statements Lodged With ASIC Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the risk accepted by the outwards insurer, as a result of insurance purchased by the reporting party to cover large individual claims.
content.name: Financial Risk Accepted Outwards Insurance Amount

content.definition: This is an indicator for the confidence level that all calls made on members will be paid in full.
content.guidance:
Valid enumeration values are:
High;
Medium; or
Low.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Confidence Level Code

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of other receivables as required on DRF_300, classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Other DRF 300 Amount

content.definition:
This is a balancing item in the list in which it is being used.

This is the value, as at the relevant date, of all other provisions classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards, other than provisions for dividends and employee entitlements.
content.name: Liabilities Provisions Non Current Other DRF300 Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for the duration of the relevant period, that audit opinion stating financial report complies with Australian Accounting Standards and Corporations Regulations and other mandatory reporting requirements in Australia.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The audit opinion paragraph states that the financial report complies with Australian Accounting Standards and Corporations Regulations and other mandatory reporting requirements in Australia.
FALSE = The audit opinion paragraph does not state that the financial report complies with Australian Accounting Standards and Corporations Regulations and other mandatory reporting requirements in Australia.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Compliance Indicator

content.definition: Details of the recipient of the excess monies upon wind-up other than "charity" or "members".
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Recipient Excess Monies Other Description

content.definition:
This is the value, as at the relevant date, of provision for doubtful debts in relation to contributions receivable and deductibles receivable that are classified as current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.

The contribution receivable is the contribution revenue that is receivable from members.

The deductible receivable is the excess of the amount insured that is receivable from members.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Current Contribution Deductible Provision For Doubtful Debts Amount

content.definition: This is, for the duration of the relevant period, the detailed text for the method used to establish Maximum Event Retention (MER) for "Other consultation" or "Other".
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Maximum Event Retention Method Other Text

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of non-insurance recoveries outstanding, which may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries. This item is gross of any provision for doubtful.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Insurance Recoveries Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the list of dispute resolution bodies that a member can lodge a complaint with.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Dispute Resolution Body List Text

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of insurance and other recoveries outstanding, which may consist of subrogation, salvage or other recoveries. This item is gross of any provision for doubtful debts and is classified as non-current in accordance with relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Loans And Receivables Non Current Insurance And Other Recoveries Gross Amount

content.definition: This is the indicator for information provided by the reporting party, for the duration of the relevant period, being based on audited financial statements.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = The information provided by the reporting party, for the duration of the relevant period, being based on audited financial statements
FALSE = The information provided by the reporting party, for the duration of the relevant period, is not based on audited financial statements
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Financial Statements Based On Audited Numbers Indicator

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of fully paid-up share capital issued by the reporting party, as determined by relevant accounting standards.
content.name: Equity Contributed Equity Fully Paid Share Capital Amount

content.definition: This is the description of the reason for the confidence level provided.
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Insurance Confidence Level Reason Description

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, of the event exposure retained by the reporting party net of any expected insurance recoveries.
content.name: Financial Risk Value Event Exposure Net Amount

content.definition: Indicate if the reporting party used an insurance broker at any time during the relevant period to place insurance.
content.guidance:
A choice of TRUE/FALSE values
TRUE = reporting party used an insurance broker to place insurance
FALSE = reporting party did not use an insurance broker to place insurance
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Place Insurance Via Broker Indicator

content.definition: This is, for the duration of the relevant period, the method used to establish Maximum Event Retention (MER).
content.name: Regulatory Disclosures Maximum Event Retention Method Used Code

content.definition: Report the value of deposits at the reporting date redeemable or withdrawable by the reporting party on demand or within 24 hours.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Deposits At Call Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for gold coin; gold bullion held in Australia and elsewhere; and gold certificates held as investments. Exclude loans repayable in gold bullion.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Gold Bullion Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for amounts receivable by the reporting party from clearing houses for unsettled exchanges of securities and derivatives. This item arises only if the reporting institution records securities on a settlement date basis as opposed to trade date basis.
content.name: Assets Cash And Liquid Assets Due From Clearing Houses Amount

content.definition: Asset backed securities are a type of debt security that are secured or supported by a pool of assets. These are transferable instruments evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. They are characterised by having a definable income stream that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity
content.name: Assets Trading Securities Asset Backed Trading Debt Securities Amount

content.definition: Investment securities are those securities, which are not Trading Securities (as defined in accordance with AASB 130 and AASB 7). These are generally securities purchased with the intent that they be generally held to maturity or held for a period of time, though not necessarily maturity (i.e. equity securities where it is not technically possible to hold to maturity).
content.guidance:
Sum all "investment securities" reporting items.                                                     
Exclude ADI's strategic investment in the equity securities of entities that are deemed to be controlled entities, associates or joint ventures, defined in accordance with AASB 127 Consolidated and Separate Financial Statements (AASB 127), AASB 3 Business Combinations (AASB 3), AASB 128 Investments in Associates (AASB 128) and AASB 131 Interests in Joint Ventures (AASB 131).
Investment securities are to be recorded in accordance with AASB.
Include all securities (stock) lent or sold under repurchase agreements. The payable due to counterparties with whom the stock has been lent or sold and from whom cash has been lodged is recorded in Securities sold under agreements to repurchase. All securities borrowed or purchased under resale agreements should be excluded. The receivable due from counterparties from whom the stock has been borrowed or purchased and with whom cash has been lodged is recorded in Securities purchased under agreements to resell.
Include holdings of debt securities issued by the parent entity, controlled entities, associated entities, joint venture entities and other branches under the same parent entity.
content.name: Assets Investment Securities Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the value of debt securities at the reporting date. These are transferable instruments evidencing a relationship of indebtedness. They are characterised by having a definable return that is not based on the economic performance of the issuing entity. The value of this item is to be determined in accordance with relevant Australian Accounting Standards.
content.name: Assets Investment Debt Securities Total Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for debt securities (both trading and investment) on the entity's books other than securities that have been notified by the Reserve Bank of Australia as being acceptable collateral in its domestic market operations which the Authorised Deposit-taking Institution has issued itself.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Not Eligible Collateral Reserve Bank Of Australia Own Issued Amount

content.definition: Asset backed Investment debt securities are debt securities consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for Investment Securities by institutions in accordance with AASB 130 Disclosures in the Financial Statements of Banks and Similar Financial Institutions (AASB 130) and AASB 7; and are secured or supported by a pool of assets. These forms of securities are usually issued by a SPV.
content.name: Assets Investment Debt Securities Asset Backed Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for debt securities (both trading and investment) on the entity's books other than securities that have been notified by the Reserve Bank of Australia as being acceptable collateral in its domestic market operations.
content.name: Assets Debt Securities Not Eligible Collateral Reserve Bank Of Australia Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the value of deposits which are not at call, and therefore not redeemable or able to be withdrawn by the reporting party on demand or within 24 hours.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Non Liquid Deposits Total Amount

content.definition: Report the value of the reporting party's claim against drawers of bills of exchange and accepted by the reporting party as at the reporting date. This item is to be determined in accordance with accounting standards.
content.name: Assets Other Financial Assets Net Acceptances Of Customers Amount

content.definition: This is the value, as at the relevant date, for the deferred fee income. It should be reported in this line item and then deducted from total gross loans and advances.
content.name: Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deferred Fee Income Amount
